Contenido: i know im quite late to the review party and everything under the sun already been both praised and scrutinized on this game however as selfproclaimed cp2077 fanboy that rode the hype train and even built my latest gaming rig to prepare for its launch yes even scoring rtx 3080 in time i feel compelled to write out my thoughts long post ahead i originally wrote more but steam an 8000 character limit bahmy first impressions massive absolutely breathtaking the first time you step foot inside night city its simply marvel to behold sprawling concrete jungle that assaults your senses with neon signs beckoning you to spend and consume the sounds and sights are very atmospheric various districts reflect the people that work and live there for example the corporate sector everyone is mostly dressed to impress from business corpos to the lavishly lifestyled other areas are more worn down grungy swirling with smog and dust gangs transients invalids and generally povertystricken folks are more prominent here industrial sectors spit out flames from their towers autonomous machinery echoing in the distance making you wonder what cybernetic creations are being built the badlands desert area is an interesting contrast to the bustling city life barren wasteland smattered with nomad clans bloodthirsty gangs and rolling sandstorms the denizens of nc are also fairly varied in shape size and cybernetics it really feels like fully functional cyberpunk city high tech and low life the main plot is fairly interesting and the inclusion of keanu reeves as johnny silverhand was nice touch the main characters you interact with are also pretty realistic looking and are animated well the story missions are decent enough however my major gripe is with all of the side content in the way it was presented lot of them involve characters just straight up bombarding you with calls when you get near certain locations you will get spammed lot and its very jarring they became bit of chore between running around waypoints and fast travel stations it was like i was playing skyrim at times rather than cdpr title the missions really needed to be more organic in nature the playstyles in this game are varied enough that it caters to most peoples tastes you can spec into guntoting maniac like and just slaughter enemies mercilessly like the terminator you can become hacking prodigy and fry the eyeballs right out of someones head stealth it up with ninja sword whatever you want its likely there there are also 3 main lifepaths that determine your backstory but they dont affect the games story much if at all you get wide selection of weapons to use ranging from traditional guns and knives to tech weaponry that uses different perks such as autoaim some weapons like turrets can only be used if you have the right perk i would have hoped for few more kinds of weapons but for the most part these do the job well if there ever was huge variety of something in this game it would likely have to be clothing there is an overwhelming selection of wearables to choose from however as is the problem in most rpgs you will often be seeking out the items with the best stats in turn if youre relying on loot which is usually the case this means your character will look like complete freak at times sport coat shiny yellow baggy pants cowboy boots and trilby hat oh boy if you go with your fashion sense instead youll get nice looking character that will practically die when the wind blows as the game progresses youll find enough loot that it will become easier to find the look you want as well as the armor but early game its hot mess they really should have included an option that some rpgs include where you can change the appearance of something you like to the stats of another item basically adopting the look but retaining the stats theres also great selection of cars and bikes to choose from many of which you can buy and own theyre very detailed inside kudos to the art team on this and you can listen to various radio stations that said the music is fairly varied but familiar enough to relate to metal glam rock rap latino techno etc unfortunately you cant own all of the cars in the game and even worse you can not modify them either this was rumored to be one of many planned features that got cut short due to time constraints hopefully it will be available in future dlc one aspect of the game i really need to gush over is the photo mode this is by and far the new gold standard for games that include this mode there are ton of options you can use to tweak photos different filters backgrounds stickers posesi probably spent about half my time ingame with this mode and ive taken 300 screenshots i really hope that other games take note of this robust system and incorporate something similar its an absolute blast performance and stability this is where it gets rather ugly theres hiding it this game is chock full of issues even 4 months after release i know lot of people are still having issues with getting decent fps rates on this game for game thats supposed to run better frames on rtx and dlss i fail to see it im running core i9 10850k 49ghz with 32gb ram rtx 3080 with all settings maxed and yet i still cant hit 60fps at times mostly it likes to run in the 50s but sometimes dips down to the high 30slow 40s i cant even imagine how it runs on lower rigsand the bugsoh man i think the longer i played the game it got worse to the point that it almost prevented from finishing the game near the end most of them werent too bad such as visual glitches but others would get stuck on objects or just get killed instantly from doing something like hopping onto counter despite multiple delays i believe cdpr just didnt have enough time to fix anything the devs were pressured by corporate to push out the product before christmas 2020 and this was the unfortunate end result another gripe i have most of the game is all style substance theres lot to behold with the sights and the details the game oozes atmosphere but theres nothing to enjoy if you want to roleplay within it the more you play the more your heart sinks when you notice the amount of features that dont exist npcs interact with odd responses that dont even qualify as typical generic ones i cant sit on bench or stool and buy noodle bowl or whatnot hundreds of doors that say locked and cant be opened arcade games that cant be played i cant even sleep on my bed properly sleeps sideways off the side of the bed you are given world to play around in but theres sand in the sandbox for something so painstakingly well made in terms of detail it hurts to know that you cant truly be part of it final thoughts ultimately i really enjoyed the game it wasnt quite what i expected from all the hype though the amount of bugs and missing content really cut short the potential it had it could have been so much better and would have benefitted from another delay of at least 6 months to year although i have played games that were much much worse than this ill definitely play this again as i need to finish my 100 achievement run but i will wait until the game is patched up and ideally once all the dlc is released despite the many flaws it had it still was phenomenal experience i enjoyed my stay in the dystopian future that is night city cruel place where nobody wins and there are truly happy endings sometimes thats just how life is and i can appreciate good game that reflects that endless thanks to the talented dev team for their hard work i hope to see more of the cyberpunk 20xx series in the future
AspectosPositivos: ['Detalles visuales y atmósfera inmersiva de Night City', 'Variedad de estilos de juego y personalización', 'Selección amplia de ropa y vehículos', 'Sistema de foto modo elogiado']
AspectosNegativos: ['Problemas de rendimiento y estabilidad', 'Presencia de bugs y falta de contenido prometido', 'Limitaciones en la interactividad con el mundo']

Contenido: 28 enero cyberpunk 2077 labor of love or broken messi was not victim of the mass hype nor the outright lies that occurred prior to cyberpunk 2077s launch i knew nothing about the game postrelease past the setting and its incredibly buggy nature hell this was my first cd projekt red game i was always interested in at least giving it shot considering it holds the title of one of the biggest pc launches of all time years later following hundreds of bug fixes and after nomination for the labor of love award now seemed like there wouldnt be better time to try it as for what i think of the game if you enjoy bethesdas openworld adventures like elder scrolls or modern fallout games play this game i think youll enjoy it infinitely more so than those games and that sentiment will probably extend to other lowerquality openworld games that have flooded the market cyberpunk may not have been what was promised at launch to this day but i think its still an enjoyable experiencehttpssteamcommunitycomsharedfilesfiledetailsid2925222522the biggest elephant in the room for cyberpunks gameplay is that its barely an rpg i have already made comparison to bethesdas openworld rpgs but the one cyberpunk is most similar to to be fallout 4 the roleplaying elements are present but fairly limited when compared to others of the genre especially when you factor in how it was advertised to excel in this way when you hear about how cyberpunk straightup lied with its marketing this is how the effects of your chosen backstory are restricted to few dialogue options and different opening cutscene your choices will matter but not for very long outside of specific character questlines and the main quest the skill trees are flooded with simple stat increases with most of the interesting upgrades being behind the various cybernetic enhancements instead there are tons of options for builds and weapons but the way the game is built encourages you to spec heavily into one weapon type and stick with it i honestly think the skill tree and leveling system could be scrapped entirely and i would find the game more enjoyable the shooting isnt all that refined either as i said earlier you have plenty of options on how to handle combat hacking sneaking going nonlethal or just going in guns blazing are just brief examples of the unique ways you can interact with enemies the problems stem from enemies not being nearly as adaptable back with the player youll fight vehicles drones mechsuits robots and various cybernetically enhanced humans but roughly 90 of combat encounters are composed of just normal people i never had to adapt my playstyle to new threat and my monowire just shredded everything i never thought to experiment with new playstyle or weapon because nothing ever posed enough of threat even though the gameplay is subpar i just could not put it downthe main selling point is actually the massive and immersive open world you have to explore the world of night city feels incredibly realistic and itll take you forever to completely run out of things to do night city is so well put together that i didnt start using fast travel until i hit the 30hour mark i was constantly pulled into the experience and the illusion was almost never shattered and its not like exploration stops at generic future city the outskirts of the map include more suburban neighborhoods and vast desert with mobile camps and raiders if you enjoy exploration you will love cyberpunk the game even rewards you for walking around the world with unique encounters sidequests gear or just the simple ability to admire the scenery i personally recommend choosing to do side jobs more than gigs because theyre the more narrativefocused quests some of my favorite encounters were stumbling into cyberpsychos that were boss fights my favorites of the bunch involved dodging sniper in the open badlands and fighting someone in mechanical skeleton that fired laser beams i dont think anything else other than the story wouldve solidified my opinion on cyberpunk the writing in this game is one of the strongest ive seen in an openworld game from the main plot to the sidequests every piece of the english language found here is delightfully put together the characters were the strongest element for personally characters that were just talking cars and vending machines have more personality than 90 of video game characters johnny silverhand is the clear highlight as the deuteragonist but that is far from saying others never stood chance of competing with him the animations and voice acting do lot to sell these characters too the themes of the plot arent limited to the standard cliche cyberpunk ones as well its not revolutionary for the genre in that sense but i still think its highlight for this subsect of fiction i personally enjoyed that each of the games endings felt like satisfying conclusion to the plot in entirely unique ways its very rare for game to have multiple endings and for one of them to not be the good ending and i adore cyberpunk for that people are going to take away vastly different message from the game depending on what you choose in the final few moments httpssteamcommunitycomsharedfilesfiledetailsid2925221345quick note the soundtrack is also really good been good to know new dawn fades and the rebel path are some of my favorites of the standard original bits but theres also large chunk of songs composed by johnnys band that are actually in the game never fade away is likely the most iconic of the bunch but its full album theres bunch of licensed music as well that you can listen to while drivingand theres something i feel that i probably dont have to mention but i feel inclined to while nowhere near as bad as its launch the game is still at bethesda level of quality when it comes to bugs while cyberpunk 2077 never crashed for i did get softlocked and experienced dozens of graphical bugs and technical glitches and for game that focuses so heavily on immersion this will pull you out of the experience every time it happens npcs faces wont load in until youve looked at ps2 model for few seconds my voice actor swapped genders for one scene only to immediately fix itself the next time i opened my mouth vehicles would float in the area on the regular one dialogue section at the very end of the game had character holding gun while using his tablet there were people tposing in the opening cutscene for s sake not only is this the patched version but this is also the pc version god help you if you played on last gen console while its amazing that the game is in playable state now it was unethical for the studio to release cyberpunk in the state that they did cyberpunk isnt labor of love out of passion its out of necessity cd projekt red shouldnt be applauded for doing the bare minimum and fixing broken product httpssteamcommunitycomsharedfilesfiledetailsid2925219285cyberpunk 2077 is far from the best rpg out there its probably not even close to the best openworld game but it is one of the most immersive games with very compelling narrative that constantly pulls you in only for the hundredth bug to immediately pull you out while it wouldve made the game less glitchy i dont think any more time in the oven wouldve make it any better there was clear conflict of interest in what gameplay genre the developers wanted to make im personally giving the game 710 i think the people arguing that this game is one of the worst out there are dead wrong but its still far from what was promised and excluding the bugs and disastrous launch im ok with that
AspectosPositivos: ['Inmersión', 'Narrativa', 'Exploración']
AspectosNegativos: ['Bugs', 'Limitaciones en elementos RPG']

Contenido: ive been playing this game to death the past few days and im really not sure if im going to go back to it cyberpunk 2077 tries to do lot but fails to do anything particularly well so im going to just breakdown different aspects and features of the game driving vehicles ill start off with mostly positive here i think the driving is pretty good i just think the main issue is the other cars on the road any time you crash into car theres good chance youll get stuck in it cars randomly swerve in front of you people seem to do this as well and the ai is nonexistent the game is best played with motorcycle as you can drive straight through traffic and it feels really nice there is absolutely reason to use anything other than motorcycle in this gamevehicles are not customizable at all and you buy them by tracking the quest in the journal menu which feels like the wrong way to do that it just felt wrong considering it only gave you 1 task which was buy x vehicle this to felt like they needed to use one of their existing systems to let players acquire vehicles and didnt want to put the time into vehicle shop of some kind which is disappointing it just doesnt fit in that menu at all stealth the stealth is by far the worst ive ever seen in any game the enemies either have eagle eyes and see you from miles away instantly or they are blind as bat and see absolutely nothing the walking patterns of the enemies look extremely random sometimes and the cameras are extremely annoying as to hack anything you need to look at it in direct sight which puts you in danger of being caughtnot to mention that when an enemy does find you they instantly alert every other enemy on the map and know exactly where you are it wouldve been way more fun if you had few seconds to fix your mistake forcing you into danger and out in the open to kill the enemy combat the combat is ok at best its nothing special enemies have such janky animations and move so randomly that youll miss 90 of your headshots with the sniper rifle and 98 of the game is shooting the same human models with different clothes and mostly the same weapons the robots rarely show up at all and act as bigger version of humans that sponge bullets rather than having unique features this is what i wanted from humans more unique abilities you have world of cybernetics and the best you can do is someone who moves towards you really fastgrenades feel useless as most enemies are never grouped together and run from place to place constantly the emp was somewhat useful although there were many times where it didnt do anything at allstorythe story felt like the highlight of the whole game but even that collapsed at the end spoilers here but i honestly felt like it was rushed at the end i did not see it coming it feels like youre at the peak and then theres one last quest and it ends quite abruptly i did 3 different endings and each time the credits rolled i did not expect it it just felt emptythe first 4 hours of the story are honestly magicalweapons items clothingim not sure how i want to critique the food items but i did not use them for the entirety of the story they just feel so hard to find and useless at the same time i have so much and thats real shame considering how much of it is all over the placea huge majority of the weapons are exactly the same it started to feel pointless to even loot enemies for weapons as i knew they would just be pretty much the same weapon there was little to variety for most of the gameas for cybernetics there really arent that many and their abilities are quite boring you get the real good ones like the double jump which as you can expect is very glitchy and hardly works then the rest are just stat increases that just arent funthe health items have almost identical icons and names and they really expect you to know the difference and strategically use them people are midcombat chances are they are just going to press x and see what happens clothing is irritating as you either choose looks or stats and go with whatever as nothing really goes together visually since i was prioritizing best stats my character at the end of the game was wearing bright yellow jacket bright blue trousers with red parts in it customizing your look was mentioned quite heavily in the gameplay trailer so the fact that you need to sacrifice serious gameplay advantages to have decent looking character is quite let downgraphicsthis is hard for to judge as there were times where the game looked spectacular and blew my mind then there were times where it looked absolutely terrible i choke the latter up to the character models and visual glitches ruining everything i think that the game could recover from this issue with patches to the gameenemy hideoutsearly in the game the most fun i had was going to all the enemy hideouts and killing them all for quick money and good loot i ended up doing these quite heavily in the middle of the game so after i finished the main story i went back to try the high and very high difficulty ones and was very disappointed first of all the enemies are scaled in difficulty almost entirely by increasing their health and damage to ridiculous proportions to the point where it just feels extremely unfair some of them i was getting instakilled by sniper rifle and you cant even stealth because the enemy breaks out the game is basically just saying you cant do these i feel as though they should have been possible if you played smart but instead they shut off every possible way of winning eg increasing ram amount for hacking to be too high making stealth kills impossible and as i said increasing health and damage to high amountsmovementi cant believe the movement is this hurrendous especially the tailing of characters i dont even know how they messed this up so badly when you follow an npc character as they are talking you will be forced to slow walk which is fine but for reason it randomly lets you sprint again at random points even when you arent pressing anything other than w and in those situations you can just sprint ahead regardlesscrouching is so incredibly slow but is still necessary to the combat so you cant just avoid doing it it breaks the pace of combat when you have to get up and down so slowlysliding is useless i have absolutely idea what purpose it serves its also very slow and you stop sliding after about 3 metres and take 2 seconds to get off the ground again it purpose in the story and combat it provides advantages eitherfunctionalityit to be said this is by far one of the buggiest games i have ever played every single one of the things i have listed so far and even things i havent glitched or bugged at some point in the game some required restarts or going back to checkpoints others were harmless but immersion breaking characters glitching through the map animations not loading cutscenes loading into the npcs camera position and being inside their head your car getting stuck in other cars motorcycles being able to ride up npcs into the air randomly standing on dynamic prop which then sends you flying 30 metres across the floor or into the air quests not loading or the digital biochip effect staying on the screen outside of cutscenes forever until you reload characters talking over each other its an absolute mess of functionality and is by far one of the worst killers of this gameit must be said that i really did enjoy the first 4 hours of this game but it suffers from the mans sky effect where the first few hours are amazing due to discovery and then you discover the reality
AspectosPositivos: ['Driving mechanics']
AspectosNegativos: ['Stealth mechanics', 'Combat mechanics', 'Weapon variety', 'Cybernetics abilities', 'Health items', 'Clothing customization', 'Graphics quality', 'Enemy hideouts scaling', 'Movement mechanics', 'Functionality (bugs)']

Contenido: new generation of openworld adventure this game is not what cdpr try to advertiseim not gon na complain about bugs glitches and performance issue because they gon na fix it eventually in the futuremy expectation for this game is not that high im expect everything that theyve said what i can or cant do in this game im playing this game on hard difficulty and go with hybrid handgunstealth hack build hard in cdpr games is not hard at all which is understandable because is not what they try to achieve anyway you can play any style that you want and dont have to worry about specific build like i need to make this build or ill having hard with the game which is great you can try any build any play style that you want i dont think you gon na having hard time in this game first off lets talk about good things in this game the graphic is great even tho i dont actually care about graphic in game that much world design is so good its so detail each district unique environment that you can tell the different from each districts that youre in main characters model and animation looks really good how they are moving around and talk to you well wout the bugs and glitches ofc im try not to talk about it btw lol the story and narrative is really good the writing and the dialogues in this game it make immersive in the story it might be even better than the withcer 3 photomode is probably the great additional to this game cause i spend time in photomode more than shooting in this game ok that might be over exaggerated but its kinda true tho the soundtrack is really good you know what the soundtrack the banger i have to recommend these few track its so good the rebel path scavenger hunt мусорщики never fade away samurai cover this one is the best song in the game for johnny silverhand might not be the greatest character in video games but is one of the good thing in this game voice acting is cdpr standard what is that mean its mean the voice acting is greatnow lets talk about what i dislike about this game character creation is really limited the openworld aspect of the game i know this game is not sandbox open world but if you gon na advertise the game about being immersive in openworld adventure game but you couldnt get this right then thats the problem in the trailer said something like looks is everything in night city and there are some of dev interview said something about npcs will comment or react to your looks in night city which it never happen to btw in 2077 we dont have barber shop and tattoo shop really what about cosmetic cyberware nope we dont get that in this game either i think they can add this in to the game later but for now this is the problem for you cant customize your character after the character creation which is pretty to npcs ai doesnt have routine they just walking around mindlessly wow so immersive they dont react differently every npcs will run away or scare when you shoot gun in the air one try to fight back or act different than this it make the world feel hollow car ai i mean you can find lots of footage on youtube compare npcs ai react to you in this game vs other openworld games the enemy ai is too easy i know i made point that is good for you to create your build but it doesnt to be too easy tho when you stealth the ai its so stupid and the hacking mechanic made it even easier tbf i cant blame them for the game become too easy when im stealth because lot of openworld action games that have stealth as an option most of them never get it right cause the main focus is the combat enemy ai they dont have any tactic to fight the player theyre main 4 type of enemy in this game theyre 3 human type and robot type or was it an android i dont remember actuallyhuman melee range and netrunner robot melee and range is not so different from these type of games although they can quick dash in this game the most interesting one would be netrunner that try to hack you to make your system overheat to deal with them you need to find them and interrupt the hacking before they can successfully hack you but when ai is too easy is not hard to deal with the combat and gunplay is mediocre its nothing new which is fine i dont mind it its better than fallout 4 tho i think cause i remember that i dont like gunplay in that game that much gangs of night city this is the one thing that they promote it as if its main thing about this game in the main story i dont feel like they matter at allonly voodoo boys important role in the story but i wish there were more i dont to get too much into the story but there are so little about them they have lore and character design and everything for them but never use it to full potential which it really disappointed and i wish when you fight them in combat i wish they fight differently from each gang but nope they fight the same way in every gang loot system is boring im not an expert or game dev or anything i just feel is boring thats all and i dont have any idea why and how to make it fun to loot rpg system oh please its kinda rpg i dont know actually maybe because the skill tree doesnt actually offer anything new most of them are just increase 10 damage which is boring tbh i think far cry 3 skill tree better unique skill to offer to players more than this but yeah i know this is an rpg games not openworld sandbox crafting and upgrade mechanic is really pointless in my playthrough and the game never encourage to use it even if you play as techie build is still not that good cause you will find new item that is better than your anyway i could be wrong with this one i might need to do another play to go full techie build but for now i dont feel like it ui is hard to navigate especially the message window and there are many vehicle for you to buy in this game and it will add to your mission log but it doesnt show picture of vehicle which is pretty annoying that i have to go through all message window to figure it out which one is the car that i want to buy why cant i buy vehicle from anywhere in the map why do i have to go to specific location this is 2077 life path this is the thing that i really disappoint about this game first when they show to us that life path is the key for multiple playthrough well is that true nope its the same matter life path that you choose vs character heshe is the same person doesnt matter which life path you choose although there are some unique dialogue depends on life path which is feel great when its there but it doesnt change anything that much in the story dialogue choice just like life path it doesnt change anything much you just choose for v to say something different form other choice that you have but it doesnt impact or change anything your action will impact the world around you yeah right when defeat the boss in the story there will be an option to spare or kill the boss which most of them are pointless cause you will never see them again in the story your ending choice will available from what side job have you done which is not bad but i think it choose include the dialogue choice during story to impact ending option as wellsummary i dont hate this game this game is good game wout performance issue rn ofc but it still not the game in trailer that cdpr keep pushing hype with night city wire and i dont want to add more thing into the list cause its gon na more nitpicking from i would still recommend this game even with many flaws i have with it wait for the game on sale and more stable than what it is rnso i give this game 25 its fine game but its not the greatest

Contenido: well i did it i finished soulstype game am i glad i did it yes i think so would i go back and do it again if i could probably not not for very very long time anywaysseriously its obviously wellmade high quality game but man does it have some issueswarning this review is more of vent than anything i actually do think its decent game just not worthy of the hype its garnered the combat is based almost entirely around timing and learning enemy attack patterns this isnt problem in and of itself the right kind of player would love learning the precise time to press space against each kind of enemy however i am not that kind of player i like to play basebuilder type games and occasionally mix in some hackandslash rpg and shooter titles when i dont feel like thinking too hard if im going to put in effort to master game i like to do it by planning my moves ahead of time and experimenting with the tools im given not by mastering each inthemoment microtwitch movement if youre like and flipflop between games like team fortress 2 and factorio id recommend staying away from this onehowever i think that the timingbased combat where one of the games first huge problems rears its ugly head for game so heavily based on timing and careful movement it some awfully laggy inputs dodgeroll one of the most important moves in the game delay on it about half second between when you press the button and when your character even starts to move in the middle of this games tightly timed fights thats huge it took hours upon hours of wondering why dodging felt so bad before i realized what was going oneafter looking at some online guides i learned that this delay is apparently part of every souls title and that most players simply consider mastering it to be part of the challenge i suppose theyre right but think about it anyways significant portion of this games challenge finds its source in intentionally poor laggy controlsim also not sure that the developers ever heard the phrase quality of life when designing this game there are all kinds of weird inconvenient things in this game that simply defy explanation why arent the allimportant health and mana potions bound to unique key why can we only use the special effect on our righthand when we can just briefly unequip it to use our lefthand weapon why do equippedbutunused weapons add to your carry weight if youre quick with the menus its perfectly possible to keep your auxiliary weapons hidden in your inventory and then only equip them when needed so why make us deal with the carry weight issue is rapidclicking through menus supposed to be another combat skill we masterand i think i would be amiss if i didnt point out the poor early gameplay progression of sorceryintelligence charactersi picked the astrologer starting class since i felt like playing spellslinger i booted into the game and started looking for better gear but nothing i tried everything i could think of i followed the path the game sent down nothing i headed east to the higher level area new spells new staffs still nothing it was beyond the twenty hour mark that i finally got new staff as random drop from an enemy in the high level area and it was garbage literally worse than my starting weapon unless you happened to be using one or two ultraniche rock breaker spells and i only found them found those hours and hours later stillit was only when friend clued in to their location that i was finally able to get my hands on some better spells although they were actually pretty close to the starting area theres nothing directing you there if you happen to miss the one particular set of ruins where the vendor is hiding youre screwed new spells for ageseven then it was probably past the fifty hour mark that i finally found staff able to replace the starting staff which by then i had upgraded to be better than most nonunique staffs and hours more before i hit the minimum level to use itlet emphasize something my friend told where to get better spells i started this game determined not to look at the wikis i tend to be really bad about that using wikis to look up secrets however this was not the game with which i should have made that resolution because to paraphrase that same friends words this is game meant to be played with the wiki open on second monitornow we reach the crux of the games design flaws this entire game is made of secrets like seriously im not sure that its possible for single player to complete single side quest in this game without looking up instructions on the wiki at least not without spending hours upon hours upon hours scouring every last corner of the map for the next arbitrary npc location and talking with every character second and third times to make sure that some new dialog option hasnt appeared even characters who supposedly actively want your help will barely tell you what they want or even why you should help them eg one character upon first meeting will ask for your help in her war against the erdtree at this point in the game i still barely even knew what the erdtree was other than really tall and glowing there is option to ask her why she wants war against the erdtree or how even her cryptic assassinations quests help to combat the erdtreethat character was nothing but small contributor to what i consider to be the games single biggest problem this game is so cryptic so utterly and incomprehensibly obtuse and obsessed with secrets that i dont think i could have told you what the plot was had i not read it on the wiki everything else i could have forgiven if the story had just yknow made sensewhats your characters motivation when you start the game you are greeted with cutscene instructing you to become elden lord why who is my character why did they just wake up in this temple was the voice in the cutscene something my character experienced as far as i can tell this is the story of some psychopath who wakes up and immediately goes on rampage killing half the remaining lucid people in this undead wasteland and subjugating the other half part of the fun of an openworld game is supposed to be learning about the world meeting its people and seeing how they live in elden ring though the world seems to be nothing more than setpiece pretty backdrop while you ride between dungeon to boss fight to dungeon there are people who like this stuff lore junkies who will spend hours making crazy theory videos on youtube however if after playing through whole game i cant identify any motive other than go kill stuff and get stronger so you can sit on the chair next to the big tree i think there might be problemthe games problems can be summed up in one fight maliketh apparently you fight him to get something called destined death what is that its never explained cryptic lore moves incredibly fast and your attack windows are comically slim janky timings forget malenia this is the real hardest boss in the game however theres secret item that exists specifically to fight him youd be lucky to find the item without going to the wiki and looking it up and even if you did find it youd be hardpressed to figure out how to use it wiki on other screen kills you quick fights tend to last less than minute however the nearest respawn point is thirty second walk away there is reason it couldnt have been right next to the boss door it didnt add any challenge all it did was make the boss take longer quality of lifetldr if you just want to git good at fighting big bosses in pretty landscape this game is for you otherwise maybe dont believe the hype
AspectosNegativos: ['Problemas de control y lag en la jugabilidad', 'Dificultad para progresar con personajes de hechicería/inteligencia', 'Falta de claridad en la trama y motivaciones de los personajes', 'Excesiva dependencia de wikis externas para avanzar en el juego']

Contenido: the short i didnt really think what everyone was clamoring for was the ubisoftification of dark souls the long prosjump buttonmusichorse combat mostlyfunaddictiveconsshockingly laggymovement is jankthe world seems very emptystamina consumption feels randomgraphics are often ugly and washed outditches many of the better systems from previous gameswalked back some of the better ideas from the network testsflailingyou need the wikiwhere did my legs go why did my monitor stop working it crashed again mostly its dark souls 3 but bigger and with extra tat tacked on and yet somehow the whole thing feels bit cheap its big mostly empty open world with dodgy traversal mechanics the few hours i played were mostly hiding in bushes collecting flowers the new sneaking around can be fun in an assassins creed way but in the one camp i found enemies tend to be in line of site of one another and the backstab is slow enough to leave you open from what little i saw you cant really build character around stealth before too long i found gatehouse where the archer can spot you through cover and bosses boss adjacent monsters really wont let you get away with it like in the aforementioned ubisoft sandboxes really the game is done favors comparing it to assassins creed as its often very ugly game assets pop in creatures disappear and all the colors feel very washed out thats not uncommon for from software games but from the character creation screen it looked like marked improvement over ds3 sadly in game models are low rez with larger ones having hard corners that show the limited poly count many assets seem to be copy pasted giving the whole experience very cheap feel not helped by the fact that the prolog is slideshow makes wonder what could be causing all the lag i dont mind dyeing in souls game but when lag keeps killing im gon na be bit cross its very odd too i have pretty high end pc and can run much much better looking games on ultra without issue the early on supposed to loose fight bugged out so badly that the thing faded to black before i took any damage it stayed that way long enough that i thought it had crashed until i saw the loading symbol for an uncomfortably long time that alone would be an issue worth waiting for patch to buy but the controls are janky too there didnt seem to be analog sensitivity adjustment so had to keep switching out controllers until i found one that didnt interrupt walking across the room in straight line how could this have happened they nailed this before yeah so the elephant in the room here is sekironot just sekiro but well get to that traversal stealth and combat improvements miles above any of the souls games were all there but they ditched them for some reason im not saying we needed grappling hook but why make the jumps so awkward and imprecise all the low ledges and walls seem to encourages jumping but its very unclear as to what can be vaulted over like sekiro it does embrace the idea that movement doesnt consume stamina sort of it does when youre in combat though that can be somewhat academic due to the poor stealth system and other factors i couldnt place sekiro also nailed parrying blocking and dodging and by that i mean they were balanced enough so that they were all useful the perilous attacks system was spectacular way to engage foes unlike most soulsborn games you really had to parry yet for some reason we are for the most part back to dark souls 3 style block dodge and parries so inexact your better off not bothering reviews keep saying its culmination of all from software learned but its seems more like picknmix of middling ideas even if you didnt want to pull from sekiro for the combat why ignore the other games the only presence from dark souls 2 seems to be the double weapons nice to have but hardly that games best feature they seem to keep doing this dark souls was great for its time but dark souls 2 and bloodborn greatly refined the formula yet dark souls 3 seems to have contained none of what made those games better and here again here as in ds3 we are awash in samey weapons i though bb taught you dozen well designed weapons are better then way way too many swords parrying especially needed to look to these three titles ds2 made nigh everything parryable and gave you big window to counter bb made parrying at range possible and sekiro made it fluid enough that it was always strong option here were back to ds3s parrying is here but blocking or dodging is still more viable in truth this game is proof to they failed to learn from themselves but theyre not even looking to what their peers have done during the network tests leveling strength gave you the ability to wear heavier armor as in the nioh gameswhich let mutable stats dictate this but they switch it back to only endurance granting more carry weight why it makes more sense for the strength based character to have heavier armor strength scaling weapons often have slower windups and longer punishes as result you may have to soak hit to land blow it was good idea it had been proven to work in other soulslike games and they cut it out on that note wheres the rallying system got to that was such great feature ive seen it crop up in many other games is it hidden somewhere in this overstuffed mess i could go on i played this game for about five hours and while it felt longer than that i dont think i really got anywhere in point of fact i think ive already gone on too long but its all kind of moot as my primary issue is that its just kinda boring i mean havent we been here before ive never started new from software game and within hour im reaching for podcast i want more sekiro more bloodborn heck id even take more dark souls 2 but just dont want whatever this is update after many hours i did get into it the horse combat helped as it is largely very fun but everything comes with caveat the mounted sections are good until you get arbitrarily knocked off your alpaca now that is admittedly annoying but whats worse is theres nothing you can do about it theres barding you can equip on your beast and while the game says putting points into dexterity helps keep you from falling off im at 60 dex and i dont see much difference also it would only sort of mater if there was huge difference as you cant as far as i can tell actively do anything to increases your fluffy friends hp getting knocked off your horse is often instant death as you just lie on the ground for an age waiting to be mauled its not unlike youve had the controller torn from your hand and it is held out of reach until you are ether killed or are obscenely low on health and just to put cherry on the alpaca manure sunday when your fine beasty does inevitably die you have to use health potion to revive them by way of menu prompt asking are you sure you want to bring your only chance of survival back from the dead at the megger cost of one of your many easily replenished items yeah im pretty forking sure elden ring except dont bother because i died battling with your superfluous text box again keeping with caveats the bosses are often quite fun despite their copy paste nature but some just wont let up id say learn their pattern but that only maters if they ever take break dark souls 2 got critisised for having too many foes per encounter but ill take that over half of them having hyper combo by far your best option is to find your favorite utterly broken spell consumable ash of war etctheres shortage and use it as crutch when the game decides to change the ru

Contenido: upon booting up elden ring youre immediately given glimpse of what is to come through the brilliant soundtrack starting off with few disparate calm strings the main theme slowly morphs into an epic melody of grandeur valor and unrelenting ambition despite having already heard this track in trailers i was blown away shattered even i knew i was in for something special blissful explorationwhereas previous soulsborne titles had you trudging through claustrophobic sewers and maddening towns elden ring is far bigger more ambitious adventure reaching across numerous regions the lands between are massive and filled with things to discover even after 20 hours i was still finding new things in the first area perhaps i had missed cave tucked away in canyon or failed to peruse nearby forest once i even stumbled upon an expansive underground area that you could easily miss its magical really much of the wonder comes from the design ethos gone are the myriad of question markers and intrusive quest logs you would find in other titles instead replaced by something as simple as your own curiosity fromsoftware uses this as tool to compel you forward when you see fort in the distance you will feel urged to go there and the best thing is that it was you and not the game that decided so elden ring relies on your participation and i love that httpssteamcommunitycomsharedfilesfiledetailsid2790286880as you traverse these lands its hard not to be impressed by the topography uneven hills and deep gorges combine to create world that can not simply be navigated by holding down your left joystick its gargantuan structures serving not just to undermine you but also as waypoints on your journey it made realize how flat and easygoing the landscapes in open worlds often are in the lands between even the geography is your adversary constantly bending and defying rules my first 30 hours with elden ring were some of the best ive had in gaming and i was ready to name it fromsoftwares magnum opus but then realization dawned wait havent i seen this church beforethere are many reasons to love the soulsborne titles but one of them is the handcrafted quality that permeates throughout every corner of the world feels like it was designed with specific purpose in mind one that you would probably understand through your ponderings and each encounter offered new challenge these were games that not only encourage you to explore but also feature enough secrets to warrant doing so this still rings true here but for every two surprises there was moment of utter disappointment reused structures and bosses are frequent to the point where every foe not overtly important to the narrative will be fought multiple times it also undermines the sense of discovery since you can only happen upon so many identical dilapidated churches before you wonder if its worth it this is truest for the many dungeons and caves they all have the same visual identity and rarely differ in terms of enemies and i have hard time naming just one of them since they all blend into one large portion of copypaste tedium eventually i began looking at these as optional bonus levels rather than integral parts of the world and honestly i think that is the best approach it is also in this repetition that the developers misunderstand what made their bosses so special in the first place like telling joke these encounters require careful buildup harrowing walk through town gone mad or slowly making your way up castle the bosses were never the main attraction they served as final sendoffs stages of thrilling and heartpounding action to juxtapose the relatively quiet exploration this still applies to the linear locations but once you step into the open world miyazaki starts hurling bosses at you like hes kid training for sports match thats not to say the boss fights are bad when you come across one of the more sophisticated fights and composer yuka kitamura starts sending symphonic shockwaves through your ears this game is delightful with few exceptions the mandatory encounters are consistently astounding and satisfyingly grueling rounded off by exquisitely rich and repulsive visual design these moments are truly special httpssteamcommunitycomsharedfilesfiledetailsid2790285862elden ring keeps on going just when you think youve seen it all it turns out theres still another half of the story left had it featured enough content to sustain this length it couldve been monumental achievement unfortunately that is not the case theres an entire region where the only unique foe is the boss at the end the rest being awkwardly recycled enemies and one of the best places in the game suffers from similar issueyet i cant help but love elden ring for weeks i was enthralled by its world and when i wasnt playing it i was thinking about where to explore next or how to approach the boss i was stuck on when i present these criticisms of the game its not because i despise it its because i care had this been disappointment i wouldve just shrugged and thought little more of it beauty and hostilitythrough the lands between fromsoftware toys with an interesting dichotomy while the landscapes are gorgeous and downright breathtaking they are far from safe mercenaries in tattered armor oversized crustaceans draconian soldiers the size of giants and even living jars everyone and everything is out to kill you even if there arent many enemies specific to one region there are still plenty of creative enemy designs the open world also gives you lot of freedom in how you approach these you could sneak your way through an enemy camp get up close and personal with comically large greatsword or ride in on your horse slashing wildly at anyone in your way this makes the notorious difficulty far more approachable and id imagine that more people will finish the game because of it the combat system itself is akin to dark souls 3 but there are enough additions to make it not feel worn out and dreary sekiros posture system where an enemys stance can be broken to leave them vulnerable been subtly integrated the enemies dont have wavering stamina bars over their heads but this means you arent pressured into style of play the stance mechanic is there you can use it if you want but it can also be ignored entirely httpssteamcommunitycomsharedfilesfiledetailsid2790286283when combined the stance system and guard counter result in battles coming across more as duels than the old hitandrun affair there were times where i had to run away either to heal or get break from the heat of battle but i spent considerably more time facing my enemy headon you could argue that not enforcing these improvements leads to some players resorting to the triedandtested tactics but i like the freedom it brings another enemy you will face is the performance while the game runs at 60fps most of the time there are some drastic problems with frame pacing and stuttering i didnt find it too distracting but those on lowerend pcs might be more affected its hard not to compare elden rings selection of enemies and locations to previous fromsoftware offerings but part of believes we should look at it through different lens for while it is like these in certain departments its also title that seeks to provide different experience one much more flexible in its design contours and of much grander scale rather than scold it for the ways it compares we should appreciate it for the ways it differs visit cup of thoughts for subjective reviews with touch of personality
AspectosPositivos: ['Brilliant soundtrack', 'Epic world design', 'Engaging exploration', 'Satisfying boss fights']
AspectosNegativos: ['Reused structures and bosses', 'Recycled enemies in certain regions', 'Performance issues']

Contenido: my review of cyberpunk 2077so ill start off by saying that i am huge fan of the witcher universe and especially the witcher 3 ive read the books and thoroughly played the game i was big fan of the company behind it as we all know cdpr naturally i was looking forward to cp2077 almost 8 years in development constant updates and promising future i was skeptical for the first delay but decided to allow it i told myself that as long as the game was polished and perfect id wait morethe first sign of problemsthe game was delayed again and although they did upload an email of sorts explaining the reasoningi knew something was up they upbig time they didnt manage the time well and there was something going on that we didnt know about spoilers performance issues and unpolished features then it was delayed third time so i was 100 sure they were running out of time main problemscyberpunk 2077 was supposed to be game in bustling metropolis of the futurea true next gen experience with many many features amazing graphics story great sidequests and features like inviting your friends over or having interesting interactions with npcs at least thats what we were promised the game arrived full of problems i am not just talking about the insane amount of bugs performance issues especially on consoles but the lack of an actual ai system and immense lack of other features like indepth character customization replayability ability customization different outcomes depending on background and of course ingame relationships with other npcs such as friendsaithe ai is by far the worst ai i have ever seen in aaa game the npcs spawn right in front of you out of thin air and disappear the same way that is not by any means the intelligent next gen ai we were promised where are the routines and daily lives of the citizens of this city rdr2 did it and is considered an old gen title not next gen like cp2077 was supposed to be the ai is so stupid i cant even put it into words i feel like im playing cheap imitation of game the police just spawn wherever you are even on rooftops its so disappointing i am very confident even an inter programmer could make better ai system than this sorry excuse all in all i would give the ai system 310 merely because there is one to begin withcharacter customizationthe character customization is once again feature we were promised with great detail especially we would be able to fully customize our characters to fit our ideal model what we were given was generic customization menu we were just given some options we could select hairstyle eye color hair color beards thats about it it is not indepth at all to add to that you rarely even look at your character ingame even if you did there are barbers in night city in case you want to change the way you look feature that the witcher 3 game created 5 years ago on top of all this the clothing in this game is meaningless everyone just selects the clothes with the highest stats making them practically useless next time you open this game take look at your character you probably look like clown that ran away from the circus because the higher level you become the better the drops are and frankly im very disappointed once againreplayabilityat the moment i have 58 hours in the game and feel need whatsoever to replay it i went with typical netrunner build because i found it interesting i feel like ive experienced almost everything this game to offer in terms of combat at the starting levels i was forced into using guns like assault rifles and even played with the melee weapons to see how they felt until my netrunning abilities improved because it is lategame build during that time i experienced the combat the way other builds would the gun play is so boring you just spray into the enemies until they die the other builds just have better damage in terms of numbers the only fun gun i actually used was the revolver while doing stealth the melee weapons are the same you just spam mouse 1 until the enemy dies there is real skill or interesting aspect and before you ask about mantis blades and such they are the same as other melee weapons you just smash your buttons until the enemy dies i wouldnt call this replayability because it just simply doesnt have anything unique to provideabilities buildsas noted previously the abilities were also disappointing at least in the netrunning section apart from some hacking abilities that did different types of damage there was pretty much nothing else all the upgrades are just number changes the feature of enemy weakness isnt even needed personally i just spammed my hacks until all the baddies were dead showing indifference towards their weaknesses played on hard difficulty i wish i am wrong about this but i feel like even the other builds have similar problem you get more attack speed more damage more critical chance and damage and thats about as far as abilities gobackgroundthe background of choice does in way affect the gameplay all you get is meaningless dialogue options that do not change any part of the story there are unique skills abilities or characteristics unique to backgrounds its just another meaningless option you select at the beginning of your game does not even affect romance optionsleisure activitiesthis game is supposed to be situated inside city of course and notorious at that night city night city is dead on the inside there is nothing interesting to do in gta v you can go for tennis go to the casino go play golf watch movie and many many other activities cyberpunk 2077 zero activities outside of side quests and even the sidequests were few compared to the witchers 3 sidequests that were even in my opinion more interesting at times than cyberpunksthe good things of this gamethere are some things in this game that i did actually find enjoyable though firstly the music is amazing i loved the songs samurai did which were actually from band called refused the music really fits the setting and i think its one of the few things they got rightthe story was also alright i did not find it amazing but i liked it the events were well knitted into one another and the endings were not what everyone expected spoilers aheadthe sad endings of our story is something i will remember they were really really well done and took by surprise the story of jackies death and us trying matter what to survive was interesting to say the least becoming data inside mikoshi or living our last months either with panam and the aldecaldos or staying in night city are not the endings i had anticipatedi think i will remember them for long timebut that is as far as the story will take it the city feels deadconclusionwhile i had some expectations i was careful not to fall into the hype train i anticipated for the game to be good experience with the necessary features that were promised to make this experience good we were given sorry excuse of game after 7 months of delay cdpr presented an unfinished game with lots of issues do not fool yourself and blame the programmers and developers they have been in cruch for over year the witcher 3 had the same issue and honestly its shame that in 2020 workers are forced into such inhumane situtations to those defending the developers because gamers couldnt wait you are fool at best we were lied to again and again only to be disappointed in the end if you can enjoy this gamegood for you but for and many others this is something i can not forgive so easily wait for improvement before buying
AspectosPositivos: ['Música']
AspectosNegativos: ['IA', 'Personalización de personajes', 'Rejugabilidad', 'Actividades de ocio', 'Habilidades y construcción de personajes']

Contenido: the effort it takes to enjoy cyberpunk 2077 is monumental nothing in cyberpunk 2077 stands up to anything but the most cursory scrutiny you wind your way through lively city streets packed with vendors but the one ramen shop that is functional sells you the same equivalent of caprisun and hot pockets that you can get from vending machines night city taxis mass transit or public transportation of any kind available to the player despite mission and an incredibly annoying side job prominently featuring the most luxurious taxi service eurodollars can buyat best theres conspicious hole where any player would expect function or feature at worst it becomes unclear why some systems were implemented at all the only mystery is whether it was poorly conceived or poorly implemented whether the feature was too ambitious to include from the start or whether out of sunkcost fallacy it was abandoned instead of removed altogether as it should have been and these strangenesses blend into oneanotherfor instance every single drink can be turned into crafting components but not any food and to do so means selecting each functionally identical soda and recycling them harrowing idea when you first open the easilyignored backpack icon tucked away in the corner of the inventory screen and realize youre carrying varying amounts of sixty different beverages with way to do this in bulk the game does offer you the ability to sell all your junk items masse but not the ability to mark anything as junk feature thats been offered in every other game to come before it where stream of slightly higher numbers cycles its way through your equipment furthermore an early perk automatically disassembles any junk items you pick up permanently obselescing the sell all junk feature anyway is this two halfbaked ideas or one attempt at userfriendliness rendered inconsequential by hasty later addition which one is whichthe game and setting are highly concerned with appearances but yours isnt customizable in the least outside of character creation not hair not makeup and certainly not clothing clothing is the entirety of vs protection and comprised almost entirely of what you gather from the corpses of the gang members that the police pay you to summarily execute an act that gives you street cred somehow which understandably vary wildly in quality and character if you find particular article of clothing that you really like the look of then you can upgrade it with components but at higher and higher amounts that quickly outstrip the cost of buying better equipment altogether its hard to find what armor does or tell meaningful difference so maybe the point is moot anyhow the key for reload and pick up the weapon im looking at it are the same meaning less than once every other fight does my mercenary decide in the middle of combat to trade their favorite shotgun for revolver lying on the ground that absolutely perks for annoying for sure but insufferable when i have to go to my inventory and reequip that shotgun every time it could be worse they could have had v drop it instead dangerous proposition when gun can be plainly visible but unable to be picked up except from specific position or angle or until giving up on what amounts to just one more assault rifle to sell to the nearest food stand that also buys secondhand firearmsas for the story cyberpunk 2077s narrative inconsistency of tone only exacerbated by its structure depending on which jobs you take and in what order you complete them events pivot at moments notice between comedy and tragedy invoking unremarkable primetime tv action which unresponsive naked woman will v carry today the murder victim or the rape victim surfacelevel vignettes about life in night city and the rare glimpse of sciencefiction story that might live up to the genre invoked in cyberpunk 2077s title if only it was explored every opportunity for truly compelling interrogation of alienation or identity or the power of that odious machine that is not stopped but only further lubricated by the application of bodies to its gears and wheels ends neither with satisfying conclusion or introspection but an abrupt pretty up huh before v recieves another phone callyou cant steer the course of any of these various stories short of simply not doing them and characters that openly hate and distrust v in one segment will share friendly beer or offer romance two jobs later even if the player made every attempt to make it clear theyd rather this person off story outcomes result in single line of dialogue or slightly more annoyed text message the most signficiant change ive experienced is that if v murders characters friend that character wont v be warnedjohnny silverhand flatly sucks im sure keanu reeves is trying and some of the more somber moments do allow him to pack some performance into onesentence rejoinder however johnnys not an extremist hes contrarian and the script certainly doesnt help when v is serious johnny is irreverent when johnny tries to get real its v who cracks wise johnnys attempts to get along with v amount to blackmail ultimatums and repeated attempts to violate vs bodily autonomy early on youre given medication to suppress johnny and to extend vs lifespan in 40 hours of play i was only given the option to take these pills once despite johnnys unbearable presence and vs worsening condition if i could have v would have been popping them like candyits the kind of thing where you try to put yourself in the head of cyberpunk 2077s decisionmakers there are cars in the game but theyre not customizable because that would mean more development theres store to buy these cars from so theyre sold to you via text message by your many fixers presumably because they couldnt get the voice actors back into the booth lastminute there are races in the game for better reason than that there are cars with the races arranged by bartender for some reason but youll never be outraced in the story matter how slow your truck is you can steal cars if youre strong enough to rip out the driver but your car is summonable and fasttravel points are plentiful so why because the game crime and cars would it have been disservice for v to have his or her one car how many manhours could have been saved how much better of an experience would have been delivered in the end if only few of these seemingly automatic inclusions and the everexpanding checklist of ultimately needless features had been pruned as the player you can barely control the pants v puts on in the morning or get v haircut despite being able to buy new arms or second heart so an inability to choose between compact or van seems inconsequential in comparison to that kind of rigidityjohnny and vs situation is presented early on as crossroads will johnny change v or will v change johnny the reality is that the latter never happens and the former is presented as something that you the player should encourage and pursue youd think that an antiestablishment figure like johnny would understand more than anyone that compromising your identity is just death of another kindcyberpunk 2077 with all its attempts to be anything but game of its own it shooting it rpg elements it openworld it wanted levels and hacking minigames and skill trees and origins and street races and item qualities and everything else you could ever want from aaa game should have learned that lesson because the only thing cyberpunk 2077 doesnt have is good reason to play it
AspectosNegativos: ['Monumental esfuerzo para disfrutar', 'Inconsistencia narrativa', 'Problemas de funcionalidad y características', 'Limitaciones en personalización', 'Personajes y trama poco desarrollados', 'Falta de cohesión en mecánicas de juego']
