Contenido: night city is city of dreams and im big dreamerwake the up samurai we have game to reviewbuckle up dummies were diving into the wonder that is cdprs cyberpunk 2077 i want to start off by saying that ive been looking forward to this game since the e3 2018 trailer dropped with my excitement massively ramping up when the 48minute demo was released after seeing it i knew then and there that id enjoy the game anyways lets dive into this mess of review its bound to be hell of ride the good if you got ta kill kill if you got ta burn it all to the ground then let it burn the gameplay is solid its nothing we havent seen before but it works well enough for what it is the gunplay feels good and the perks are serviceable if somewhat bland statbased perks arent really what im looking for in an rpg but hey i cant really complain the cyberware mods however is where the fun really starts the mantis blades gorilla arms double jumps and charge jump all add up to compelling implant system that makes the game whole lot of fun to explore and enjoythere are lot of things this game does right the main thing that sold on this game apart from cdprs pedigree is the setting for as bad as it might be to live in it the dark future looks highly enticing to personally swapping out your arm for chromeplated cybernetic counterpart getting your nervous system augmented with microprocessor that can straightup rival it hell getting fullbody conversion to become tricked out borg is about as cool as it gets the game makes you asks yourself at what point do we stop being human how much chrome is too much and if youre anything like that really gets the gears in your brain turning pun intendedthe atmosphere is another one of the games strong suits walking the streets of the dark future never felt this immersing youll be able to feel the bleakness of the trashfilled streets of pacifica the gaudiness of the gated communities of westbrooks north oak subdistrict the familiarity of heywoods neighbourhoods and the freedom of openskies of the badlandsthe characters and the story are the games shining stars in my opinion rivalling games such as the last of us and red dead redemption 2 cyberpunks characters are some of the best designed written and acted ive seen yet not once in my 200 hours of playtime did i think to myself these are just pixels on screen because to these were real people this is testament to the writers actors and designers of these characters who have all done stellar job in bringing them to life for us to interact with johnny in particular brings different perspectives and takes to the table that have made reconsider situations that i might not have otherwise his boastful attitude and witty remarks add wonderful flavour to each encounter shows up in which is godsend because if had been anything but that would quickly become unbearable the story plenty of buttclenching serious lighthearted and funny moments as well as heartwrenching and downright disturbing moments in certain characters questline youll know it when you see iti wont talk about the graphics much because personally due to the age of my system i was only able to get playable framerate with lowmedium graphics even so the game looks good if i had rig which could support raytracing and all the bells and whistles it wouldve improved my experience but as it stands now i cant complainthe soundtrack oh lord the soundtrack it is physically impossible for not to sing huehue the praises of this games score and soundtrack speeding down the highway with the radio blasting metal on full volume the cellos of johnnys rebel path theme and the different combat themes of each district all add up to very pleasant auditory experience ive been checking spotify each day since the games release to see if my favourite tracks have been added so i can listen to them whenever im out and about hell im listening to the score as im writing this reviewbut of course it cant be all sunshine and rainbows lets talk about some aspects that arent as savoury the bad test of persons true value death facing it staring it down you cant deny that cdpr failed to deliver on some aspects of the game the cut subway system which was displayed in the games very first trailer as well as promotional images removed features such as the mantis blade wallclimbing being able to sit on benches and such i understand that some sacrifices must be made for the whole game to be better but still dangling carrot in front of our eyes through trailers and gameplay showcases then taking it away on the hushhush isnt cool then theres the deceitful marketing and the whole console while being outraged that 7 year console cant run game that was clearly intended for nextgen systems is incredibly stupid to theres denying that cdpr could have informed customers of the issues that plague the base consoles in order for them to either make more informed decision when it comes to buying the game or cancelling their preorders if they already paidi believe the management and the suits at the very top have over the hardworking devs who have poured their hearts and souls into this game and it really shows its honestly outrageous to see the devs taking flak for decisions they themselves had say in regardless it is what it is the past cant be changed now lets move on the stuff that everyones been laughing about the ugly youre starting to remind of fifty years back minus the charisma and impressive bugs we all know about the bugs by now genitals popping out through clothing npcs acting like absolute tools naked tposing on bikes cars blowing up for reason the whole lot in my experience most of the bugs were simple visual issues that didnt impact my experience much apart from taking out of the moment and at times making laugh my off that being said i encountered few gamebreaking bugs during my 200 hours which frustrated the hell out of thankfully these were kept to minimum dying for reason when falling 3 feet getting permanently stuck after being hit by an npc in car falling on slanted surfaces which would put you in an animation loop that would slowly damage you until you die the performance at launch was quite bad to get through but it massively improved ever since my i54590 and gtx 1070 struggled lot when the game first came out but with patch 106 at the time of this review the performance greatly improved and the game is already in much better state even on comparatively old system like mine i dont doubt for one second that the game will be much more enjoyable after 34 months from release it wont be bugfree sure but it will definitely be in better state than what it was at launch so far in my 200 hours the game only crashed once though your experience may vary depending on your system closing thoughts thing of beauty i know will never fade away it makes sad that not all people have enjoyed this game as much as i have flaws and all sure its nothing spectacular or lifechanging as some people thought this game would be but if you honestly thought this game would blow your mind youre really shooting yourself in the foot in time after vast majority of the bugs have been fixed and all the dlcs have come out i have doubt that this game will be as wellregarded by the people who have played it as the witcher 3 if not more so i for one cant wait for that day to come take care chooms
AspectosPositivos: ['Setting', 'Atmosphere', 'Characters', 'Story', 'Soundtrack']
AspectosNegativos: ['Cut features', 'Deceitful marketing', 'Bugs']

Contenido: spoilers this is going to be long one the minimap doesnt zoom out while driving reintroduced in patch 13 as i finished the game shortly after it first came out i have been holding off reviewing it for whileim not getting into all the bugs etc at all nor the deceitful behavior from cdpr throughout the development and release just the game itself the gameplay and the mechanicsto be clear i was never part of any hype train and only paid attention to what cdpr specifically said the game would be so why that header for its just so telling for the game in general even after they fix it the point still persist its such ultra basic thing for the minimap to zoom out while driving in games like this so you dont have to slow down before every junction in case you might have to turn next but they still got it wrongthats kinda what you can expect feeling lot while playing this gamesaying to yourself huh why does it act like that and not like this it would have been better if it would have made lot more sense ifyou will feel this especially if you have any experience with gta or other games in which do open world city driving etc we will definitely be getting back to that later so whats good about this game even though its really poorly optimized it is visually very impressive it looks amazing stunningi absolutely love the atmosphere the look of the city the open world in general the lore most of the story the battlegun system the great side quests that often more than rivals lot of what the main story have to offer the perk system and the ability to equip cyberware whats wrong with it that list is sadly quite long and mostly subjective of coursefirst off the game been cut to piecesheavily watered down from the original visionmarketingeg day and night cycles the metro weather impacting the game important life path selection it doesnt matter at all crowd community system third person cutscenes the ai etc etcthe ai was supposed to be groundbreaking but instead it is groundbreakingly badit feels so stiff and fake and theres nothing to it at all reactions interactions heart factions you can play into for depth nothingyou will never feel more alone in huge city than you do playing this gamemuch older games did it way better there were supposed to be routines etc for the npcs they were supposed to feel alive and part of the gamethats not at all the casethey can do two things1 cower2 run and despawn right in front of your eyes literallythey dont react to you in any meaningful way at all the cops the ai itself is nonexistent thats mostly true for the cop system as well you never see them or interact with them there are car chases real wanted system you see them from time to time on street corners almost tposingother than that they just always annoy you if you aim your gun in public or hit pedestrian etc and they then almost always will become aggro to you if you did the deed on the top of mountain cop probably saw it somehoweven if you go in guns blazing out of nowhere helping them on crime they ignore you before during and after the factas whole the wanted system should have been cut as its detrimental to the gameplay and immersioni mean they only just recently patched that cops would spawn right behind you matter where you were at the time in the weeds or on top of building the city looks great feels very unreal as ive been saying there is lot to do but it absolutely effect on anything at all it doesnt impact you the game or the ainothing you do will the gigs crimes etc are just random effect happenings plus lootits just you against the virtual world in which you are imprisoned and with that i mean that it feels like you are in virtual world in game the story it was actually good but its very clear how much they have watered down the experience to be able to get it out as fast as possible the prologue with jackie is the closest you get to the next gen rpg feels but the buck stops there after that it just becomes normalaverage currentlast gen not directly bad by any means just really disappointingthe worst thing for with the story is that its finite its closed off either you finish the game or you donti wanted to complete the last mission and then keep playing after the fact somehowgo back and do the stuff i didnt do but you cant you can only go back to before doing the last mission it feels bad after all that work and it shows if you look at how fast people stop playing it on steam alonei wanted to keep playing building my character doing side quests tie up loose ends until new content came out because you know its supposed to be next gen open world rpgits definitely not that visually maybe so whats up with the gta thing just to be clear this is not gta nor should it bebut its still the funniest thing ever it seems like they have gone above and beyond to not being compared to gta im pretty sure it was probably banned to talk about gta in their office during developmentthat would explain lot as to all the things they missed or got wronggta is game with similar city vibes whats wrong with looking at what they are doing right when it comes to open world driving ai city stuff interactions reactions physics and mechanics and then making them even better for this genphysics and mechanics are physics and mechanics most of which will be the same if you want it to feel as real as possibleits not about copying gta or not setting your game clearly apart from it its about looking at how other people have solved the same issues and why gamers like it so much pre crazy town gta of courselike it or not gta is competitor and im pretty sure rockstar was very relieved as to how cyberpunk turned out especially if you think gta 6 and that cdpr wants to take cyberpunk online at some pointin general there are really old rpgs that did many rpg things better some of which isnt even included in this next gen rpg conclusion with all that being said i actually enjoyed playing i mean i have 100 hours in it rightwell its complicatedi held off doing the main story for the first like 90 hours just because i was hoping lot of those bad mechanics etc would get patched improved on etc so the gameplay would be better i wanted to save the main story for that so i spent my time hunting loot grinding etcbut then i couldnt hold on to my naïveté any longer so i started doing the story for real from the first bossin what felt like blink of an eye 510 hours i got that prompt going backthe end to the game the last mission i was shocked all that grinding for nothing it just ends it wants you to stop you have tolike that moronic cdpr moderator said on reddit i believe it was our games have an ending they always have its your problem if you dont like itwell the main story can still end credits and all without it forcing you to stop playing or only being able to go back to before the end buuuut as baffling as the mechanics etc were at times i genuinely enjoyed playing the gamebut in the end that enjoyment was like dragging my bare arse over course carpet like dogit kinda feels good now but you will feel hollow and regretful laterpeople should definitely look into it but maybe hold off for now they are literally still bugfixing to this day stuff like physics gameplay mechanics etc will probably not see any action before good while if everi really hope i can recommend this in future also for
AspectosPositivos: ['Visualmente impresionante', 'Atmósfera y aspecto de la ciudad', 'Mecánica de combate', 'Misiones secundarias de calidad', 'Sistema de mejoras y ciberware']
AspectosNegativos: ['Minimapa no se aleja al conducir', 'Juego recortado y aguado en comparación con la visión original', 'IA deficiente y poco realista', 'Sistema de búsqueda y policía poco desarrollado', 'Sensación de soledad en la ciudad', 'Historia finita sin posibilidad de continuar después de completarla']

Contenido: tldr great game buried under mountain of bugs and unfinished content id wait for more patches before purchasingi will update this review as more patches go livepros the soundtrack its perfect they completely nail the cyberpunk aesthetic all of the cdpr produced samurai tracks fit so well into the world theyve created i love how they really lean into the punk rock mythos and make it major theme throughout the game the one knock i have is that there just isnt enough tracks to fill out the large amount of radio stations they have in game you end up hearing lot of repeats main storyline campaign side gigs love interests panam and judy are by far the most fleshed out characters in the game besides v and johnny themselves both of their storylines are extremely well written and give you real sense progression from both relationship and character arc perspective they each get 3 or 4 major missions packed with character development i think detective river ward was supposed to be another major love interest but it feels like they cut lot of his story as you only get one major mission with him although that hunt for the serial killer was an excellent mission river just felt like blip compared to panam and judy and thats shameneutral general performance now im saying this as someone who pretty solid rig this game bad optimization if youre running an rtx 3070 or amd equivalent it will run pretty well dlss is massive performance boost but is only available on rtx 20 and 30 series cards the difference between my gtx 1080ti fe and an rtx 3070 was day and night if youre running more dated pc youre going to have to make some concessions to play it at stable 60 fps if youre lucky enough to have an rtx 3080 or 3090 and good cpu game look good combat slinging lead and slicing up enemies with katana feels great they did good job with most of their weapon designs how they sound and the associated combat animations the problem with combat isnt the art side its the programming and design side there is level indicator greenyellowred nameplate to let know what to expect before entering fight the only thing you get is skull if the enemy is much higher level than you if i hit tab to scan people there should be very clear ui element letting know how strong they are compared to i feel like i either wiped the floor with my enemies or they wiped the floor with there was never any middle ground game desperately needs balance pass braindances netrunning the animation and visual effects are excellent this might be one of the coolest parts of the game but what kills is the fact that there is only handful of braindances in the whole game there are tons of npcs that supposedly sell braindances and lot of journal logs talk about plethora of bds you can experience but you cant actual purchase or experience any of it also netrunning was awesome just shame that outside of couple missions there is way to do it 219 support while playing with my 1080ti every time i loaded the game it put black bars on the sides of my screen forcing to go into display settings apply lower resolution and then reapply my native resolution to fix it i did not have this issue while using rtx 3070cons illusion of choice too many of the dialog options throughout the game have real impact on the outcome of any given mission obviously unfinished content you can tell they really cut down some of the open world areas large chunks of the map are completely inaccessible arasaka waterfront like half of pacifica laughably short life paths ai is in shambles i could go on and on bugs you can really tell what parts of the game they did or did not have time to polish the main storyline quests and major side quests are excellent i ran into very few bugs during the scripted missions themselves there are lot of bugs you can attribute to the nonexistent ai more on that later but there are also lot of physics game systems and animation bugs heaped on as well from randomly dying while walking down stairs to naked tposing while riding motorcycle the whole game just needed more time in the oven nonexistent ai outside of specific missions where some npcs or bosses are specifically scripted the ai does pretty much nothing it sounds like they either didnt finish it or disabled it to eek out better performance in the 10 release either way its downright embarrassing for company like cdpr to release game in this state driving feels very finnickysluggish driving just doesnt feel good lack of vehicle customization is very disappointing police wanted system i think this already been memed to death but cops spawning behind you cop car chases barest of bare bones wanted system its very embarrassing from aaa studio game intro life paths this felt like it was extremely low effort basically the game gives you three different origin stories with 30 minute mission each woo beat on the brat storyline after talking with coach near your starting apartment this starts series of wagered mma fight missions these are the most unbalanced unfun missions i might have ever played in game after thirty tries i just gave up and found ways to cheese them you can drop two melee weapon on the ground and press r to equip while the fight is underway it will block the first equip but the second will work and then you can melee weapon double jump your way to victory the beast in storyline after meeting claire in the afterlife youre invited to join series of street racing gigs there is zero racing ai once you get out in front you win its awful player customization the character creator itself was far more shallow than i was hoping for they also need some sort of transmog system or complete overhaul of their armorcrafting system because in order to have statistically good character you have to look like clown most of the time how cyberpunk handles sexual themes and encounters at every turn cyberpunk tries to throw sex in your face with constant barrage of overt sexual ads but when sex can be portrayed in any meaningful way they hold back throughout the game i dont think there is more than 4 heterosexual and 3 homosexual encounters possible as male v none of the encounters i experienced had more than partial nudity one was even fully clothed though im assuming that was bug now im not expecting cdpr to show fullon hardcore sex or anything but for game as sexually saturated as 2077 its also weirdly prudish instead of having genuine discussion about sex workers cdpr just portrays them as the cliché abused underclass which is mindblowing when you have the mox essentially sex workers union turned gang to protect themselves in your game the problem is they talk about the mox for like one mission and then basically act like they dont exist for the rest of the game its just frustrating because you can tell cdpr laid the groundwork for some very interesting stories but instead they just lean back into tired tropes i also have serious problem with the mission in clouds where the game essentially makes your character bisexual this is the infamous angelskye mission in an rpg taking away players sexual agency is bad idea sexual preference should have been in the character creatorcomputer specs intel i9 9900k evga gtx 1080ti fe 64gb ddr4 3200 ram lg 34gk950fb 3440x1440 144hz 500gb samsung 970 evo m2 ssd

spoiler free reviewjust above the averagefor the 95 of my first playthrough if youd ask for point grade of cyberpunk i would give it something around 6510 above average mostly thanks to the story visuals and music that are all part of experience with the game sadly numerous bugs glitches and minor issues sabotaged an otherwise strong 9 or even 95 but then after playing through all possible endings the story part kinda fell apart dropping the six and half even lower just kinda cause three endings were rather decent but then again one strips you off of around 90 minutes of gameplay and then kicks you in the face for choosing it while the others are not really satisfying and there are plenty more which are just bad in my opinion and because of that i felt disconnected from the whole story and even the 6510 i was readying in my head turned into 5and with an exactly average game i thought to myself well do i even recommend cyberpunk 2077 to others after few battles with my thoughts i decided yes yes i wouldcyberpunk 2077 is actually good game shame it is so overshadowed by how many bugs it and how the story let down at the very end what lived up to the hypei am actually surprised how wellcrafted the ingame world is it made immersed from the get go and thats easy task everything from giant skyscrapers to the smallest houses in the badlands is top notch there was lot of care taken in creating night city and its outskirts quite honestly it actually works like real city would i know i know i just got surprised by it just think about how many games have cities that could actually be habited and used not just for show its not created with heavy impact on travelling by car sure the roads are important but if you wanted to stroll through the city on foot youd have proper sidewalks crossings aisles and footbridges for your disposal something eg gta v was lackingthe lighting the sounds everything seems in order for 2077 metropolis and it makes sense too led lights and all that cyberstuff wasnt just put left right and center for the sake of it the cybersolutions have strong reason to be there instead of neondiarrhea led lights are only in places needing an actual highlight not wasting too many resources so worldbuilding is top notchand then music music is fantastic i already fell in love with couple of tracks the selection of genres is wide and well fitting soundtrack payday syndrome its more beneficial to go stealth but music is way better when you go loud energy given to you through the eardrums is just something else something i enjoyed the most the storyquite honest with you i was very surprised by how neatly the story is constructed the prologue itself takes around 6 hours to get through thats insane that time is also used to perfection you get to bond with some characters you find reason to progress the story and most importantly you start finding alliances and rivalries the characters are likable relatable and compelling you decide how you want to progress and whose stories you want to focus on and the main protagonist v genuinely had think of himher as myself which is an enormous amount of fun being able to feel as part of the game so the immersion aspect was unexpectedly well executedwhat did not live its obvious that the hypetrain for cyberpunk 2077 was far beyond anything this game could achieve lets be honest here the hype surpassed even the one for halflife 3 and that was not healthy for the games release which was just full of flops bugs issues glitches not even far into the game it took less than 30 minutes for the first gameplaydisrupting glitch to occur thats basic stuff that just shouldnt pass qa you know what that reminded of the witcher 3 cd projekt red just wasnt that big back then and more importantly they didnt have that impossible to achieve level of hype behind them witcher 3 was just as bugged and it was fixed in weeks time following the release just like cyberpunk was supposed to be i think i have idea what was going on the peoples mind while first setting release date when we got that broken of title on 10th of december by the time of writing this review the game been patched 6 times already and lot of early game issues have been addressed but cyberpunk is still far from perfect it can now be finished though because guess what the first iteration of the game couldnt be completed as the final boss was just impossible to kill fun rightthe amount of things that still need polishing is astounding im not sure how much time will the game need to reach the state at which it can be considered fullystable at least the random crashes dont occur so often anymore the save states dont get corrupted anymore either so heres hoping that cyberpunk 2077 will reach point at which bugs and issues will be thing of the pastdriving in this game is absolutely horrendous its disgusting with all vehicles i know im racing genre veteran but this was just unbearable understeer is all over the place cars and bikes steer like bricks halfsunk in the sand and the only working brake is the handbrake and it doesnt work too well either so the fast travel becomes mustthe rpg aspect of the game had bit wondering multiple endings and choices matter were thrown at way before cyberpunks release and you know what the first one is true second not so much yeah the differences between endings are in most cases like day and night but the way you get there is not as varied as you could hope for your dialogue options especially while talking with johnny silverhand could as well be limited to yes progress it hurst to say this but there are multiple situations which just ask for any other outcome you can be snarky complete jerk very independent person or wholesome guy and still the dialogue goes mostly exactly the same for every approach why make characters love or hate i dont care but let choose the way they will respond next dont let them come back to neutral line after i insulted or complimented them thats not how humans work matter how you look at it its step back from witcher 3what is left to talk about is the endingi want to bash someone for it i am damn glad i took my time before finishing the game cause the endings are just so disappointing almost regardless of which route you choose feels like the writers responsible for how cyberpunk comes to an end were different people than those who designed the rest of the game i have felt so disconnected from everything i have learned about the game and characters portrayed in it that it almost ruined the entire experience for in most endings most because as i said earlier on i can accept three of them accept is not high praisemost of the endings are just illogical weird stupid even and the results of picking those endings just disappointmentin the end i spent lot of time weighing whether or not would i recommend this game to anyone and you know what despite well everything i would i really would with patches coming every other week maybe in some time the game will reach better state but you know what even with those bugs glitches and all the issues you might come across its very lengthy and very fun experience just maybe enjoy your time before reaching the point of return because after that it gets messy
AspectosPositivos: ['Historia', 'Visuales', 'Música', 'Mundo del juego']
AspectosNegativos: ['Bugs', 'Glitches', 'Final de la historia']

Contenido: if youre looking for more quality reviews like this follow our curator page devils in the detailthe night city of reality the night city of expectationscyberpunk 2077 is game of grandiose ideals that came with grandiose marketing to the extent that it can be chore parsing out the games fluff from its actual content the ad campaign that surrounded the project was so invasive and ubiquitous that even after almost 60 hours of playtime im still not fully equipped to separate what the game is from what it was intended or advertised to be thats not wholly cd project reds fault either i ultimately bear some responsibility for creating something in my mind that developer ever fully realized part of that to do with the high esteem that i hold for their previous projects specifically the witcher 3 so its not completely fair to cd project reds creative and yet it was also their marketing that constructed the hype train i was riding regardless of how we got here the sheer amount of dissonance from what i thought i would play partly my fault from what the game actually became mostly their fault creates tricky ruleset for reviewing aside from the game figuratively crashing headlong into the hurdle of my expectations the game is still sometimes fun its usually charming occasionally dull always buggy relatively beautiful mess of game the exhausting vacillation between positive attributes and negative characteristics makes for rather arduous game of mental tennis few parts of the game come without greatness likewise part comes without lethargy the incongruity between the positive and negative makes reviewer somewhat hesitant to state the game is good or bad or fair but i will with lump in my throat saythe game is ok and when it was over i was ready to move onhttpssteamcommunitycomsharedfilesfiledetailsid2337786881 mistakes were madetheres an rpg problem that exists and its pervasive in two waysfirstly the character you control v is already paintbynumbers character for whom the player will fill in the canvas ive seen this criticized in general sense and im not completely on board thousands of rpgs like this have already existed without complaint geralt from the witcher works in similar fashion you never take the reins of characterization completely this is different aside from book series and three video games worth of establishment from what came before other than it seemingly contrasting from what was advertised but make mistake v is already person and people have problems goals and aspirations you will not decide these for her or in my case him occasionally though there are general inconsistencies with v it seems weird for instance that streetkid would work with police officers and politicians yet does if you allow him to so should i simply not allow it or is it mistake for the developers to have allowed it the onus is ambiguous the answer unfortunately appears to be of consequence v can or cant you decide any streetkid code in your head is just that in your head which makes the roleplaying feel superfluoussecondly the main quest of cyberpunk 2077 is timesensitive not actually but storywise this is an enormous issue it creates story template that conflicts with the players desire to explore if the main quest deadline and that deadline not being met results in something terrible happening why in the world would v if this were real bother doing anything else that cd project red went through the trouble of creating the answer is that v would not because it doesnt make sensehow can cyberpunk 2077 justify that anyone with even slight measure of intelligence particularly its protagonist would go through the trouble of falling in love racing cars beating up nobodys having sex eating drinking or shopping if they had this totally separate issue that renders all of these earthly pleasures utterly meaningless the main story breaks the world httpssteamcommunitycomsharedfilesfiledetailsid2337770249 the player simply can not based on the games own story rationalize doing anything other than the main quest and that main quest isnt that long especially in comparison to the amount of side content and because the plot moves so quickly and v so slowly disconnect forms and the plot cant sustain itself you see its possible that v the player will be just too busy messing with hookers or dirt biking in the desert or getting drunk in bar to adhere to the allimportant details of the quest cyberpunk 2077 says is the most important its easy to outroleplay the narrative because any main plot particularly one that is timesensitive simply dissolves in an open world like this basically why give the player tons to do then by the nature of the plot tell them theres time to do any of it because as stated if this were real they surely wouldnt v looks like an idiot for having fun the land of zero gravitydespite the lack of sense it makes for character who should be doing anything but there are lots of fun things to do in night city i was regularly captivated by the vistas the populace the pulsing radio and the night jaunts through the citys underbelly while not being revolutionary i felt this much and more in the fantasy realms within the witcher 3 it still achieved high level of verisimilitude for the city proper theres something to night city even if it was less than advertised many of my favorite moments of the game were the straightaways with my figurative foot on the gas speeding into oblivion it was in these moments when night city felt alivefor few seconds at least until i would suddenly glitch outside my car and be suspended in the air just above it surfing on the hoodbugs and glitches are prevalent i casually surfed on top of my car often you will see anomalies like this everywhere and the real tragedy with these regular irregularities other than their predictability is that they ruin moments that would otherwise work exceptionally well imagine sensitive moment between two lovers or friends or glorious shootout where v against all odds blasts his way through legion of adversaries only to be met with invisible goons random floating objects or decapitated people who are still very much alive despite its potential for danger bugs colored the whole of night city in something goofy and unintimidating its circus clownhouse night city is supposed to be as much of character as v is and either by content or unintentional moments of motosurfing complete with floating inanimate objects or people that goal is never fully realized and that is the biggest shame of cyberpunk 2077httpssteamcommunitycomsharedfilesfiledetailsid2337775537 conclusioncyberpunk 2077 does not feel especially innovative or finished which is shocking considering its marketing truthfully it just kind of exists another contemporary neither truly offending nor pleasing owning nothing it really excels at or really even anything its particularly poor at save quality controlits pretty glitchy rpgshooter that exists in an open world it grants the player the freedom of exploration and the freedom to level up via skill tree youll meet some interesting characters do some interesting things and in the end spend 50 hours completing it allsound familiar it should youve been playing it for years610 fair

producto recibido forma gratuita its now five years since skyrim first took over everyones lives with players happily spending hundreds of hours exploring what is one of the finest open world environments ever created the fifth mainline entry in the elder scrolls series creator bethesda warned that there will not be sixth for some considerable time yet and so instead theres this special edition so named because ordinary remaster doesnt sound quite so appealingin terms of content this is exactly the same game as was released in 2011 albeit with all the subsequent dlc included from the start it seen graphical upgrade though the details of which well get into in moment there is also mod support available from launch which on the playstation 4 in particular been long time comingalthough its taken for granted nowadays the transition of the elder scrolls from niche franchise to mainstream hit was great surprise at the time before 2006s oblivion the idea of western roleplaying game being one of the most successful games of the year wouldve been laughed at and yet its popularity paved the way not just for skyrim but the mainstream acceptance of the likes of dragon age and the witcherthe elder scrolls success is doubly surprising given the rather bland tolkienesque fantasy world the games are set in although its lack of distinguishing features made it easier for bethesda to create more grounded experience for skyrim that doubt helped to attract more casual interest each game is named after particular location in the world with skyrim being nordicinspired land of horned warriors and snowy mountainsas the game starts your character who can be customised from any number of humanoid races been mistakenly rounded up with bunch of prisoners rebelling against the games continentspanning empire youre later able to join either side if you wish but the rights and wrongs of the situation are not at all clear cut your initial consideration though is that youre about to be beheaded and are only saved by ruddy great dragon attacking the village youve been brought toit transpires that dragons havent existed in the world for centuries and their appearance is supposed to augur the apocalypse naturally you turn out to be the chosen one that can stop them dragonborn who is able to learn their language and absorb their powerthis is all very exciting at the time but once you escape from the dragon the real appeal of skyrim is made clear youre given some advice that you should head to nearby village for help but if you dont want to theres nothing at all stopping you from ignoring the story for the rest of the game and just heading off to explore on your own you can become mercenary learn craft or buy house and find spouse its entirely up to you and the game encourages any and every eventualityit doesnt entirely abandon you though and if it thinks youve got lost itll start pointing you in the direction of story quest locations although give theres over 200 dungeons to explore the chances of you not happening across something on your own are remotealthough there is third person option the first person view is the default which means the basics of combat are kept as simple as possible the left trigger controls whatevers in your left hand the right whatevers in your right there are few context sensitive actions depending on what they are spells needed to be powered up while theres basic block and counter system for shields but it means you can instantly get stuck in whether youre wielding twohanded battleaxe or fireball and healing spellsgiven the detailed upgrade system and your ability to craft your own weapons armour and potions this is true roleplayer in way youd never expect of such mass market game but bethesda game studios main weakness continues to be dialogue and character interaction the amateur hour voiceovers which range from nordic brogue to californian twang are constantly distracting although the dialogue they mangle is so full of cliché its not as if theyre ruining anythingand despite the move to the playstation 4 the games human characters still look like woodcarved puppets with robotic animation that would often shame playstation 2 game the visuals for the games landscapes are more impressive though especially as you know everything you see from the highest snowcapped mountain to the low marshland is real location that can be travelled to and exploredin terms of improvements for the special edition the frame rate is locked at 30 frames per second with 1080p resolution the draw distance noticeably extended in terms of adding in extra background details like foliage and theres new depth of field effects shadows look more realistic and so too does snow ice and running water theres also lot of use of the god rays that so often ground fallout 4s far harbor dlc to halt although theyre much less problematic here in fact the performance is all round very good with almost slowdown and relatively few bugsparticularly compared to the original playstation 3 release the difference is night and day and yet the special edition is still only emulating the original pc version with maxed out graphics that means its still well behind the pace of modern games especially when compared to conceptually similar titles like the witcher 3 its still the terrible animation and unnaturally static landscapes that you notice before any of the improvements as welcome and as wellimplemented as they are but to do any more wouldve involved remaking the game almost from scratch and wed much rather bethesda work on new game than spend too much time on an old oneafter all its not just the visuals that are showing their age but also the simplistic quest design and narrative structure and yet in way the special edition does have an answer for that in terms of the playercreated mods although theres only very small number so far for the playstation 4 and none of them do anything very interesting beyond adding few new spells or other even more trivial extras but hopefully replacing the dragons with thomas the tank engine will come in timeits been fun to return to skyrim and bethesda have clearly put lot of effort into this special edition even if it is almost as if theyre fighting losing battle with new content though weve desire to play all 100 hours all over again even if were sure many will although of course if youve never played the game at all then this represents incredibly good value for money but for us the main thing we took away from skyrim special edition is how much were looking forward to the next elder scrollsreviewed on playstation 4 xbox 1 and pcin short one of the best western style roleplayers ever made works better than it ever before on consoles but theres only so much new coat of paint can do to hide its agepros enormous game world thats absolutely bursting with side quests secrets and almost infinite choice improved graphics and performance plus all the original dlc and modscons the graphical changes are welcome but the game still shows its age particularly in terms of animation amateurish voiceacting and simplistic quest and narrative designscore 910
AspectosPositivos: ['Enorme mundo de juego con muchas misiones secundarias y secretos', 'Gráficos mejorados y rendimiento mejorado', 'Inclusión de todos los DLC originales y mods']
AspectosNegativos: ['Gráficos que muestran la edad del juego, especialmente en animaciones', 'Actuación de voz amateur y diseño de misiones y narrativa simplistas']

Contenido: introductionelden ring is soulslike action rpg by the legendary fromsoftware the developers of the dark souls series where the main goal is to expand the genre by allowing you full access to an open world environment players will have treacherous traps to bypass devious bosses to decimate and epic distances to travel on their path to becoming an elden lord positives negatives classic souls formula where combat prowess determines your progression large selection of weapons and armour the sheer scope of the open world is overwhelming wellwritten and captivating storyline new crafting mechanic is intuitive and easytouse all damage types and builds are viable truly terrible launch where many bugs and issues still exist in the game there is tangible balance between different builds mechanically boring boss encounters an abhorrent amount of recycled content especially in the latter half of the game unannounced patchesfixes completely break builds this forces you to either farm levels to make up the gap or reassign attribute points at your own cost to fix it storyin elden ring you assume the role of warrior derogatorily known as tarnished being whose existence is an affront in this land where gold and power rule all you soon find out that this world been torn apart by countless wars and that very little of its once noble kingdoms remainyou must use sites of grace elden rings bonfire replacement to guide you across these lands and seek out the great rune bearers with the hope that you can eventually restore the elden ring itself and assume the mantle of elden lord but this is simple task as over time these great beings have become lost and confused in powerfuelled madness and they will do anything to ensure the runes remain in their graspelden rings story is mostly masked in fog and intrigue and to truly understand it in its entirety you will likely need several playthroughs and to explore every inch of its world to unravel it what is explained to you however is beautifully written and flows exceptionally well for the entirety of the gamehttpssteamcommunitycomsharedfilesfiledetailsid2790851412gameplay analysisa world where power is taken not giventhe heart of all soulslike games is inevitably the combat where prowess and skill determine whether you are victorious or suffer crushing defeat elden ring is the same for the most part combat is more forgiving than previous fromsoftware entries especially compared to their previous title sekiro where even minor mistakes could cost you dozen hours despite its fairer scenarios you will still require some finesse to progress combat is smooth and for the most part pretty fair although there are some cases where it can feel clunky or just plain brokenyou have far more freedom here to build your character exactly how you want to with limited respecs available to your character as well as plethora of weapons and armour to choose from combine all of this with both the new and improved ashes system where you can enchant nonunique weapon with specific skill and completely rebalanced magic and ranged system you have fairly dynamic gameplay experiencethere is also newly implemented crafting mechanic while i didnt use it to its full potential i can see it being useful to the player who wants an edge for boss fights or difficult encounters most crafting materials are freely available in either the openworld or as drops from specific enemieslike butter spread too thin on toastthis is the best analogy i can give to the games openworld experience in truth the scope feels extraordinary with every visible location in the distance being place worth investigating it saddens that this falls short of expectation as the games format doesnt fit this kind of experience it feels like flattened and rolledout version of the original dark souls formula without updating it all to compensate for the vast distances this is made more evident in the latter portion of the game where its riddled with recycled content bosses and enemies you have already fought will return to the fray with slightly more health or higher damage output which honestly is just lazy game design and it entirely detracts from the atmosphere intendedthere can be victory if the war was lost to begin withveterans of the genre will be glad to see the vast quantity of bosses and enemies this game to offer from monstrous dragons to overwhelming giants this game it all so it disappoints greatly to play through the entire campaign completely unimpressed by the lack of boss mechanics tactics and overall strategy there are obviously exceptions to the rule but the overall experience fighting most of them felt uninteresting and stale the side content isnt much better where you are literally just riding around looking for copypaste dungeons or crafting materials to bolster you against the next boss fightaudio and visualthere can be denying this game is stunning real treat for the eyes in nearly every aspect of its design the world is gorgeous the vistas are cinematic and the bosses are heavily detailed in way telling you story about themselves by just standing before you my only major concern is the sheer amount of golden visuals that encompass your vision matter where you look httpssteamcommunitycomsharedfilesfiledetailsid2790850758the audio falls into the same boat with most of it being recycled from previous games it immediately feels little stale there is notion of nostalgia here for sure but i think an entirely fresh experience would have done wonders to contrast this perfectly the soundtrack is just something to behold absolutely one of my favourite soundtracks ever orchestrated with each boss and zone bringing entirely new compositions to the fold and elevating the overall atmosphere pc performance and specificationswith settings set as high as they could go ive had only minor fluctuations in frame rates with my current build below game launch had an astronomical amount of issues some of which were heavily performance based most of these have since been rectified volumes of bugs and crashes experienced in under 100 hours of gameplay some texture tearing and clipping issues were presentram 32gb under load usage 39cpu i9 10900ka 370ghz under load usage 42gpu msi ventus rtx 3080 under load usage 494final thoughts very goodreview chart hereelden ring is wellwritten and gorgeous adventure that also proves without shadow of doubt that you cant simply take an existing linear formula and force it into new openworld shape without it losing some integrity vast array of new and improved mechanics as well as the large catalogue of weapons and armours you can choose from basically ensures that challenge is insurmountable and will keep you build crafting for many hours there were quite lot of bugs and performance issues at launch but these have been rectified for the most part overall decent game and one that definitely caters to larger audience than ever before i can recommend this game in its current state but if you havent been fan of the genre in the past perhaps wait for salefollow our curator page summit reviews to see more highquality reviews regularly
AspectosPositivos: ['Classic souls formula where combat prowess determines your progression', 'Large selection of weapons and armour', 'Well-written and captivating storyline', 'New crafting mechanic is intuitive and easy-to-use', 'All damage types and builds are viable']
AspectosNegativos: ['Truly terrible launch with many bugs and issues still existing in the game', 'Mechanically boring boss encounters', 'An abhorrent amount of recycled content, especially in the latter half of the game', 'Unannounced patches/fixes completely break builds']

Contenido: controversy the gamefor some people who had actively anticipated cyberpunk 2077 ever since its announcement closely watched every trailer and got themselves hyped up beyond belief the game turned out to be very disappointing luckily im convinced at least i didnt look forward to the game much at all and the only real appeal i saw was the collaboration with one of my current favorite musicians grimes who produced song for the ingame radio and voiced one of the sidequest characters other than that i really couldnt care less about this game but bought into the hype week or so prior to its release and partially transferred my wealth anyway and here we arewithout any further ado im just going to say that few games ever made so invested in them to make it little more bearable to read through ill divide my thoughts into three different paragraphsthe good 1 the designs they are absolutely stunning here from main characters to someone youll only hear few lines from throughout the game from dangerous and scary adam smasher to soothing and routine judy applies to the ingame street ads everything ever so slightly related to the samurai band later about that and clothing for the most part stellar 2 the graphics alright im guilty this very game kinda made upgrade my gpu sooner than i wanted to naturally do so its mind boggling with rtx on ive never seen any other game look prettier the sights you see while driving through the city at night are worth lot by itself 3 the characters each and every from the main character cast is very memorable and well written whenever johnny and yes the trope with the iconic character that only the protagonist can see due to said characters being inside their head is as old as the world examples arkham knight tales from the borderlands appears and starts talking about his terrorist past or just says something disturbing in general you cant help yourself but feel like hes all for real hes just that much of an idealist and you grow to love him for that at least thats the case with you either love johnny to bits or hate his guts inbetween from what ive heard but even the secondary characters like takemura and rogue are to be remembered and have countless things and unique character features to cherish them for 4 side missions just as rich if not even richer as the main story campaign while some of them are lackluster and unapologetically short quest lines such as dream on and the story of convicted murderer wanting to make difference through his newly acquired faith are going to stay with you for long long time all of the secondary quests related to samurai and silverhands past are also win the bickering between the former band members feels like those are the conflicts that couldve easily happened between any of the days of glory longtime passed rock bands be it say metallica or deep purple really authentic 5 the story yes as simple as that i really liked the main story of the game and the way it was flowing full of memorable encounters and events its the meat of the game and keeps you invested throughout written beautifully 6 the symbolism if you as silly as it sounds question yourself what makes human different from god wonder about afterlife and are curious about when does ones life truly end thats the right game to feast on the themes of faith yes faith not religion please never ever mix them together are touched very authentically in one of the sidequests too 7 audio and music the original soundtrack is perfect fit for this world from the menacing and grim v and consumer cathedral to the banging midtempo roller of the rebel path radio music is also great curated by the likes of run the jewels nina kraviz and grimes the latter contributed an absolutely stunning delicate weapon exclusively for the game too easily my favorite from all of the originals from cyberpunk 2077 the meh 1 gameplay yes as sad as it is the game gets little boring to play after while which is cardinal for game like this vehicles feel just okay the gunplay is borderline alright and the quickhack system is fun for while until you realize it was done better even in the first watch_dogs game only the story and the characters kept interested in immersing myself in more of the repetitiveness 2 customization yes sure you can customize your character to oblivion but thats about it you cant even change their haircut later on the clothing system is revolving purely around the stats and will force you to wear things you dislike for that sweetsweet combat advantage cars cant be customized whatsoever but luckily i never really cared about them in the first place but i have to admit that the game really allowed to shape and make my character exactly the way i want them to be even though if you cant be nonbinary in 2077 which i assume you cant since everyone keeps referring to you as to or she exclusively and the game doesnt really give you third option cdpr are completely missing some really important attributes of the cyberpunk genre as whole 3 cyberware oh they advertised it as the pinnacle of videogame customization but more often than not its just another way to improve your stats with visible changes only few of the implants actually change you in drastic way but what about cyberpsychosis you might ask obviously you cant go insane because of all of the chrome in your body like you can in the pennpaper rpg thatd be way too deep for triple 2020 game right 4 consequences of your actions they are kinda there some of the things you do early on really affect the story and the flow of the later side missions but is it really game changing not in slightest another overly advertised and underdelivered feature the bad 1 technical issues rtx 3060 with an i58400 are giving 5560 fps on highultra with medium rtx and dlss on what talk about optimization the amount of bugs and glitches is legendary not even worth mentioning at this point 2 expectations cdpr had it coming really never seen game advertised like that before could even order collaborative pizza from local pizzeria chain packaged in cyberpunk themed box the media the trailers the demos for the streamers its very sad you cant really see all this greatness in the game itself the expectations were set too high and we received an undercooked product as simple as that and its ones fault but cdprs conclusion so is the game really worth playing yes but not now ive had lot of fun diving deep into the games world and i have to give all of my praise to the designers writers and musicians that made it all possible for its one of my new favorite universes and i would love to play the tabletop rpg now but the amount of technical issues and broken promises is really offputting just give the developers sometime to actually fix the game might take year or even more and if you dont mind the gameplay being little underwhelming but care about the world and the characters of the game absolutely go for it now is not the time however yet im still glad i enjoyed the game seemingly lot more than some of the people i know dont have your expectation high and you will never be disappointed
AspectosPositivos: ['Diseños impresionantes', 'Gráficos sorprendentes, especialmente con RTX', 'Personajes memorables y bien escritos', 'Misiones secundarias ricas y significativas', 'Historia principal atractiva y bien escrita', 'Música y banda sonora originales de alta calidad', 'Exploración de temas profundos como la fe y la humanidad']
AspectosNegativos: ['Jugabilidad que puede volverse aburrida', 'Limitaciones en la personalización de personajes y cyberware', 'Consecuencias de acciones no tan impactantes como se esperaba', 'Problemas técnicos y falta de optimización', 'Expectativas excesivamente altas generadas por la publicidad']

watch_dogs game only the story and the characters kept interested in immersing myself in more of the repetitiveness 2 customization yes sure you can customize your character to oblivion but thats about it you cant even change their haircut later on the clothing system is revolving purely around the stats and will force you to wear things you dislike for that sweetsweet combat advantage cars cant be customized whatsoever but luckily i never really cared about them in the first place but i have to admit that the game really allowed to shape and make my character exactly the way i want them to be even though if you cant be nonbinary in 2077 which i assume you cant since everyone keeps referring to you as to or she exclusively and the game doesnt really give you third option cdpr are completely missing some really important attributes of the cyberpunk genre as whole 3 cyberware oh they advertised it as the pinnacle of videogame customization but more often than not its just another way to improve your stats with visible changes only few of the implants actually change you in drastic way but what about cyberpsychosis you might ask obviously you cant go insane because of all of the chrome in your body like you can in the pennpaper rpg thatd be way too deep for triple 2020 game right 4 consequences of your actions they are kinda there some of the things you do early on really affect the story and the flow of the later side missions but is it really game changing not in slightest another overly advertised and underdelivered feature the bad 1 technical issues rtx 3060 with an i58400 are giving 5560 fps on highultra with medium rtx and dlss on what talk about optimization the amount of bugs and glitches is legendary not even worth mentioning at this point 2 expectations cdpr had it coming really never seen game advertised like that before could even order collaborative pizza from local pizzeria chain packaged in cyberpunk themed box the media the trailers the demos for the streamers its very sad you cant really see all this greatness in the game itself the expectations were set too high and we received an undercooked product as simple as that and its ones fault but cdprs conclusion so is the game really worth playing yes but not now ive had lot of fun diving deep into the games world and i have to give all of my praise to the designers writers and musicians that made it all possible for its one of my new favorite universes and i would love to play the tabletop rpg now but the amount of technical issues and broken promises is really offputting just give the developers sometime to actually fix the game might take year or even more and if you dont mind the gameplay being little underwhelming but care about the world and the characters of the game absolutely go for it now is not the time however yet im still glad i enjoyed the game seemingly lot more than some of the people i know dont have your expectation high and you will never be disappointed

AspectosNegativos: ['Jugabilidad se vuelve aburrida', 'Limitaciones en la personalización', 'Sistema de cyberware no cumple expectativas', 'Consecuencias de acciones no tan impactantes', 'Problemas técnicos y bugs', 'Expectativas excesivas']

Contenido: this game is an ambitious game and is brilliant in many respects it deserves positive review yet it is one that i can not give myself remember that all of what i say are and only my own opinion feel free to disagreein terms of combat elden ring added posture break from bloodborne this feature innately encourages you to be on the offensive in order to benefit from it however the bosses in elden ring are some of the most aggressive bosses that have ever graced the soulsborne series they often leave very little window for you to take advantage of especially if you use strengthbased slow weapon you might need to keep dodging the bosss flurries of attacks before you get to poke it once with your ultra greatsword before going back to dodging again this is in direct contrast with the posture system because you are encouraged to be aggressive yet you often cant this led to some players opting to grind out as many levels as they could before fighting boss so that they can simply trade hits with it and win with their raw stats in my opinion this is horrible combat design many bosses have animations that are specifically designed to trick you into dodging early which i do not mind in itself but it does get tiresome when every single boss and their mother starts to do itanother thing to note is that bosses will longer follow through any predetermined combos what i mean is that boss may terminate their combo once they detect you have gotten too far away for them to hit so instead of finishing their combo they would simply stop and reset this further reduces the windows of opportunity that players have to get some damage in the difference between what the player can do versus what the enemies can do in my opinion again have exceeded what constitutes as fair but challenging you are again encouraged to wear heavy armour with high poise so you can just trade hits with bossesspeaking of bosses it seems to that they reuse boss enemies little too often take for instance the godskin duo you get to fight the skinny one you get the fight the fat one you get to fight the spirit version of the skinny one you get to fight the spirit version of the skinny one and then the spirit version of the fat one you get to fight the skinny one along with the fat one you probably end up fighting the godskins over or close to 10 times throughout the gamei know that this is not your traditional action games like the dmc series or nioh but i think the combat system of the soulsborne series deserves better revamp than just adding in the ability to jump however the innate flaw of the combat system alone is not what made wanting to give it bad review i think one can still argue that the essence of soulsborne game lies within the clunky gameplay the buggy camera is part of the challenge as some have arguedwhat truly made not wanting to leave positive review is on the technical side the game advertises coop play with friends yet it still uses the exact same clunky summon system from previous games during coop you lose your ability to ride your horse which was one of the more heavily advertised features of the game mind you and had to travel through the vast open world on foot want to travel to somewhere that one of your friends still havent explored you got ta run there with them sometimes you encounter fog walls on the edge of zones that you have to dismiss all your summoned friends before you may cross it and you have to resummon your friends again just inches away from where they left you just so you may cross that fog wall why man justwhy this alone is not bad enough to discourage coop play the server horrible connection issues i would be sitting right next to my partner as she tries to summon and disconnecting from her world completely randomly or at least as it appears to this paired with the need to constantly summon and resummon gets tedious very quickly once you finally get it working and you are playing with your friends other players get to invade you i know that this is feature that been presence for forever in the soulsborne series but i serious believe that the game is better off without it passive play as it always been is the king in any form of pvp in the soulsborne series the world of elden ring is tough so venturing into difficult enemies npcs with hostile player keep on spamming weapon art that takes away 23 of your hp is nothing but frustrating so the host and their summons would just stay near to the bonfire or grace in this game and not progress the level the invader being constantly outnumbered is also encouraged to hide behind enemies so that they have better winning chance this leads to the absurd sometimes hilarious situations where one does anything once an invasion happens both parties are waiting for the other side to lose their patience first once players actually happen to fight each other lag determines huge portion of the outcome i have turned off crossregion play and yet i could still hit someone 5 times and not see any effects only to have them die seemingly from nothing few seconds later the pvp in this game is very much broken and i believe removing this aspect completely would be overall beneficialanother huge point of frustration for about elden ring is the huge input lag and action queue window the soulsborne series run on the same fairly dated engine and its problems are more obvious than ever the enemies in this game moves fast very fast you need to time your dodge timer well even though you have about 05 seconds of iframes because the moment you press your dodge button is not when your character dodges the seemingly minor input lag is very noticeable and it screws up your timing just enough for you to fail your dodge did i mention about the bad pc optimization when your framerate drops it sometimes makes you unable to control your character and you would die to the most obvious attacks because you can not input command to dodge this leads to action queue which is perhaps my biggest gripe this game queues your actions for instance you can initiate command to dodge but get hit by an attack perhaps because you dodged too late and the game queues that dodge command so that is acted upon as soon as your character becomes free this leads to the absurd situation where you get hit by an attack and your character dodges automatically after being hit often at the wrong time without any additional input from you and dies because you dodged again at bad time all this because you were fraction of second too late on your initial dodge this seems to can not be intentional even though action queue been presence in all the previous games it is by far most noticeable in elden ring other soulsborne games come anywhere closei have ranted long enough and if you somehow made it through my entire post thank you for reading the review of nobody again i want to say that this game is absolutely fantastic in the aspects that it does well in the reason i am leaving negative review is because it could have been so much more again thank you for reading go buy elden ring
AspectosNegativos: ['Combate con diseño cuestionable', 'Reutilización excesiva de jefes', 'Problemas técnicos como lag de entrada y cola de acciones']

Contenido: yes you mustve heard and seen various of visual bugs and glitches and hard bugs that prevent quest completion so ill try not to talk about that and focus more on the actual gameplay and why you shouldnt waste your time and money on this game but let first briefly confirm that yes these bugs are atrocious absolutely immersion breaking i mean in the supposed year 2077 when i call my vehicle this autonomous smart machine comes and run over if i dont move out the way wtf i guess id be lucky if it doesnt spawn on top of other vehicle and explode or pass by without stopping or spawn but stop 5 full screens away from so i have to run to it or if it somehow not manage to do any of mentioned above i promise you it will spawn the exact opposite direction youre trying to go so you have to do u turn but i digress1 this game lies to you it gives you impression that its open world but its not the outer edges of map contain next to nothing and texture gets noticeably worse as u get farther out and eventually teleports you back into playable part of map many stores and buildings that have doors are locked ones that are open are actually tied to main quest or side questgigs so its not an open map but big closed map 90 side quests are basically extended fetch quests or playing messenger nothing intuitive or interesting you have to drive some npcs here and there but its nothing to drool over theres nothing to do in the overworld its filled with useless empty npcs who runs away screaming if you jump near themb your choices dont really matter it barely matters which lifepath you choose you only play 1 hour worth in the beginning for each lifepath and rest is the same except for some dialogue options but even that doesnt matter because theres only one real dialogue options most of the time game likes to give you impression that youre building out your own story but you are stuck in narrow tracks of predetermined drama its cool but its not what was promised or advertised you can choose whichever dialogue options its the same outcome now some quests are pick or b and if you pick one other disappears but that too doesnt really matter because what matters is what you pick for the last main quest this game was advertised as being able to beat by only playing side quests thats lie you cant there are 5 side questlines but to get to ending credits you have to do the main quest now that wouldnt have bothered if it wasnt advertised as such you cant kill any of the quest npcs theres interesting way to complete the quests other than the one way it was meant to be completed boooorrrrrinnng why not let fail the quest by killing the npc why not let kill children in the game and balance that by having some ultra negative buff that doesnt go away or expensive to get rid of why not let make these terrible choices and deal with it you dont have any freedom in this rpg2 dumb mechanics one of most common sidequestgig is go there kill them but killing them all does not complete the quest in order to complete you must find and open the item called shards in this game which is basically scroll that contains wall of text text which you wont give two crap about it provides lore just boring same generic text and if you dont read it or dont find itor cant because game didnt spawn it most annoying bug then the quest remains uncompleted even though that quest location longer contains any enemies you were supposed to eliminate soooo dumbb if you played witcher 3 then you know about the useless mechanic of crafting which you barely touched well in cyberpunk the dumb mechanic that one sane actually cared or wanted is back with vengeance now if you want to craft good stuff you have to invest your level50 is max but in most play through youd get to 2040 and skill points i mean i have to take level points and skillpoints on being able to craft rare and legendary etc wtf this design choice only make sense if this was some mmo rpg where you can sell your crafted stuff to other players but thats not the case in this singleplayer if you level up crafting your weapon proficiency will be dogcrap but hey you can always respec skillpoints with cheap price of only 100000 _ really and you cant respect levelpoints so gl with thatc lets talk skills theyre the most generic unfun set of skills ive seen in rpg game most of them are just percentage gains1 or 10 etc of base stats like hp or dmg while wielding different weapon types thats it you cant do any unique fun builds your only choice is go for dmg and hp or be useless craftsman playing this game taught something though next time im thinking about buying game first check out the skill tree itd be good indicator of how fun or boring your character will be to play ive learned valuable lessond items are bland 99 items dont do anything interesting only thing youre looking for is dps just take the higher dmg and move on there wont be any cool interaction with skills and items other than percentage boost in proficiency in that said weapon or item i dont care for legendary item that does nothing cool or exceptional and is lower dmg or armor than my uncommon item why would i ever use that and be careful im not sure if this is intended but you cant remove modifications on weapons once you slot them babies in there they are in there for good you can replace with another mods but that destroys previous mod but that mod is only increase anyway soe hope you enjoy elevator rides because theres ââââ ton of them in this game once i got to top floor of building via elevator but i wanted to skip the long elevator sequence so i tried to jump downnot falling far enough for fall dmg until you get to point where it instakills you for being out of bounds again not open worldf the teleporting cops if you commit crime in this game police will spawn behind you like some teleporting mage it doesnt matter if youre out in the open public area or secluded hallways of abandoned apartment you can count on cops to know the exact moment you commit crime and come try to kill you even though when gang npcs are shooting at each other and nothing is happening you the main character is always on big brother watch this cop mechanic seems like such afterthought implementation my disappointment level is over 9000 oh and dont try to get close to them they instaaggro you and try to kill you for even approaching whatg stealth ai is stupid af yup stealth is so arbitrary like how do you not see right next to you but you still use it anyway cuz it gives extra dmg derph terrible ai you punch civilian and they all disappear out of thin air enemies just stand there and watch you kill his buddy coupled this with bad stealth you have yourself some pathetically amusing fights but its more pathetic than amusing though feelsbadmantldrskyrim which was masterpiece by all means came out 9 years ago did everything better than cyberpunkdont play this game it will not be worth it if youre really really bored wait til massive sale but hey at least it looks nice right on pc that is rip console users
