Contenido: whether you want to be vigilante pig killer or you just want to drive your motor around and using walking civilians as ramp night city it alli am writing this review on november 22nd 2021 after the 131 patchthis game didnt have good start did it but for the biggest part its all fixed now there are still some bugs but in most cases they are just visualto be honest they are quite ridiculously funny imagine driving alongside character and then you witness the character start spinning to 360 degrees its limbs around like it was possessed by some demonin way cp2077 became family for you know you somewhat hate some of your relatives but you still love them in another way right well thats cp2077 for mewhat do we know cp2077 is just too ahead of its time in the future when we will have implants real life the entire world will be buggy and glitchy this game is just immersiveit took some few good hours to learn to love the game and i would say i am very happy i didnt give up on itfor the sake of not wasting much of your time with this review i will start with the badas i said above as far as bugs go its pretty stable and i didnt really encounter anything that was majorobviously people are different so this is purely my opinion but i dont like how the car driving feels in this game it feels too stiff and unnatural it might be just because i am used to oldschool car driving lets say gta 3nfs anything before nfs 5 porsche driving bike on the other hand is amazing its what i use most of the times another thing that is somewhat annoying the waypointing system is somewhat bad the routes you get arent the most efficient ones and often your objective isnt appearing on the floor it really is so you end up searching for something and then realize it might be in some hidden basement or something the ui seems to be bit cluttered and confusing and it takes bit to get used to or maybe i am just getting old but i feel like theres point in overcomplicating things the overall mechanics or however you want to call them feel somewhat mediocre but its fine by the game compensates with other stuff you can not edit your facialbody featurestattoos once you press that button thats how youll be stuck for life one more thing and this probably was my biggest oof about the game was that the assault rifles are pretty awfulpistols good revolvers great sniper rifles and melee weapons amazing but the assault rifles are just bad and inefficient even shotguns are decent but what about the good partswhile this section might have less of these bulletpoints theyre the pillar of this game the ultimate moneyshotthe world is so big you will feel like frog in the ural mountains you will feel so smallits quite an interesting feeling that i could never get from any game before for this thing made the game so much more immersiveits beautiful game with purely astonishing views amazing world details and such but the size of it all too so many streets alleys not to mention if you go climbing like goat on all the buildings in my opinion if youre into walking simulators this alone could be worth your eddies ie moneythe story is more than decent it avoids some of the most boring cliches although its not anything mindblowingfriendships and relationships come and go in odd ways depending on how you make your decisions i think its pretty rare to actually feel like your decisions really affect people in games to feel like youre actually influence someone realoften when i had to make decisions i was encountering dillemas such as hm cmon this dude is decent fella i shouldnt be to him and well i usually dont overthink that kind of stuff in game lolthe game is modders paradise if youre into that the internet is full of tutorials and content they arent very finicky to install however updates usually tend to mess with themdid i mention side gigs theres plenty of them but also random events happening around as you walk such as groups of gang members commiting dumb stuff obviously you can go past them but would you after this game will suck you in you wont be able to stop sinking hours in itwhile were on this subject my advice would be to not rush into the story i kinda did and i am not very happy about it and enjoy some of these side stuff first besides leveling up and getting cool stuff which will aid you in the main missions later its also the best way to get to know the gametheres so many references and easter eggs some subtle some not so subtle especially if youre from eastern europeyou can play the game any way you want you can go the boring route nonlethal and stealthy or you can go in guns blazing and not leave one single cell in an enemys body alive of course combination between all of these options is also possibility but i like to keep it simplei do wish it was more fun to play in stealth while i usually am not the stealthy kind of gamer i can and do appreciate game with good stealth cp2077 doesnt have good nor bad stealth its just average i guesswith this i mean purely by how it feels for to play it in stealth you do get to be very creative in stealth you have interesting ways to mess with the enemies and distract them but the satisfaction just isnt there for meultimately its game that will suck you in you will have fun for hours the world is purely amazing youll feel like woah all the time closing notes and random useless blabberingi initially bought this game on preorder i was angry about the delays before i got the chance to play it at the release my pc died now after 1 year i finally get to play it i know its better that i didnt play it at launch but its about the principlei am happy with my purchase and for the price i paid one night out in the city i might have an alcohol problem though i had and still have lot of fun even if i already saw 2 endings i am not letting my grip of it i dont even remember when i was so caught in game that i played it without break until the sun was risingprobably i will go for full completion 60h in this game passed so fast and theres still plenty of juice in this babyas far as the developers go i know they got lot of poo thrown at them but theyre people and they make mistakes and they werent lazy i would say things went wrong because of the team leadingresource management but thats another subject and quite irrelevant point is their hearts are in the right place and they fixed majority of issues and they still are working on the gamemaybe i am being too soft about the situation but it is what it is i cant say i am not disappointed because its not how i expected the game to be after how it was marketed prerelease but i also like to believe i have some common sense and ability to make the best out of situationseditafter putting around 150h in this game i must say there were few more bugs i encountered but nothing major except i once fell through the map and the game reloaded from the last checkpointv stands for vendetta for vigilantism for vanity for virility it stands for anything your heart vvants
AspectosPositivos: ['Mundo inmersivo', 'Detalles asombrosos', 'Variedad de actividades secundarias']
AspectosNegativos: ['Conducción de vehículos', 'Sistema de marcado de objetivos', 'Mecánicas mediocres']

Contenido: here it is ladies and gentlemen our 8 years long waiting is over cyberpunk 2077 is finally here and it turned out to be disappoint pretty big one too well if youre console player you can actually call it full scale disaster thanks to completely broken ports which at the moment i write this were even pulled from ps store but console ports are different story here and now i want to talk about pc version and pc version alone just because you know steam reviews have character limit so yeah matter what you do do not pay for console version but here in steam ill share my thoughts on pc releaselike i said this game is big disappoint for years weve followed cd projekts updates and dreamed about perfect cyberpunk experience and what did we get in the end well pretty much nothing really the funniest thing about cyberpunk 2077 is that theres close to gameplay in it simple like that if youve expected an rpg experience you should forget about it long before starting with this game it is not an rpg not that cd projekt promised us an rpg feel free to check the official description in steam the game is advertised as open world actionadventure but still quite lot of people expected cyberpunk take on good ol witcher 3 while this game it is not witcher long story short its firstperson shooter with cars that takes place in an open world environment and is mixed with chooseyourownadventurelike elements thats pretty much itnot like the formula is big problem by itself quite the opposite i found it quite nice i mean why bloody not right everybody loved deus ex series why not to give us an actionpacked version of it in proper open world environment i mean technically mankind divided was an open world game too but lets just face it the open world there was just gimmick so actionoriented deus ex with proper open world sounds good to and even though huge cyberpunk rpg still sounds like beautiful dream its not like we didnt have any choices in deus ex while this game adds to the formula by including as many of such choices as possible so whats wrong here why all the disappointment let explainfirst for 314000000 game its laughably rough and unpolished the action parts feel like cheap secondgrade fps while driving sigh yeah about bloody driving lets just say you wont be able to use cars in the city without suffering outside the city problem feel free to have fun with your wheels there because theres nobody there but in the city itself its better to either walk or use the quick travel why because you touch anything you instantly get wanted status which means that suddenly therell be an army of cops shooting at you and since its yet another one of those games in which ai is suicidal maniac and pretty much everybody would try to jump in front of your car like i said cars city nobut even that isnt the biggest problem weve seen rough weve survived the bloody stalker sure we can deal with cyberpunk the real problem is there isnt much to do here like at all you either do quests or well thats pretty much it sure there are optional activities here but all of them are the same exact thing simple like that you enter the zone and either kill somebody or access the computer for the experience repeat until out of patience thats it nothing else here even proper collectibles well aside from deck of tarot cards but those hardly feel like the real deal not like i miss all that collectible disaster from the assassins creed series but honestly night city is so empty that youll want to cry remember how many stuff gta series had well forget about that here you cant even change your appearance youre done choosing your genitals which is thing now at the beginning thats it barber shops tattoo salons even though there is way to apply couple of tattoos as some sort of reward gang wars you cant even join faction properly nothing night city is just that bunch of story missions end of the story should i say that it sucks i mean seriously 314000000 for pretty basic chooseyourownadventure experience how why i smell some serious bull here i really wonder if adam kiciński and randy pitchford are friend now because thats how it feels here seriously what did they do with all the money i mean aside from paying keanuthats where things starting to feel good though because story in this game its bloody masterpiece and even though usually im john carmack kind of guy who believes that story in games isnt really that important i totally had blast with cyberpunk unlike witcher 3 character here dont waste your time talking about nothing sure theyll still talk quite lot but the writing here is so rich and full of details that it feels awesome i didnt feel so personally involved with the characters since detroit become human when you play cyberpunk its just impossible not to care and since matter what youll do there wont be perfect ending for everybody the impact is even bigger like detroit cyberpunk makes you think about it for quite some time after you finish it which will take up to 100 hours but only if youre up for 100 completion with all the achievements if all you want is main storyline itll be like 50 hourstrust though youll want to do optional quests i mean quests not those crappy activities the optional quests here theyre at least as good as the main story some of them are even better actually so nicely written so full of details so perfectly directed awesome stuff its just those dont really feel like optional stuff especially since theyre directly connected to the choices youll have at the end in other words optional quests are not really optional awesome but not optionalunfortunately like i said aside from those quests night city cant offer you anything literally anything aside from unpolished fps sequences open world here its gimmick proper rpg experience proper exploration proper activities like i said this game nothing only some shooting and some basic chooseyourownadventurelike choices thats it thats the entire game unlike many others i didnt experience single major bug during my playthrough was playing since the moment the game was launched and man does it look breathtaking even though the optimization is horrible the game comes with some brilliant textures fantastic hdr and beautiful ray tracing but lets just admit it eight years 314000000 keanu reeves something this basic is not what we all expectedso i dont know i dont want to give this game thumb down just because personally well i loved it here said it even though i dont have tendency to treat video game characters like real people the characters in cyberpunk 2077 became like family to the writing in cyberpunk is that awesome and i sure treasure my memories here but when its about gameplay cyberpunk 2077 is rough shallow empty and overall disappointing game remember the first xenus aka boiling point road to hell add godlike writing and thatll be it so at the end of the day i have only one question what did they do with the bloody money
AspectosPositivos: ['Historia']
AspectosNegativos: ['Gráficos', 'Jugabilidad', 'Contenido']

Contenido: let just start by saying that if you like this game youve won the argument by virtue of enjoying something im struggling to if youre having fun thats great if youre besotted with the world thats fair and youre not wrong nothing in this review is intended to piss off the hive i just have to write about the impressions i honestly feelcyberpunk 2077 is game that is unforgivably marred by one thing and one thing only overpromotion thesis could be written on how audacious cyberpunks marketing been the hype train is of course not all cdprs fault but the false promises are releasing too early and expecting you to pay 50 for the privilege of being an unofficial beta tester is look i work in marketing so i know how it goes but when you promise so much and know you cant deliver on it and change your marketing material in order to refer to the game as an actionadventure rather than an rpg before release well it doesnt sit right with if ubisoft had done this i would have blown my top i have to stay consistentlet make this clear i was not on the hype train for this game hype makes feel nervous and i try to deaden myself to it im also realistic i understood that it takes more for game to be developed in the currentgen to offer truly nextgeneration experience and found it miracle that red dead redemption 2 by contrast was so incredibly detailed and complex if less dense than this title im also not stickler for bugs i know theyll get patched and fixed and that performance will improve what i did expect however is what was promised in this game there is advanced vehicle ai which means police chases simply can not happen thats system that was present in grand theft auto vice city npcs are lifeless and are barely worth interacting with the world strong art direction and can look quite beautiful at times but its far from breathing and routinely feels shallow and tired thanks to how repetitive and basic the npc and traffic routines are it reminds of mafia game where the open world is just set dressing serving effectively as long loading screen as you move from place to place but this isnt how the game was marketed from the offset they outright promised sandbox rpg featuring incredibly dense and novel npc interactions and narrative paths i didnt buy into everything they said of course but when your world is even less impressive than the last watch dogs game i have to wonder whats going onthe gunplay is punchy despite the inconsistent ballistics the upgrade tree is relatively cool if deceptively limited and the momenttomoment gameplay is all just serviceable its not an rpg i find to be particularly deep this is somewhat moot point but theres little gameplay here you havent already seen achieved more competently in titles like sleeping dogs deus ex and fallout driving feels dated as if the vehicles have substantial momentum to them its the little details that are truly noticeable like v not even sleeping correctly in his bed or qol considerations like the lack of dedicated walk button on keyboard that culminates in making the game feel average at best i have idea what happened with the life paths i was led to believe they would be as long and impactful as the origin stories in dragon age origins but theyre just 20minute starter sequences geared to introduce you to the world at breakneck speed they feel like cut contentthe good stuff here involves both the reliably impressive writing and story sequences yet thanks to the limited input you have for roleplaying it regularly feels like youre watching very cool television show its nowhere near as reactive and dynamic i had hoped not even half as much as the witcher 2 if this game only featured its story front and centre i would have given this positive review however it doesnt and i cant give thumbs up for undercooked ambition or good writing when its less than 25 of the experience especially with all this mediocre fluff surrounding it i say that even as someone who is willing to tolerate much for good story the amazing sequences you see are ironically those that would make for the best trailerbait and oh boy did theycyberpunks writing is far from perfect though especially in its presentation and pacing im never provided the means to care about v at all thanks to his introductory montage youre given relationships professional contacts and criminal reputation in the space of around two minutes its hard to get your bearings compare this to kingdom come deliverance where the horrific origins of henrys developing heroism are fullyplayable rooted grounded in your humble status it helps you build your own relationship to his ambition ambition that stays with you throughout the game theres nothing like that herea side note its very easy to assume that its the fault of those who are heavily involved in watching the press cycle for getting their own hopes up buying into every oped andor preview carefully curated to generate clicks and escalating excitement for the game unfortunately you would also have to be blind to the design patterns and trends of the last ten years to not see how derivative the vast majority of cyberpunks systems are its not bad thing to be derivative not always but if youve marketed your game as being anything but that from day one well people are going to noticei have doubt this game will improve in the next year in terms of its optimisation performance bugsquashing and maybe even additional content for now i would advise onthefence newcomers to steer well clear i would also recommend that you stay sceptical of people who want to lambast absolutely everything in this game as well as those who somehow think critical impressions are misguided at best or hate at worst certain elements of this game have been crafted with noticeable care and heartfelt attention to detail such as the side quests which can show real glimpses of brilliance i imagine few of the actual developers want to strangle the marketing and management teams right now and trust i get iti would have likely brushed this off as fine sometimes aboveaverage game ignoring the bugs and lack of innovative features as simply par for the course i may have given it positive review if it were honestly janky but featurecomplete closer to the promises we were given what i cant do is positively review product sold under wilfully and repeatedly false pretences thats weird for because i dont usually take principled stand if you can label cringe review as that i didnt much care about epic strongarming their way into the market for instance im not entirely sure how much of this ad campaign was straight deception on cdprs part and how much of it was comprised of wellwishing narratives that exploded out of control magnified by the sacred reputation gamers had anointed them with all while they found their feet in new and strange genre for whatever reason this time it feels odious maybe im just getting old

Contenido: let just start by saying that if you like this game youve won the argument by virtue of enjoying something im struggling to if youre having fun thats great if youre besotted with the world thats fair and youre not wrong nothing in this review is intended to piss off the hive i just have to write about the impressions i honestly feelcyberpunk 2077 is game that is unforgivably marred by one thing and one thing only overpromotion thesis could be written on how audacious cyberpunks marketing been the hype train is of course not all cdprs fault but the false promises are releasing too early and expecting you to pay 50 for the privilege of being an unofficial beta tester is look i work in marketing so i know how it goes but when you promise so much and know you cant deliver on it and change your marketing material in order to refer to the game as an actionadventure rather than an rpg before release well it doesnt sit right with if ubisoft had done this i would have blown my top i have to stay consistentlet make this clear i was not on the hype train for this game hype makes feel nervous and i try to deaden myself to it im also realistic i understood that it takes more for game to be developed in the currentgen to offer truly nextgeneration experience and found it miracle that red dead redemption 2 by contrast was so incredibly detailed and complex if less dense than this title im also not stickler for bugs i know theyll get patched and fixed and that performance will improve what i did expect however is what was promised in this game there is advanced vehicle ai which means police chases simply can not happen thats system that was present in grand theft auto vice city npcs are lifeless and are barely worth interacting with the world strong art direction and can look quite beautiful at times but its far from breathing and routinely feels shallow and tired thanks to how repetitive and basic the npc and traffic routines are it reminds of mafia game where the open world is just set dressing serving effectively as long loading screen as you move from place to place but this isnt how the game was marketed from the offset they outright promised sandbox rpg featuring incredibly dense and novel npc interactions and narrative paths i didnt buy into everything they said of course but when your world is even less impressive than the last watch dogs game i have to wonder whats going onthe gunplay is punchy despite the inconsistent ballistics the upgrade tree is relatively cool if deceptively limited and the momenttomoment gameplay is all just serviceable its not an rpg i find to be particularly deep this is somewhat moot point but theres little gameplay here you havent already seen achieved more competently in titles like sleeping dogs deus ex and fallout driving feels dated as if the vehicles have substantial momentum to them its the little details that are truly noticeable like v not even sleeping correctly in his bed or qol considerations like the lack of dedicated walk button on keyboard that culminates in making the game feel average at best i have idea what happened with the life paths i was led to believe they would be as long and impactful as the origin stories in dragon age origins but theyre just 20minute starter sequences geared to introduce you to the world at breakneck speed they feel like cut contentthe good stuff here involves both the reliably impressive writing and story sequences yet thanks to the limited input you have for roleplaying it regularly feels like youre watching very cool television show its nowhere near as reactive and dynamic i had hoped not even half as much as the witcher 2 if this game only featured its story front and centre i would have given this positive review however it doesnt and i cant give thumbs up for undercooked ambition or good writing when its less than 25 of the experience especially with all this mediocre fluff surrounding it i say that even as someone who is willing to tolerate much for good story the amazing sequences you see are ironically those that would make for the best trailerbait and oh boy did theycyberpunks writing is far from perfect though especially in its presentation and pacing im never provided the means to care about v at all thanks to his introductory montage youre given relationships professional contacts and criminal reputation in the space of around two minutes its hard to get your bearings compare this to kingdom come deliverance where the horrific origins of henrys developing heroism are fullyplayable rooted grounded in your humble status it helps you build your own relationship to his ambition ambition that stays with you throughout the game theres nothing like that herea side note its very easy to assume that its the fault of those who are heavily involved in watching the press cycle for getting their own hopes up buying into every oped andor preview carefully curated to generate clicks and escalating excitement for the game unfortunately you would also have to be blind to the design patterns and trends of the last ten years to not see how derivative the vast majority of cyberpunks systems are its not bad thing to be derivative not always but if youve marketed your game as being anything but that from day one well people are going to noticei have doubt this game will improve in the next year in terms of its optimisation performance bugsquashing and maybe even additional content for now i would advise onthefence newcomers to steer well clear i would also recommend that you stay sceptical of people who want to lambast absolutely everything in this game as well as those who somehow think critical impressions are misguided at best or hate at worst certain elements of this game have been crafted with noticeable care and heartfelt attention to detail such as the side quests which can show real glimpses of brilliance i imagine few of the actual developers want to strangle the marketing and management teams right now and trust i get iti would have likely brushed this off as fine sometimes aboveaverage game ignoring the bugs and lack of innovative features as simply par for the course i may have given it positive review if it were honestly janky but featurecomplete closer to the promises we were given what i cant do is positively review product sold under wilfully and repeatedly false pretences thats weird for because i dont usually take principled stand if you can label cringe review as that i didnt much care about epic strongarming their way into the market for instance im not entirely sure how much of this ad campaign was straight deception on cdprs part and how much of it was comprised of wellwishing narratives that exploded out of control magnified by the sacred reputation gamers had anointed them with all while they found their feet in new and strange genre for whatever reason this time it feels odious maybe im just getting old

Contenido: funny enough even the review portion of the game page on steam is bugged right now which pretty well sums up how this game went everyone heard all the controversy about bugs and performance issues and everything along those lines but what shocks is how little the complete mediocrity of the game itself seems to be overlooked by people saying well the story is goodi think william gibson summed it up best in his tweet 2 years before the game was even released the trailer for cyberpunk 2077 strikes as gta skinnedover with generic 80s retrofuture but hey thats just thats really all this game is city with people wearing neon and the same 15 advertisements plastered everywhere in hologram oooooh the future is here this game about as much in common with cyberpunk as star trek more apt description might be outrun 2077 because cyberpunk 2077 is really only cyberpunk on the surface with neon ads hacking and biomodified people and none of those things are inherently cyberpunk or even done remotely well they are retrofuture or even just common threads in scifi it seems like the people praising this game are fanboys yes but are also clearly only aware of cyberpunk as combing 80s or 90s style with futuristic setting they dont seem to be capable of actually looking beyond the bare surface of video game as compiled set of features and asking how well or poorly each box is checkedcyberpunk the genere is gritty it is dark and grungy both blade runners and the animated shorts neuromancer and its sequels and ghost in the shell 1996 are all hallmark cyberpunk works and they share set of distinct aesthetic and thematic threads which cyberpunk 2077 not only failed to address it missed entirely cyberpunk 2077 doesnt even seem to know what cyberpunk isthis game is glossy gta if gta didnt really work what hacking there is is complete joke and nothing about the city manages to live up to the key theme of the cyberpunk genere which is the collision of society with the moral implications of future technology that is what this game promised to offer more deeply than exploring city or driving or shooting or roleplaying or upgrading your character which lord knows have been beaten to death in every aaa title for the past 10 years if i wanted to steal cars commit crimes and do jobs i can go play one of dozen driving themed games which stay in their lane cyberpunk is watered down version of gta in that it seems to most closely have taken inspiration from gta v probably because of the games commercial success and does everything down to the detail less well than game which predates it by more than 7 years there are moral decisions there are decisions at all but even the element of conflicting with future technology is only briefly implied with the dilemma of johnny keanu reaves and even then its less of discussion of the actual implications of the technology and more of an action movie about someone trying to save themselvespeople praising this game may have found something endearing and sure the story isnt bad its half dialogue which basically defeats the point of video game but whatever its decently written and well acted the mechanics arent terrible the gunplay is fine the driving is mediocre but passable but these people defending the game even now seem to be holding on to some strange delusion not only about the product that was initially promised but about the constant flaunting of missed potential everywhere in this gamesee not only does cyberpunk not live up to what is present tense advertised the last minute culling of scope is present everywhere in the city as half finished mechanics like brain dance vendors and oh i dont know police chases which its not like this was hard one to decide to include in game that managed to basically boil itself down to half assed driving game not only is it clear that the scope of the game was decreased massively as crunching ensued from poor management in early development but cdpr didnt even have the wherewithal to actually remove the fragments of scrapped mechanics im looking at you locked doors and public transit entrancesthe lack of anything that really resembles the aesthetic and sort of ethereal nature of cyberpunk in cyberpunk2077 isnt only depressing because its not there but because i have hard time believing that the thing thats missing from this game along with an actually branching story and several other poorly spaghettied together systems like character progression and gear acquisition gang alliances and rivalries vehicle customistation relationships housing large chunks of the map functioning ai and pathing reasonable physics texture and model popping terrible hacking to name just few is that they arent likely to come with future patches i have hard time believing the base form of the game will get much more polish and tune up than bug fixes whether or not you agree that this game is missing the mojo it was supposed to have theres denying that the amount of things that need to be fixed in order to get this game in even the same ballpark as what was initially promised looks like another 10 year development cycle in and of itself at this point why would they even bother patching it to that extent they already sold millions of copies theres financial incentive to improve on the base game in any more ways than necessary i hope i eat my words on that but im not counting on it and at this point its almost worse if features that were promised end up showing up in future paid dlc sure theyd be there but in game that supposedly set in the corpotocratic cyberpunk future talk about ironyyou can tell this game is good and sure maybe some of its features are good i would argue you can get basically everything that this game does well much better elsewhere but game is more than the sum of its parts which even as sum this fullpriced massively anticipated mess of popsicle sticks and glue is hardly anything to gawk at but none of these things have anything in common with the clearly laid out vision of cyberpunk world and what gets so much is that one seems to be acknowledging that 90 of reviews are just discussion of features and how well x or is done with everyone looking further than their own nose to form conclusion about the product this sort of add mechaniccheck the boxbrag about it is how we end up with aaa failures time and time again this attitude towards video games as set of functions not only creates scope creep of which this game is prime example it lets developers off the hook for creating genuinely good games games which have soul the storys alright you can drive cars the voice acting is quite good but the game soul not cohesive one anyway and for game whose setting is defined by the implications of progress without bounds and the cancer of corporate greed it would almost be funny if it wasnt just so sad to see how off the mark this game really is
AspectosNegativos: ['Bugs y problemas de rendimiento', 'Mediocridad del juego', 'Falta de cumplimiento de la estética y temática del género cyberpunk', 'Mecánicas incompletas y mal ejecutadas', 'Promesas incumplidas', 'Falta de cohesión y alma en el juego']

Contenido: editcyberpunk is the most disappointing game ive ever played after 2 months to marinate on it i firmly believe this to not be good gamecdpr delayed this game multiple times supposedly because they wanted to polish it and fix various bugs i have ryzen 7 3800x and an rtx 2070 super by means the greatest of rig but i can pretty much run anything you throw at decently as i play 1080p without rtx this game graphically was fine i shot north of 7080fps routinely with dlss on however i like to run rtx so i didfirst thing fps drops are insanely common and some are so bad i have to exit out of the game and launch back in because ill hit an area downtown that gives 35fps relaunch the game and then it settles at 5560 range which is amply playable rtx is extremely buggy and not welloptimized the graphics are beautiful not what i mean but ive read horror reports of peoples 3080s getting the same fps as at 1440p 3080s yanno nvidias flagship card that is supposed to do 4k at decent 5560 max everything secondly there are lot of bugs i have encountered very few bad bugs that make restart the game but there are many minor glitches and bugs which are irritating cdpr did not delay this for the purpose of polishing their move was solely corporate in nature they wanted more muneh gameplay is very fun for at least shooting hacking etc are all relatively simple and straightforward hacking is not the complicatedindepth mechanic showed to us in 2018 and 2019 its just simple pointclick magicmana system prevalent in multiple rpgs with cyberpunkgenre twistit all gets repetive though the perkattribute system i feel was well done the character development in terms of perk choice attributes and how it ties into gameplay flows well however they deleted and cut many perks that couldve added including the blocking bullets with your sword perksthe roleplaying elements suck i play male v and his voice even when is speaking thoughtfully or compassionately feels disconnected half the time sounds like typical passive aggressive merc who could care less the other half sounds only slightly less passive aggressive v is very unlikable character matter how you play him they even take away your ability to insert yourself as this character because his real name is supposed to be vincent or valerie even mass effect let you choose shepherds first name attributebackstory based rpg decisions literally boil down to pass conversation skill check that rarely genuine impact on the narrative unlike say fallout new vegas where skill checks are primary component of the narrativealso everything you saw in the trailers is literal 2 minute montage that shows how you became night city merc character buildup entry missions nothing the narrative is exceptional in my eyes so far at least in terms of writing panam takemura are deep wellwritten thoughtful characters with significant amount of emotional depth and i am very impressed by the writing of various side jobs as well as the main storyline romances are incredibly pointless and yield little to tangible results the storytelling of the characters is great doubt but v as character is unimpressive and forgetful you do not mold nor dictate his narrative the way cdpr told you you could another lie by cdprthe world is my single greatest issue with this game good way to describe it is as wide as an ocean and as deep as puddle cdpr spoke about the verticality aspect the verticality is largely tied to jobs and missions there is not much verticality in terms of pure openworld freeroam exploration yes there are layers of the city but its largely forgetful most world events boil down to gang do bad thing kill gang get money and equipment do not expect rdr2 level immersion you will not get it that was massive mistake for i came into this game with unimaginable hype levels and expected an immersive world i could get lost in unfortunately there is very little to do outside of gigs and jobs world events are virtually nonexistent outside of gangs doing stupid in terms of openworld immersion exploration rdr2 blows this out of the water contest this game immersionnight city is deceptively beautiful as it is visually and aesthetically pleasing game world but it doesnt rank in my top 10 gameworlds to actually play in weirdly enough i got more immersion from far cry 5s hope county than i did cyberpunks night cityyou cant even go to plastic surgeon or hairdresser in game with the core premise being body modification be happy with the way your character looks in the creation menu because once you launch the game thats it i am sure cdpr will change this at some point by adding in free contentedit change or plans for change like this so far that ive heardcyberware does not have the humanityethics concern to it when you use it cyberware is largely glorified stat and ability boostersgivers people were talking about minimal cyberware playthroughs for the sake of ethics and how it could affect the narrative it doesntcyberpunks music however is second to none and simply fantasticoverall this is an average title i enjoyed my time but i will not play this title again this games problem which many foresaw was the unimaginable hype that was built around it hype that was not matchable with the games final product i am sure cdpr will fix the technical issues as time goes by edit so far barelyi went into this game expecting 1010 masterpiece that will change the game that is not what i goti would give this title cyberpunk 2077 610 is this masterpiece is this goty is it an average game with good story and horrible management yes edit the main story is absolutely phenomenal this is one of the best stories ive had the pleasure of being part of cyberpunk 2077 despite its technical flaws and gameplay woes in terms of content provided an exceptionally memorable storyline and memorable characters story 910 characters 910 gameplay 810graphics 910immersion 210technical 210open world 510music 910overall 610edit i have to change this to not recommended simply because of the price and the lack of content available this story is worth experiencing but not at the price they are advertising because this game replayability value wait for half off get this game for like 2999 but in its current state with bad glitches bugs and total lack of content and severe lies by cdpr i can not recommend this title at 5999double edit i really go back and forth with this game sometimes i feel its horrific disappointment other times i feel its an okay game gameplay is fun but very repetitivewriting is decentstory is funworld is beautifulmost unimmersive open world ive ever playedworst ai ive seen in yearsoptimization sucksthis is not the worst game ive ever player however this is without doubt the most disappointing game ive ever played not worth buying its beyond the bugs and the technical issues this game is incomplete and total mirage
AspectosNegativos: ['Bugs y glitches', 'Falta de contenido', 'Hype excesivo', 'Incompleto', 'Mala gestión por parte de CDPR']

Contenido: heres the straighttothepoint n dirty toptobottom almostentirely spoilerfree version of cyberpunk 2077 at present after 60 hours of playtime ignore the extra 12 paused the game and forgot to shut it down before i went to bed one night is cyberpunk 2077 finished game absolutely not the ammo limit inventory limit and airandomlybreaking bugs are all very small but critical issues that need to be fixed ill expand upon these below is cyberpunk fully playable absolutely is cyberpunk 2077 fun you bet your ass it is is cyberpunk 2077 worth regular price atpresent id say so if youre someone who only plays for the story and doesnt care about doing side missions then youre going to get the absolute minimum out of cyberpunk 2077 as the game been built from the ground up with plethora of extra story content locked behind side mission decisionscompletion and on top of recommending you learn to actually enjoy games properly id also recommend you wait for cyberpunk 2077 to go on sale if thats the case but if you play games properly and enjoy exploring doing side missions and just generally messing about with ooh shiny icons on the map youll absolutely get your moneys worth from cyberpunk 2077 even at its current full price okay so whys everyone complaining about the game so the game some minor issues such as graphical issues during the cutscene sequencesanimations i say cutscene even though the game doesnt have any actual cutscenes to refer to moments where you become lockedinplace and can only look and select dialogue such as when youre with evelyn in judys bd basement theres sequence where evelyn gets out of her chair to walk over to judy only she doesnt actually animate out of the sitting position until shes 75 of the distance through her walk so for the first 34ths of the walk shes doing some harry potter seatedfloating magic or when youre in the taxi with jackie on the way to meet dex after getting shot up during the heist jackie goes to pull the biochip out of his head to give it to you except the animation forgets to remove his pistol so you see literally half of the barrel of his handgun protruding out the opposite side of his head and few more cases like this as the game progresses theres also the aforementioned issues with ammo limitsmanagement you have hardcap of 100 shotgun shells 100 sniper rounds 500 handgun and 700 rifle rounds only the game doesnt actually indicate this anywhere you have to test to figure it out or read other people complaining about it on forums who did their own testing where when you pick up craft or buy ammo above those limits the game will happily take your crafting components or money fill you to the limit and then just vaporize everything above that limit it doesnt drop on the ground it doesnt give you refund it doesnt even give you an error notice just poof already have maximum ammo great youre still able to waste your crafting components money crafting or buying more but its still going to just cease to exist with refund or warningthen the inventory management issue almost identical to ammo management you have maximum carrying capacity based on weight which thankfully can be increased through various means that the game does actually tell you about so whats the problem you can continue to craft pick up equipment above your maximum carrying capacity the game wont give you any notice or error it doesnt just drop excess equipment it just completely erases it found sweet legendary piece of gear in chest and picked it up when your inventory was already full apparently doesnt drop doesnt automatically get decrafted into components doesnt refuse to pick it up or even give you so much as courtesy warning it gets picked up the game realises that it doesnt fit in your remaining inventory space and just completely erases it from the game this is something i wouldnt even expect from firsttime indie developer much less cd projekt redthen theres also the notuncommon issue of enemy ai just completely breaking theyll be fighting running moving doing their thing and then just randomly break they stop moving stop shooting stop responding even if you shoot them or hit them with grenade they basically turn into boxingsparring dollthen lastbutnotleast the broken scrapper perk automatically disassembles all junk into components sounds great right but read on which doesnt have any filter for the valuable junk which is worth 750 and not just 3 and will happily disassemble them as well with way to turn it off besides complete skill reset which costs 100000 seriously guys you couldnt create tagword in the code for jewelry or even just an extra tab called jewelry or valuables to avoid this issue thankfully i had the foresight to avoid this particular issue myself by not getting the perk but ive read legions of lessmindful folks complaining about this on every game forum known to man since the game releasedwhich loops us back to the original why are people complaining long story short for those who dont already know massive expectations were dropped on the actual developers by the suitsupstairs at cd projekt red an unrealistic release date was set by the suits as all the developers flat out said this isnt possible this release date was pushed back several times as the suitsupstairs realized yep theyre right but we can still crunch it to this time period after several delays vocal group of potential consumers complained and whined and cried and pressured cd projekt red into releasing game that they flat out knew wasnt ready only to appease fans who then cried when loandbehold the game wasnt perfect and entirely finished the things they complained about had to be the 3 things i just mentioned because otherwise the game feels complete and most of the negative reviews dont actually cite any specific issue they just cry about how bad the game is its so terrible its not finished okay yes but howanyways the game supposedly based on some online articles cant personally verify if theyre true or not yet but i did see there were multiple possible options to go down different ending paths so theres at least few 6 distinct endings so you get lot of control over how things go down depending on your actions throughout the game mainly choices in certain sidequests as well as having to have completed certain side quests to unlock certain endings the city feels incredibly alive theres people everywhere you see ais regularly talk to eachother and with the infinitelygenerated ncpd combat minimissions and the plethora of sidemissions theres always something to do in almost every corner of the city seriously the only people getting bored in night city are people who either arent into fpss or who dont enjoy games properly and just blatantly ignore side quests and only focus on the main storyanyways thats my bit maybe ill see around at the afterlife kid stay safe out there
AspectosPositivos: ['Inmersión en el mundo de Night City', 'Variedad de misiones secundarias', 'Control sobre el desarrollo de la historia']
AspectosNegativos: ['Problemas de animaciones y bugs', 'Limitaciones en gestión de inventario y munición', 'IA enemiga inconsistente']

Contenido: i think after 249 hours and three full runs through the game and seeing the wide array of potential endings i can safely say i feel i certainly got my moneys worth with cyberpunk 2077 i bet you just glanced up to confirm i selected not recommended and you would be correct i did and i did it with heavy heartthe glorythere are countless moments where you see the raw passion in the art of making this game the many layers of architecture throughout the city the attention to detail in the vehicles the first time you run into random nameless npc just strumming guitar in sync to the music you hear them playing the rich and vibrant details to how the world works as explained in the opening sequences of the game the oversaturation of detail in every dark bright dirty clean and everything inbetween corner i genuinely feel i am playing work of art in video game form and that is rare praise from methe realityits work of art that you shouldnt look at too closely its problems start to show when you get too close can you blitz the game in half an hour yes but then youve missed 90 of the content it genuinely feels so rich yet so hollow the way sidecontent is delivered is the hollow throw darts on the map at random and expect the player to want to head to their respective markers this is quite boring however once youre there the mission is revealed to you and you are allowed to play it out how you want but can often be rewarded for playing it specific way sometimes defying the desires of the person who hired you these missions feel rich in story lore background but delivered in text message rivaling the length of this review not to mention all the data shards token replacements for entire conversations that likely had to be scrappedthe rotthen all the little cracks there are plenty of moments where objects npcs are interacting with will duplicate and stay frozen in the air near them the minimap is zoomed in too close to see turns coming up while driving edit fixed as of 13 that said the gps navigation is often broken and will zigzag through streets rather than take the fewest possible turns within reasonably similar distance traveled it does at least adjust whether youre on foot or in vehicle npc scripting often breaks forcing you to use an autosave to backtrack bit to give it another shot at working as intended this also teaches you to use your quicksave at prime opportunities so you dont lose much progress since autosaves arent frequent even just quicksaving and reloading will often fix lot of npc scripting onthespot weapons attributes stats and skills are horribly balanced mods on gear do stack but they dont want to show they stack on your stats screen edit stats now seem to be shown properly as of 121 you will occasionally just die at complete random at least i do and i cant figure out why from slight falls or getting hit by passing car edit instant deaths were identified and fixed as of 12 inventory panels have to reload with every transaction or dismantling this alone gets extremely tedious edit reloads are much faster now as of 12 but still tedious and many more minor annoyances and glitches will be encountered along the way none of which is consistent on userbyuser basis either many have it worse than many have had near flawless experience and theres accounting for the standards of the massesedit april 1st 2021i read through and tested the 12 update for few hours this fixed solid chunk of my nuanced details regarding bugsglitchesissues and is at least that much closer to its intended vision but theres entire systems and mechanics missing here still before that vision becomes reality on top of that many functions that were working before now dont work as intended such as scan toggle each time i launch the game now scanning is on hold i have to go to my keybinds switch it to hold apply then switch it back to toggle in order to get scan toggle to work again and there are more minor new bugsglitchesissues as well tested amd dxr functionality on settings that get 120 fps and full dxr drops framerates to staggering 30 i feel full control of dxr sample rates needs added so we amd users can tune thisedit september 1st 2021version 13 dropped with some free content added simple improvement to the minimap while driving and more quest scripting fixes raytracing implementation is still broken on amd considering doom eternal and re8 run just fine with it enablededit december 1st 2021no real changes just doing this dirty edit for the nomination awardsthe dreamfinally the real reason i dont recommend the game theres so much potential here not being realized there are less than five gangs in the city and i genuinely feel that core progress should be locked behind gaining reputation and prestige with at least one of them this could also drastically alter how the ending unfolds i hope someone at cdpr reads this because i would genuinely like to see fullon gang wars between their respective borders in the city ncpd and maxtac jumping into the fray shortly after these battles begin and let them be dynamic i would like to see system where you could earn reputation with all the gangs using an alias and keeping your face hidden if ever discovered on the other side of the fence instantly marking you traitor and to be dealt with in the way that gang operates it could be as simple as shooting someone who saw your face and not realizing they are still alive they report to their superiors and flip coin whether or not the gang finds out it was the player on top of that the player could turn the tide of war and go saints row on them by claiming territory from one gang for another they could even join the ncpd and eventually maxtac in much the same way even arasaka militech and biotechnica not to mention the nomad clans there should be exclusive mission boards per fixer gang ncpdmt corporation or clan rather than marks all over the map for missions ive seen how the fixers can be visited why not have them give you roster of potential missions to take on i wish you had been able to take another year or two developing these systems i see the potential for them like it was intended from the start but had to be cut because it would take too long to complete and im well aware of the fiveyear investment rule i know why you launched it like this and i know youre not allowed to admit this cold truth of business i wish you had waited to take on investment until you had timeline for finishing what couldve been real masterpiece for your studiotldrthe reason i do not recommend this game is because as it is now i feel it is work of art masterpiece video game that is lacking great deal of its true potential it is indeed worthwhile to buy and play as it is now but cyberpunk 2077 clearly isnt everything it wants to be and should be at least not yet
AspectosPositivos: ['Detalles visuales y de ambientación', 'Pasión en la creación del juego', 'Riqueza en la historia y lore']
AspectosNegativos: ['Problemas de bugs y glitches', 'Misiones secundarias repetitivas', 'Desbalance en armas y habilidades', 'Problemas de navegación y scripting de NPCs']

Contenido: 4510yeahyouve probably already heard all of the positive remarks about this game im not going to spend much time marking down the things i do like about elden ring but it would be disingenuous of if i didnt cop to somethingin order1 the ashes of war system is cool and the build variety it opens up is great theres lot of room for player expression moreso than previous titles and certainly more than sekiro2 certain parts of the game are breathtaking and the art direction is spot on for the most part3 theres lot of weapons armors rings etc etc its very easy to make your character look good and lot of the unique weapons feel great to play with4 fighting boss when its done right still feels pretty great that feeling when you dodge at just the right time never gets oldaaaand thats kind of it ill be honest it took minute to scrounge up even thatim just going to go over the major elements that led to scoring the game the way i didthe worldi am incredibly critical of open world games perhaps to fault ive always struggled to find merit in these types of games and they rarely if ever hook in the appeal for of an open world is the prospect of living world that i can get lost exploring in now the open world concept is essentially the tagline of elden ring and you spend an assload of time in it so how does it shape up it doesnt not even in the slightest bit now the world isnt empty let make that clear ahead of time too often do critics of this game latch onto that word and time and time again youll see the fans counter with theres tons of stuff in the world its not empty at all and theyre right theres plenty of stuff the problem is that it almost all suckstheres lot content in terms of quantity theres countless enemies dungeons and merchants but it essentially all boils down to the same routine in the overworld fight some trashmobs loot some items in dungeon fight some trashmobs loot some items kill boss wow leave theres narrative stringing you along through any of this locations barring the main quest and there towns or villages to relax or morp around in the whole world of elden ring is vast expanse of nothingness with bunch of filler riding the coattails of the main story areas lazily hidden by your horse weve seen this formula time and time again in games from developers like ubisoft usually to much criticism but is it really that much different here when you pull away the soulsy veneer ask yourself if it werent for torrent how alive would the world feel if you were stuck on footlevel designthe level design is not good im going to piss off lot of people by saying that but its true the fundamental issue with the levels in elden ring is that there is virtually reason at all to fight the enemies fromsofts design philosophy coalesces into perfect storm of ââââââââââ lot of the time where the inherent risks of fighting enemies almost always outweighs any of the incentive to do so the enemies respawn if you die even once and the runes youre going to get from the boss will far outclass anything youre gon na scrounge out of even 100 mangy dogs so why not just run through the whole thing seriously how is that not the optimal way to play youre routinely presented with situations where youre outnumbered and entirely outclassed by the level enemies and fans will tell you to fight but why you dont have to to progress the only thing in the way of you getting to the next area is the boss that always nagged about fromsoft games and its made even worse here with all of the magic spam and other teethpulling ââââââââ you have to put up with you cant tell that benny hilling around the map is good game design you just cant questlinesthe quests in this game if you can really call them that are bad theyre very bad the souls series isnt really known for its arresting side characters or engrossing bplots so this isnt too much of shock and normally wouldnt be huge problem for the issue though is that the open world nature of elden ring mutates the already pretentious questing system of previous games into even more of nuisance heres breakdown of the only quest i bothered completing with the help of guide1 meet yura bloody finger hunter underneath bridge at limgrave lake2 warns you about the dragon this is the only thing does and there is indication whatsoever of any kind of quest related to him3 ride clear across the lake into random ravine get dismounted off your horse and fight some bloodyfinger guy yura spawns in and then says some random dialogue about the guy youre fighting while you mash him4 despawns and then reappears at the very end of the ravine in cave again indication whatsoever about where hes at5 talk to him congratulates you and purrs at your martial prowess and then warns you about some crazy lady named eleonora quest over6 wrong there is now summon sign clear across the map in raya lucaria at the end of broken bridge yes you read that right7 use the summon sign fight some random npc with yura get sent back on the bridge and be careful not to miss him as hes now leaning on the railing behind you8 talk to him get an ash of war quest done9 wrong again teleports clear across the map again to random church in the atlus plateau this time you find him sprawled out neardeath on the church floor giving an operamonologue about his beloved eleonora you stand around awkwardly waiting for him to croak then loot the sword off his stillwarm body10 just as youre about to leave eleonora spawns in gasp you fight her and then get polestaff11 quest done does that not sound like the stupidest âââââââ thing youve ever heard in your entire life this appears to be the standard of elden rings quests 0 direction 0 investment and 0 idea about what the ââââ is going on the way theyre designed prevents you from ever really being the active agent in any of the quests you undertake youre not experiencing the beats of quest because you intend to they kind of just happen to occur if youre in the right place at the right time and if mercury is in retrograde and the north star is juuust bright enough coupling that with the fact that theres actual decisionmaking expected on your part you get the comedic impression that youre just some âââââââ extra at the school play whos so good at getting in the way that the actual actors in the show have to improvise some on the spot nonsense to keep the whole production from being torn down by your meddling i actually busted up laughing when yura died it almost feels intentionalconclusiontheres lot of other stuff i could touch on but im already out of space here so ill keep this brief if you like all of the other souls games you might like this i dont for all the reasons above am i going to keep playing it though yeah probably am i going to like playing it mmmmmm probably not
AspectosPositivos: ['Ashes of War system', 'Build variety', 'Breathtaking parts of the game', 'Art direction', 'Variety of weapons, armors, rings']
AspectosNegativos: ['Open world design', 'Level design', 'Quest system']

Contenido: backgroundmy first interaction with cd projekt red game was around 2008 some random guy told about the witcher and i tried it i loved the game even with the poor and strange combat system usually i try to play games with original voiceslanguage because translations are often inaccurate voices are too artificial and youll miss some jokes cdpr games on the other hand are good with full translation and i personally enjoy them that waysince then i became kind of fan of cdpr games and was waiting for witcher 2 i loved new models improved combat and few more features but the game was too linear in terms of map optimization wasnt good as far as i remember then came waiting times for witcher 3witcher 3 trailers were interesting the final product wasnt disappointing open world for the first time horse good amount of main story time and decent side quests i can tell much but in short it was good game dlc introduced few hour contents and second dlc was one big expansion you know old classic expansion with many missions weapons etc it had new map act i the falldid you ever hear the tragedy of cdpr the liar i thought not its not story the fanboy would tell you its the truth cdpr was decent game developing company so ethical and so playerfriendly they could use the name to influence the player base to create hype they had such knowledge of the fan side that they could even keep the ones they cared about from fleeing the business side of the company is pathway to many abilities some consider to be unnatural they became so powerful the only thing they were afraid of was losing the fan base which eventually of course they did unfortunately they learned from other big companies everything these companies knew then bad business decisions almost killed them ironic they could save their reputation from death but not anymoreafter waiting for cyberpunk for years after watching more trailers and getting more hype and after many delayed release dates we finally received the game it wasnt the company i loved anymore i heard few things since then it looks like some developers left the company and it was case of negative experience not just for players but for employees too it was the start of the fall act ii the betrayali bought the game and played for the first time recently december 2021 winter sale by now the game should have been patched fixed improved and so on if this is the case may the tech gods have mercy on cdpr souls i completed the game finished most probably all side story quest had tons of legendary stuff etc story side was good enough character models are good too you may ask what was so bad about it what makes not recommend the game to people i will tell you boy after years of mentioned delayed release dates the game not only was released in terrible state betalike but its an average game in some aspects and horrible in others i will tell you moreact iii the experiencegame poor optimization im not talking about just performance which according to some players with better pcgpu than mine is still problematic i do have good pc other than gpu and have good performance in most games audio volume is sometimes low and sometimes high i almost cant hear the radio songs but i hear the damn engine your audio software settingspresets dont matter here i have gaming mobo and use slightly modified gaming audio preset in ss3 it works in all other games so its game related audio problem there are more reasons to have negative opinion of the game npctransport appear and disappear out of nowhere sometimes i had to waste lot of time near city dump because my car stuck and all the cars on the road disappeared and there was fast travel thing nearbypoor world load after you return to the game from menus lot of objects can get stuck in other objects you cant pick some loot at alldriving physics is terrible i played many racing games and this is terrible even for nonracing game standard gta 5 game from 2013 with very arcadey physics feels amazing after cyberpunk here it feels as if indie developer tested physics dont get wrong cp physics is not just meh its really awful speaking of physics other physics related things are bad too there is funny comparison video on youtube where the author compared cyberpunk with other games cp looked like cheap indie game made in garage shooting at water takes back to ps2 timesyou cant customize protagonist after start for arasakas sake why the cyberhell you cant change even the simplest things like hair eyes in this game are implants so why not change them too tattoos cyber stuff piercing i mean even in modern times we can change faces in cyberpunk we should be able to change almost everything arm implants look generic thanks to modder this can be improved bit where are other models where is visible leg implants modelarmor choice in this game is poor you can look like scifi clown with good stats or have poor stats and look better too many iconic weapons most skill categories are poorly balanced stealth is good even without proper skills some other categories can also be ignored some implants require high levels in mentioned skill categories you have to waste points on poor skills to buy some decent implantssome implants require high street cred levels legendary arms for example other than that street cred was useless for i had to grind just to buy the damn armstoo many consumable items and proper way to use them it becomes hassleyou cant continue playing after game ending load save before final mission or return to menu witcher 3 changed this why return to the old formula ai is dumb police appears out of nowhere and wont chase you at all npc reaction to danger is very poorly executed in the gameupgrade option for some of my weapons just disappeared at one point for reason i was left with cool but weak gun its bugi hope that i havent forgotten anythingcant pick loot httpssteamcommunitycomsharedfilesfiledetailsid2692525092empty roadcars disappearedhttpssteamcommunitycomsharedfilesfiledetailsid2694224558bike acted weird jumped in air and got stuckhttpssteamcommunitycomsharedfilesfiledetailsid2696940813object loot stuck in another object httpssteamcommunitycomsharedfilesfiledetailsid2700883765lightning bughttpssteamcommunitycomsharedfilesfiledetailsid2699627602act iv the verdictif cdpr wont fix the damn bugs improve optimization i mentioned above and at least change few things like allow us to change character appearance and free roam after ending then i have more hope for this company expansion for potentially fixed game can be good sign too fixes first of course if you want to play for cdpr style story then buy with the biggest discount you can and be prepared for bugsedit 1 i mentioned few other problems updated text and added some screenshots
AspectosNegativos: ['Pobre optimización del juego', 'Problemas de rendimiento y audio', 'Problemas de carga del mundo', 'Físicas de conducción terribles', 'Limitaciones en la personalización del personaje', 'Problemas con la inteligencia artificial y la reacción de los NPC', 'Errores y bugs varios']

Contenido: this game felt dated when it released 10yrs ago and 10 more years of rereleases hasnt helped at all the combat is oblivions but instead of talking 400 hits to kill the 100th draugr deathlord in generic cave you only do it in 200 or so with cleaner animations and janky kill moves which gets the player killedthe game is shallow none of you decisions impact the world or effect the story and there are many elements of tonal dissonance where one quest line focuses on heroic archetype and another on murdering people but the heroic one feels urgent from the get go and it just feels weird to go oh alduin end of the world who gives lets go rob some for 100 hrs the blades parthunaax conflict is the most forced conflict i have ever seen like 3000 years later oooo we have grudge when the blades in recent times were like the cia of the empire not really militant order much more compelling conflict would be if they expanded on the conflict between the blades and thalmor because that actually is relevant to recent conflicts and not to dragon who is the main reason like humans arent enslaved and dragons should be portrayed as characters and people not flying lizards with zero intelligence there couldve been much more interesting story if the story like made u interact with them as characters either to build motive besides cartoonishly evil or like sway dragons to your cause to defeat alduin odaviing says the dragons have been becoming discontent with alduin this shouldve been expanded on as plot pointmorrowind did better job of this as the main quest felt important but there wasnt an urgency in accomplishing it the tribunal been having war of attrition with dagoth ur for years and there were many points where side content intersected with the main quest and plot points in it making side content by extension feel meaningful to the story as whole alsomagic and alchemy have been watered down since previous games and are boring unbalanced chore if you dont use mods to overhaul said systems in morrowind for example enchanting and alchemy was great way for player to get access to nice utility magic effects potion was method of casting some spells same with enchanted items but with either constant on hit or on cast for non mage focused player all utility been removed from magic in skyrim and the lack of spell crafting really kills the fun you could of have with it but its unlikely bethesda will ever include it again its ridiculous to make world that scales with the player but doesnt make the magic scale adequately with it another thing i dont find entirely compelling is that your character cant screw up and you cant make wrong decisions only one quest did this in skyrim while almost every faction quest in morrowind allowed for thisto sum up the factions questswinterhold go through 35 dungeons then your suddenly skilled enough to become the archmage of an academic institution yeah nah you can clear this without focusing on any magic and whoever made this quest line needs to remove whatever metal rod is lodged in their brain before they take up writing ever againcompanions beat up some poor farmer in the name of honour go to crypt and learn that ur in werewolf cult beat up another farmer to honour ysgramors legacy be forced to be made werewolf for some reason even though 3 out of the 5 leaders dont want to be anymore kill ton of werewolf hunters kill some witches come back to see they retaliated at home base go on lame revenge mission come back get awkwardly handed legendary weapon read kodlacks journal where u learn really liked you even though u only talked like once to him go through another generic nordic crypt slay wolf spirit the endthieves guildwhere the companions was way to quick in pacing they dragged out the interesting missions and the ability to become guild master with the most god awful grind fest of radiant quests who ever came up with that idea should be firedthe main questline in the faction is basically do few smallish jobs heists and such be forcefully inducted into another daedric cult becoming the champion of the hundredth daedric god because apparently someone who can slay someone who may be an avatar of akatosh is too weak to kill someone with keydawnguard faction fine overall had its moments wasnt particularly exceptional but it was exceptional that it felt like it wasnt written by someone with brain aneurysm which is amazing considering their track recordvampire faction same as dawnguard but vampires my only beef is that it suffers from lack of any real difference to dawnguard main quests and also pretty terrible tonal dissonance if you havent finished main quest as youre rail roaded to be hero gasp dragon born what an honor but youre also vampire who treats humans as cattle it doesnt fit in tonally with most other quest lines and factions as there is real like morally ambiguous way to complete most quest linesdark brotherhoodits alright but there is some down right smooth brained writing once again basically u kill bunch of useless characters proceed to plot to kill emperor kill the emperors spiessecret police leaders you get handed over on plater to him because obviously will forget the dark brotherhood murdered his if you and wont have anyyyyyyyy grudges because thats logical and good writing yeah its stupid the quests in oblivion overall were much better and intricate with more compelling characters and the assassins guild in morrowind was interesting as it lead up to you killing highly important characters essential for multiple quest lines making who you kill have an impact in the worldoverall as ive said before its shallow and skyrim was my first rpg and bethesda game so its not really nostalgia for older games why i think so i believe their focus in development was poor for example the major cities in skyrim have less buildings and are far smaller than towns in morrowind which released in 2002 and instead you have over hundred samey dungeons when dungeons were never the thing that made rpg games good its the world and how the player leaves mark on it morrowind does this and new vegas does alsoi wouldnt be surprise if the next game is 3 minute long 2d cartoon because bethesda seems to look at their past games and remove any traits that made them compelling such as complex story unique magic mechanics factions that actually meant something and character that grows to fit the world and not the world revolving and around the characterif bethesda wants to make good game next they need to focus on what the core mechanics will be there been greater popularity in deeper more in depth complex rpg experiences since skyrim launched which have become far more mainstream and if they dont bring anything new to the table it will flop
