Contenido: first off i didnt watch any of the preview trailers i didnt know what was going on with cyberpunk i had assumed cdpr dumpstered it when i heard it droppedmy curiousity got the best of this is your last warning to avoid any spoilersits been yeara few patches laterand 25 playthroughs and i can review itnoi dont reccomend it why dont i reccomend it theres so many reasons why i dont but lets start off the good stuffthe city looks great the music is killer the concept is cool the characters you interact with are generally interesting in some wayfixers aside and thats about where my praise stops youll see praise about the graphics and storyyoull see people sing praise about how cdpr fixed problems and will keep fixing problemsabout how we got some dlcsand none of that matters not one bit of it the core problems of the game are not fixed theres issues with the game that go down to the foundation and spit polishing the rest of the decrepit structure doesnt solve the foundations collapse lets start off with the story life paths generally mean nothing in the grand scheme of things it changes your first hour or soand it changes how you can interact with certain charactersbut beyond thatit matters not life paths werent expanded on by cdpr so i wont go further into themthe story pacing is all kinds of justbad the life path is 15m to an hour depending on if you actually want it to drag on longer then begins act 1 act 1 is just terribly paced the montage is gameplay we shouldve gottento build up with jackie the game wants us to care about jackieand triesbut it falls flat on its face during act 1 you meet lot of interesting characterstalk lotand plan the biggest heist in the city its all cool and payday like in some ways but theres crackssmall onesthat start to show here you get introduced to all these peopleand are given so little reason to care about them or their problems act 2 suffers more of the samebut we get johnny johnnys actually pretty cool guy in my opinion i was always mostly entertained by his appearencesand quips in conversations or hearing is input on whats going on sure hes disembodied voice in my headbut at least hes funny at times act 2 picks up where act 1 endsyou have hole in the headand youre dying because johnnys eating your brain meat theres high points in act 2 the vas did great work here trying to convey emotion and the troubling times vikvand other characters do amazing work here act 3 is figuring out what to doand exploring johnny and the end game and the 3 paths you have laid out in front of you help with that final choice seeing johnny change from hardcore anti corpo jerkoff to becoming more mellow after sees the damage hes done to vand others around themalong with how the world didnt changewakes him up its an interesting change of character and shows that johnny could grow its shame that v didnt really grow as much as i hoped would the endings are all well doneand all interesting in their own ways depending on what you choose to do i wont spoil thembut i did quite like them but the stories alrightits got pacing issues for the first half of the game the side gigs are where the good writing really shows through theres lot of very good onesand lot of very enjoyable ones that i quite enjoyed beyond the pacing problems i didnt have an issue with the story for the most parti just wish that the writers took more into account of if v was his own character or the player it feels like at times they forgotso the stories passable the voice acting is very well doneso why am i thumbing it downmechanicallythe game isnt fun thats my biggest problem with the game mechanicallyits not fun at all its boring slog while yesyou can do crazy buildsthose crazy builds dont mean whole lot when you realize that the perks are all almost all passive bonuses like added damage or higher crit chance the game uses terrible looter shooter systemand theres just not enough gear to justify it some weapons have plenty of time in the limelightothers not so much the armor system is cancer and you look like you went dumpster diving in the trash wall outside the city most of the gear you find will be broken down into parts to upgrade the gear you actually like most of the gear wont ever be touched because it conflicts too much with your build the builds just arent fun nor are they intuitive most of the perks are passive perks that increase critical damage or critcal changeor outright damage most of the perks you want for build will end up conflicting with other things you want in build but once you realize that all builds pale in comparison to the sneaky hackerman revovler build that clears entire compounds in seconds with spreading quickhacksyou learn that most build crafting is utterly pointless you dont even have to spec into hacking to get the most benefits from solid cyberdeckcyberware feels largely bad once you learn that the technomancer hackerbuild is the best build in the gameand you grind to get yourself to that pointthe game is boring the rocket arm is more likely to kill you than the enemythe monowire uses almost all the same perks that gorilla arms wantsand mantis blades so few animations that it gets boring to use very quickly once you get the hover jump cyberware your mobility needs are met and you only need to spec the rest to your build but like perksso much of its passive perks that you forget you have themmore rammore damage to bots and mechsetcyou also cant sell certain cyberwares so its pointless to buy lower grade try it out then trade it in laterthe economy is so out of wack for everything you make and sellis worthlesseverything you buy is tens of thousands of eddiesyes im aware you can get perk that increases the value of an item that you craft but tell meif i make legendary weaponand sell itwhy is it 2900but to buy it i have to tack on another 40k cars are largely pointless you get so many vehicles for freeyou only need to buy at minimum oneand even then thats debatable get bike if you really have eddies to burn you get the fasest car for freea very good bike for freeand free truckso why waste eddies on any other cars or bikesits mediocre its not very good and its shamebecause theres elements of good game under here i want to like itbut the first act is so boring that i hate doing it again
AspectosPositivos: ['La ciudad se ve genial', 'La música es genial', 'El concepto es interesante', 'Los personajes son generalmente interesantes']
AspectosNegativos: ['Problemas fundamentales sin resolver', 'Pacing de la historia deficiente', 'Mecánicas de juego aburridas', 'Sistema de botín y armadura problemático', 'Construcción de personajes poco satisfactoria']

Contenido: good railroad story game not so great rpg there will be appropriately tagged spoilers for the ending because for the ending is easily where the game falls apart so i need to address it however dont shy away immediately as some of the ending criticisms are spoiler freefor starters i would personally rate the game as 610 or 710im not joking when i say i would still recommend game that i believe is 610 and this is because overall cyberpunk 2077 is good game my main issue with it is that it is not what i was expecting i wasnt expecting better game but rather different gameanother quick point is that although i have 56 hours in game most of this was leaving my pc on overnight i reached the endgame having done the main quest and side quests with actual story in about 30 hours the pros 1 the world itself for this game is fantastic the dystopian architecture is outstanding i like the clear differences between vibrant night city and the desolate badlands2 adding onto the above is the world building everything that adds life to the city the cars the people the clothing the flashing lights and the advertisements they all fit quite neatly and look great3 the characters in this game are solid too the two that stand out for the most are jackie and judy these two characters in particular are moulded in such way that it genuinely feels like there is relationship between these characters and v even for male v in judys case4 the rpg elements within the game are apparent theyre used frequently to access new dialogue options sometimes ways to finish quest but mostly to open doors but even then it just feels like youve made good build however they arent flawless the cons 1 first up the bugs some of them feel like really simple bugs sometimes theyre game breaking i play bethesda games so im used to bugs but theyre worth pointing out in any review2 the police and crime systems are completely whack when you commit crime you can physically see the police spawn in around you but they dont chase you you can tear off in car and lose 4star rating after driving one or two blocks it just feels like pointless system also you can literally swipe everything not nailed down without consequence3 the driving is something horrific generally the cars feel really floaty and slightly tapping or d will usually send you veering off into poor crowd of civvies bikes handle much better but in comparison to the cars they feel like dead weight not floaty enough plus collisions are nightmare slight tap with some vehicles seems to send you flying all over the place and its just tiring to deal with4 the gunplay feels bit clunky to again ive played the older bethesda fallout games so im used to it but it just simply felt like i couldnt keep up with the ai and it didnt feel like sensitivity issue because my sensitivity felt fine outside of combat add to that guns that just feel really weak in general and youve got system that definitely needs revisiting5 the rpg elements they exist and they allow you to play role yes but its simply astounding just how irrelevant they feel to the actual game there are very few choices i can recall and none of them really bring to mind any particular consequences at any point throughout the game6 the 5050 approach to sandbox cyberpunk is strange in that the world is so beautifully crafted it makes you want to explore however theres nothing to actually do when you do explore there are the gigs but theyre so mindnumbingly dull that they dont feel worth dedicating time to one gig had go into basement and turn on some lights for some eddies7 this sort of ties in with the above but there were very few side quests that were story oriented in my opinion for an openworld rpg i feel like i shouldnt be finishing the game within 30 hours im spoiled by the elder scrolls and fallout even cdprs the witcher games in that i want to have games that i can sink days into at time and still not have finished the few storyoriented side quests contained within are great there just isnt enough of them8 the overall tone of the story i dont feel like im spoiling anything here really so tag the game the player constantly feel like theres sense of rush sense of urgency this leaves the player feeling like theres very little freedom to go and explore this is exacerbated by the fact that even some of the side quests remind you of this overall rushthis shows that the game prioritises its story above all else and this ultimately means is that this isnt cyberpunk the rpg its cyberpunk the railroaded action game its story game with rpg elements just slapped on top the ending more cons for it should go without saying that this will be spoiler territory so be warned ill spoiler tag all of it but im separating my ending review into two sections mechanics and content im torn on leaning towards dislike for the ending and i dislike the way it works separating them into two sections allows those who want to see why i criticise the ending to do so without ruining the actual ending itself for themselves1 the mechanicsa the ending you get at the end of the game is completely determined by single choice you make during the final mission technically two choices but that falls under content so i cant say more here this adds on to the point about the lack of true rpg elements and the lack of consequence b theres also endgame content the free roam simply places you prior to the ending of the final mission and this just leaves feeling robbed of true ending 2 the contenta the actual ending itself just feels terrible you spend the entire game trying to get johnny out of your body only to get told v is going to die in 6 months anyway it just makes feel like ive wasted my time everything just feels robbed from b the endings dont leave any room for dlc expansion post game because most involve v leaving nc or dying dlc wont feel like an extension just more side stuff that tonally doesnt feel like you can fit into vs existing story is cyberpunk 2077 good game yes as long as youre looking for storyled game if youre looking for an rpg with freedom akin to bethesda titles or the witcher 3 change those expectations because otherwise youll just end up being disappointed like i was and it will take you time to truly appreciate this game for what it actually is
AspectosPositivos: ['Mundo del juego', 'Construcción del mundo', 'Personajes (Jackie y Judy)']
AspectosNegativos: ['Bugs', 'Sistemas de policía y crimen', 'Conducción de vehículos', 'Jugabilidad de disparos', 'Elementos RPG irrelevantes', 'Exploración sin contenido significativo', 'Duración de las misiones secundarias', 'Tono general de la historia', 'Final restrictivo']

Contenido: producto recibido forma gratuita screw you bethesda and your creation club this whole idea is completely outrageous how about instead of milking skyrim for the hundredth time you could instead focus your efforts on making your new ips or i dont know tes6 now because apparently you arent making enough money you have to try to gouge the modding community community who stood behind you many times community who painstakingly fixed bugs that you couldnt even fix yourself youre despicable and this creation club is disgustingpretty bummed out about so ill list my pros and cons and you can decide pros 64bit the game is noticeably more stable i watched video where someone placed 2000 objects in the game and then shouted instead of crashing or freezing the game was able to handle it quite well this should make modding more stable as well rain occlusion you dont understand how big of difference this makes now rain wont go through solid objects and roofs alttab actually works now before it just seemed to freeze my game i was sometimes able to get it to work by exiting and reopening and exiting the window but that did not always work alttab works perfectly in draw distances are incredible seeing trees and other objects much further away than i can in the old skyrim they definitely did good here i can even see some buildings that are extremely far away makes for the perfect immersion i also havent seen one flickering object in the background that is not to say there isnt any but i havent seen any which is nothing but good side note with some testing i was able to tweak my draw distances on original skyrim to match those of i can see bleak falls barrow and high hrothgar from whiterun which i dont remember if that was possible before comes with the cost of really bad flickering which can not be fixed that is only fixed in flora amount been greatly improved it makes for great landscape and makes the forests seem more alive cons doesnt seem like they really reworked any of the textures i am still seeing horribly pixilatedblocky textures around skyrim they should not be able to get away with this in their video they say remastered artwork but in reality they upscaled the textures some went from 512 to 1024 but others were probably stretched even further and this degrades quality insanely and degrades performance for quality improvement what the hell were they thinking i was really hoping for true high resolution textures for the pc version its still being limited by consoles and pure laziness source httpafkmodsiguanadonsnetindexphptopic4633skyrimsethingstoknowwhenconvertingstandardmodstossepage3entry163361 doesnt seem like the mod compatibility they talked about is here they made it sound like lot of things would just carry over and thats not the case there are certain mods in question that may never work with the mod ive been spending the last month on looks like its going to be incompatible with until skse is updated huge let down when they talked about how mods were going to be compatible still the same bugs from what i have seen they didnt fix any bugs with the special edition it still requires you to get the unofficial patch which is beyond ridiculous they should have went through and fixed the known bugs now they are going to have to either ignore the community or fix them over the next couple of months if they are planning on even releasing updates for this did not launch with creation kit they 100 should have released the new ck alongside it makes sense why they didnt especially with this talk of mod compatibility this means i have and others have to wait to start porting our mods over to i was hoping i could release my follower on both skyrim and skyrim special edition at the same time that just isnt going to work i think it should have been released with this whole lets give it to some modders before release and the rest of them can wait week after release isnt fair thats playing favorites and it is not fair to the rest of the community compressed audio really bethesda source httpswwwredditcomrskyrimmodscomments59u0iwthe_skyrim_special_edition_features_a_significanti have lot of issues with this and i think bethesda messed up big time from what i have seen i get the impression that this was solely to get money from the current gen console owners this seems like pure greedy move on bethesdas part and i can not recommend it my current skyrim setup with mods looks 100 better than this i love bethesda but this was not what i was expecting to clarify i was not expecting it to look like fully modded game i was expecting true high resolution texture pack for the game which we did not getbethesda released this with the mindset let the modders take care of it and its just not cool anymore they need to put the work into it and stop being lazy and leaving it to Contenido: producto recibido forma gratuita screw you bethesda and your creation club this whole idea is completely outrageous how about instead of milking skyrim for the hundredth time you could instead focus your efforts on making your new ips or i dont know tes6 now because apparently you arent making enough money you have to try to gouge the modding community community who stood behind you many times community who painstakingly fixed bugs that you couldnt even fix yourself youre despicable and this creation club is disgustingpretty bummed out about so ill list my pros and cons and you can decide pros 64bit the game is noticeably more stable i watched video where someone placed 2000 objects in the game and then shouted instead of crashing or freezing the game was able to handle it quite well this should make modding more stable as well rain occlusion you dont understand how big of difference this makes now rain wont go through solid objects and roofs alttab actually works now before it just seemed to freeze my game i was sometimes able to get it to work by exiting and reopening and exiting the window but that did not always work alttab works perfectly in draw distances are incredible seeing trees and other objects much further away than i can in the old skyrim they definitely did good here i can even see some buildings that are extremely far away makes for the perfect immersion i also havent seen one flickering object in the background that is not to say there isnt any but i havent seen any which is nothing but good side note with some testing i was able to tweak my draw distances on original skyrim to match those of i can see bleak falls barrow and high hrothgar from whiterun which i dont remember if that was possible before comes with the cost of really bad flickering which can not be fixed that is only fixed in flora amount been greatly improved it makes for great landscape and makes the forests seem more alive cons doesnt seem like they really reworked any of the textures i am still seeing horribly pixilatedblocky textures around skyrim they should not be able to get away with this in their video they say remastered artwork but in reality they upscaled the textures some went from 512 to 1024 but others were probably stretched even further and this degrades quality insanely and degrades performance for quality improvement what the hell were Contenido: 32 hours of gameplay and its finally over my character is riding shotgun in the scripted scene happy and free as tapeworm the game wants to put in the solemn and sentimental mood which is why it generates another random car in front of ours the characters are throwing it off the road without stopping the conversation id want to say that this is cyberpunk 2077 in nutshell but it really isnt theres nutshell at least not an easily crackable one so lets talk detailsim really glad that steam recommendednot recommended grade instead of the likedislike one cause otherwise i wouldve had significantly more problems with picking the right one cyberpunk 2077 is game videogame that is the one you can pump lot of hours into without regretting it much it falls around the same level as fallout 4 or whatnot game with hookability and not much else the one that can put you in an endless loop of okay one more quest which drags you throughout the entire game without leaving any sort of emotional impact or feeling of satisfaction and theres way more to that than just luckluster storyfirst of all the game is monument to effort oh theres clearly plenty of that the city is vast diverse and yeah sort of beautiful its probably the most technically and aesthetically impressive city since i dont know forever and heres the problem its an exhibition showpiece if you will what i wanted jumping through glass from one penthouse to another fighting on flying platforms between the neon billboards hacking the traffic lights to create chaos on the roads theres nothing like this whatsoever not even in the story missions this city is more than backdrop you spend 90 of your time crawling through the corridors breaking necks or just travelling around through the system of teleportation devices cause thats the treatment you want right night city just ignores you go on run over dozen of pedestrians the cops wont even start chase theyll forget about that once you leave the scene same goes for the gangs not even slaughtering whole squad of yakuzas is going to stop their sama from giving you missions or asking whether or not you want to buy her crappy minicar aside from some scripted encounters and story missions you wont even notice any sort of crime problems within night citys limits gta2 had more consequences for messing with the wrong dojo in fact gta2 did several things better than cyberpunk 2077 for example the radio remember taxi drivers by bula matari theres magic here the music in 2077 is mostly forgettable or downright awfulso yeah have fun i mean this was supposed to be great game right fabulous spectacular grandiose why the hell does it make sneak around with this pathetic skyrimtype stealth system in fact its even worse cause at least in skyrim the enemies arent deaf you can make any sort of sound that is not gunshot right behind their back and they wont notice anything theyll just keep staring at walls allowing you to do your worst also theres difference between just knocking the enemy out or straight up snapping their neck never once any of them woke up the game breaks new grounds really i beat it on very hard difficulty but im pretty sure it wouldnt have made any difference on easy aside from boss fights but theres like five totalbut alright you dont want to sneak around you wan na shoot the bastards in the face then youre stuck with this weird floaty gunfight mechanics bullet sponge enemies and completely useless skill system at some point i just stopped spending points on anything cause it made difference i only spent them if encountered locked dialogue option since youre luckily allowed to open your character screen right in the middle of talking to someone oh sorry did you say something yeah lem just add another point to intelligence so i can answer you in fact i finished the game with 18 points in crafting despite not crafting anything at all simply because it let open locked doors or choose specific dialogue olines that made life easier but if you do want to roleplay as tinker good luck finding any highlevel components in loot buying yeah sure for the price of good car the game gives you all the best gear anyway well best by its standards youre still ought to shoot some enemies in the face about fifteen times before they go down implants i know i know in fact implants are the only reason to spend your levelup points on body that or if you want to steal other peoples cars but i didnt mess with it or with hacking or with weapon stats and again finished the game on very hard without any problemsin certain ways cyberpunk 2077 is metaphor for its own world come for skyscrapers and neon but stay cause youve got shift at burger king this gameplay is so mundane so generic you could splice human revolution and saints row 4 together and this is what youre gon na get and while 2077 is still much better than both of these games combined theres way to make this gameplay appealing im tired of this kind of stealth im tired of this abstract lightblue cyberspace im tired of characters that you know are going to survive cause they give you side quests have mercy once thing is nice though theres difference between not humorous and not funny and thank god cd projekt choose the former for the most part the game takes itself seriously which is almost refreshing well aside from couple of bizarre sidequests with references to pop culture which are so out of place and cringeworthy that it almost makes you nervously chucklewere not gon na talk about all these glitches bugs and just lack of polish hehe polish in general its gon na be fixed some day whats not gon na be fixed is that some people not i never liked the witcher series so i didnt care expected gaming messiah and got just some nice guy instead fine to hang out with not good enough to follow into battle again i want to emphasise its not bad game per its just unoriginal and trite in almost every aspect it property of seventh generation of consoles written all over it which i guess makes sense given the fact that it was announced eight years ago one day people who grew up with it will remember it fondly but there will never come day when this game will count as classics

Contenido: apologies for the manifesto thats belowthis is tough onei distinctly remember where i was when cyberpunk 2077 was announced all the way back in middle school and now it released just before i finished university to put it simply cp2077 been long time coming it been said countless times before but i still feel like its important to be seen if you have been eating breathing drinking sleeping about cp2077 and took everything cdpr showed us as gospel you will be disappointed if you thought this game was the return of jesus christ or the cure for cancer or that its release would somehow revert all the misery 2020 seems to infinitely produce you will be disappointed and unfortunately that is your fault for thinking so the game is with some exceptions of course mile wide but an inch deep its also great until it isnt allow to explain that further cp2077 tries incredibly hard to suck you into its world and 9 times out of 10 it truly works in my play time i have never been so sucked into fictional world than cp2077 characters like jackie or panam are incredibly fleshed out their dialogue and scenes with your character are truly some of the best in the industry in those scenes i feel like im there talking to them not v but then that 1 out of 10 times happen perhaps jackie tposes during an incredibly inopportune time or maybe panam just decides to venture off to the shadow realm midconversation leaving you talking to yourself maybe your car will turn into submarine if you hit lamp post and take you under the map at jusssst the right angle its these funny to gamebreaking bugs and glitches that really take you out of the simulation that cdpr tried so hard at creating making you remember that this is just game the map is gorgeous thats undeniable cdpr put lot of detail into night city and its surrounding locales from the immaculate areas where the rich and corporations are situated to the industrial slums that surround it all the way to the grimy oil fields and dirty badlands however its just that there is depth to the map whatsoever cdpr tired to counteract this with side missions gigs and mini missions dressed up as police dispatches they even dressed up car purchases as missions to bloat up the map i managed to complete every mission offered in the game and i have compelling reason to return to the game sadly there are not lot of open buildings you can explore while the map size is generously large the map itself is cut up and gerrymandered in such way that the map size is more of an illusion for example the playable area of the district of pacifica is only half of what the map implies as for graphics i have modest rig with the exception of 2080 and everything ran smoothly on high settings i decided to leave the film grain option on and while that may be controversial move im glad i kept it seeing the grain interact with the night sky and the light pollution remind of movies like driveheatblade runner or my old photos on my film camera perhaps its nostalgia talking but i thought it looked great as for the story i wont reveal much for the sake of people who wish not to be spoiled the first act is definitely the most polished and i wish that it was stretched out this is not to say that the rest of the plot is trash but it is noticeable when cdpr heard feedback from some players say that the story for witcher 3 was too long for them which i think is crazy but i digress they scrambled to trim some fat i also do wish that the missions that dictate your character nomad street corp were longer or more important as at the end of your first mission v will be identical matter what life path you chose for the rest of the game the main side missions were all really well executed most notably panam who id argue is the most fleshed out character after v and silverhand the dialog choices you are presented are more fallout 4 than deus ex the music was really well done the original soundtrack was fantastic the radio stations were good but could get repetitive i for one really enjoyed the jazz station for nice change of pace compared to the other stations that kinda blended into one in my opinion gameplay was fine i used controller for majority of my playthrough and experienced little to issues with input driving was passable but only just i swear that the brakes dont work as intended as i have to brake football field ahead of turn gunplay was fine more cod than typical rpg which im not complaining about the part where i actually say if you should buy the game or not so would i recommend the game thats an incredibly tough question to answer its really all in the mindset of who is purchasing the game if you are someone who had calendar date for the games release bought merch and complained that it got delayed multiple times i would not purchase it lets be honest here you already did buy it if you were expecting this game to be such technological marvel and game changer that keanu reeves himself comes out of your monitor and give you huge kiss on the lips and tuck you into your bed every night i would not purchase it if you were someone who was interested in the game but didnt fall for the hype train i would wait for this game to go on sale you are not missing out on anything important personally i bought this game because i had deus ex itch that needed to be scratched and it did it similarities to deus ex but is also separate enough to be somewhat fresh breath of air for if the devs at eidos are peeking around the level design and story of mankind dividedhuman revolution and the controlcombat of cp2077 would be fantastic so if youre in the same boat as i was and craving some more jc or adam jensen action this is the next best thing but wait for sale if you want to purchase this game at its current state i strongly advise you wait for decent sale only if cdpr make some drastic improvements and quality of life would i recommend this game at full price its shame as i was excited to play the game and while i did enjoy my playthrough i was left with hallow taste in my mouth this game needed to have been delayed by full year at minimum i hope this was helpful

Contenido: coming up on 300 hours of play and beating the game multiple times in market where games keep releasing unfinished or stay in alphabeta forever this game had the best release i can remember people like to compare elden ring to darksouls 3 which is pretty accurate darksouls 3 was one of my favorite games of all time and elden ring does it quite bit better lets start off by talking about the strengths of elden ringthe massive world elden rings world is huge maybe too big you see mountain in the distance you can climb that mountain you climbed that mountain and now see castle or ruins in the distance you can explore that area too the thing about ds3 after thousands of hours played the levels start to seem very small i dont think this will ever be the feeling elden ring players will encounter the map is also very detailed and enjoyable to look at and make markers forcharacter creation1010 its amazing since it so many settings to play with you can also change your appearance and name later in the game one of the best character creators i have had time to tinker with if you tried you could probably make your character look like your real life avatar the graphics and optimization er many settings to be tweaked and seems to do good job running on older machines some of the game does have some optimization issues but they are resolved and unnoticeable for the most part the graphics on highmaximum are pretty amazing for the scale of the game might not be as good as demon souls remake quality but then again the world is massive and something had to give the art is amazing new weapons skills and tilesets of course they reuse many things from the old souls games which is actually smart considering the scale of the game if you consider all the new art they added the reuse of old material is welcomed by myselfthe music and sound for the game are next level i actually feel myself being unnerved by some areas music so much so i am hesitant to go back and find items in that location i play ton of games like escape from tarkov or warzone so i know about bad sound lol the developers will put sound cues on many important items like scarabs these sounds work well for training players who want to discover secret areas to listen to less prominent noisescrafting is new mechanic to the game and is done very well the game is huge and being able to interact with the environment through harvesting definitely makes it slightly more immersive the crafting motivates players to look all around hoping to find an ingredient for cure poison or scarlet rott coupled with the ability to make detailed markers on the map you can set up some useful crafting routes ui and controls can be finicky especially if you are new to the genre i am glad they kept the same as the past titles but some other people will not like the double bound controls personally i am use to this departmentthe multiplayer this is where er could shine quite bit more er decoupled summoning players and the stat boost from the effigyarc rune i think this is good idea the game is meant to be played with others which is why they added ash summoning ashs can be very strong sometimes better than co operator great addition but what is really disappointing is the 4 player maximum count ds3 you could get up to 7 players in your game this was great for fightclubs or just playing the game and being invaded i understand the decision to reduce to 4 maximum players was probably made because of network instability even with 4 players its unstable i know they are working hard to resolve this and have talked about it openly this is not the only problem though there is also multiplayer pvp arenas like ds3 and ds2 this is kind of mind blowing considering how many arenas you come accross i am hoping this is resolved through dlc kinda like they did for ds2 the mutiplayer some weird hitches people dont understand as well you cant summon co operator with duelist in your world you cant summon duelist if you are invaded you can summon co operator then duelist and then be invaded however the sequencing for who enters the world of the host is very important 2 players can not connect to host world at the same time this is problematic since invasions are out of the hosts control and sometimes occur at the same time as host trying to summon player which results in unable to summon or disconnect once the disconnect occurs there is also cool down before summon signs will appear again once i figured out how it works i resolved 95 of the disconnection issuesbalance is another controversial er topic there are few builds which are abusing some mechanics that make pvp not so great fires deadly incantation is mostly the root of these problems but some other builds using blood hound dodge can also be very frustrating to fight against i am sure fromsoftware will fix it but its still something that needs to be talked about if you are trying to duel and use reasonable build around sl 130 you will probably be disappointed with the results i am not saying its impossible to have good fights but the chance you go against great oak shield or eclipse shotel is high dont even get started on moonveil katana and bloodhound step users though xdconclusionall in all the game is not far from perfect in my eyes the game just released and it was near perfect release from my experience the balance will get ironed out so points deducted to my score for the game in that area i do have to deduct some points for the multiplayer i am sure these issues will also be resolved or lessened when the community learns how to do the workarounds relative to other game releases for the past few years i think 95 is fair score its almost perfect and soon with patch or 2 or dlc it will be there very rarely do we get to experience work of art like this game i do recommend trying to play without wiki or guides but more so use them as tool to point you in the right direction this game is so full of wonder and mystery most the enjoyment is just discovery or being awe inspired by the view of an area thats new huge and you get to explore9510 best release i can remember
AspectosPositivos: ['Huge world to explore', 'Detailed graphics', 'Great character creation', 'Immersive music and sound', 'Well-done crafting mechanic']
AspectosNegativos: ['Multiplayer issues', 'Balance concerns in PvP']

Contenido: okay let begin by saying that i did not have any hype for cyberpunk 2077 when it launched i didnt start hearing about it until all the keanu reeves city to burn memes started popping up and i thought that it looked interesting but not enough to spend 60 on i hate buying video games but have spent 1000 on apex free game btw and i definitely wasnt going to preorder it december 2020 came and we can unanimously agree that this game had godawful launch but regardless i put it on my wish list and didnt think about it againfast forward to march of 2022 ive just bought my first gaming pc and i see cyberpunk is on sale and i think hey this game looks pretty cool and its been over year all the bugs have got to be fixed by now right well i can confidently say that i was incorrect cyberpunk 2077 is still buggy game but nowhere near as buggy as it was on launch its bit frustrating that some of these bugs have been in the game since day one but not as frustrating as dumping half an r301 mag into gibraltar and doing six damage because noregs and respawn entertainment servers say screw you very frustrating look ive played good games and ive played bad buggy nightmares and i can tell you that the bugs in this game arent that bad the bugs in cyberpunk while noticeable dont seriously detract from the enjoyment yeah some dude is gon na be sitting on air and maybe another chicks gun is gon na stick to her hand while shes on the phone but none of that matters if im staring at panams dumpy is it immersionbreaking yeah little and that sucks next i wan na talk about the combat i had been playing on mouse and keyboard for literally less than two weeks and i decided to play this game on its secondhardest difficulty hard which this game is anything but seriously this game is easy the prologue is crazy stupid easy afterwards theres massive difficulty spike that makes you go oh damn challenge please say challawnge in your head okay ily ty but then you realize you just got ta make nicheish build and grind for little to time and badabing badaboom done i finished the game at character level 43 and with level 50 street cred i think 50 is max for both but defo is for sc with blunt melee focused build that i abandoned because arm swords are coollooking some guns are bit floaty but most have the right weight to them especially snipers you can walk around straight up one or twoshotting enemies not bosses but theyre still easy to beat all the challenge comes from realizing that matter how high your level is enemies can also one or twoshot you and they will its dumb
