Contenido: as many other people have pointed out there are lot of bugs at this stage of the game this is to be expected the game is really huge in scope and theres bound to be bugs in release software is never finished only released this is not huge issue for as im writing this review 2 days after release theyll iron out most of the bugs i encountered in my playthroughi didnt have any major performance issues while playing with ryzen 5 3600 and rtx 2060 super i had rtx enabled and the game looked dropdead gorgeous they definitely nailed the visual aspect of the game the city the characters and the overall atmoshpere looks amazing and its obvious they wanted the game to look as edgy as possible which is good thing for cyberpunk game they definitely nailed this part of the game i was not really able to experience much of the audio of the game because of my setup but the only concern i had with audio was due to bugs again something that will probably be fixed later onat first i did not really care about the characters and story maybe because i wasnt attentive but i also played the witcher 3 game by the same developers and game that i think had much more engaging story than this game this may be because they wanted this game to be more open ended as it was more on this later supposed to be an rpg and to be fair i did start liking the story after while although still not really stoked about it i only managed to get one ending as of writing this and ill be playing bit more to get the other ones as well i do have gripe with starting paths though they dont influence much of anything in the story its just there to say something different depending on your path it doesnt really add anythingup to this point everything ive talked about are minor flaws in my opinion bugs are to be expected and i did not purchase the game for its story but rather for the replayability and the customizability of the game ive been dreaming of different character builds and cool outfits and custom cars and random events id participate in and this is the main reason why i dont recommend anyone buy the game at its current stage none of the things i mentioned are in the game sure you can buy clothing and sure you can spec into skills and make different builds but it becomes painstakingly obvious that these are lacking lot there are not nearly as much customizability that we were lead to believe there were you cant even preview clothes when buying to see how they look on you you cant customize cars and given enough specs into strength you dont even need to buy most of the cars as you can just steal one from the streets almost none of the cool edgy things that were in the night city wire trailers actually accessible to you even though some of it is in the game i wanted my character to look like those mox guards and clearly as they are in the game the game assets are in the game but as there is way to modify your character once youve started the game in terms of appearance separate from clothing you got choicethis issue would have been kind of passable had there been good character customization screen so that you would be satisfied to continue with what you got but not even that is possible the character creation screen is lackluster it does not have nearly enough of the complexity of good character screen for example something like what the sims sliders body build modification none of that cool half skin half metal body parts you only have couple of piercings and some hairstyles how can any of these features be missing from an rpgwell the thing is cyberpunk 2077 is not an rpg at least the description box never mentions it is an rpg instead it says that it is an actionadventure story they slowly shifted from an rpg to an action adventure and removed lot of features in the meantime but this is most definitely not the fault of the developers the designers or people who worked on the game its got more to do with the people related to the business side of things they already delayed the game 3 times already to rush the game development to fit the deadline they had their developers crunch for the game for almost at least counting the delays they were probably crunching for whole lot more year most of the stuff that they showed in their trailers and gameplay demos are either gone misleading or downright untrue because they probably didnt have enough time to add into the game its easy to act as if youre progressive company and pander to audiences mistreating your employees and pushing out content unfinished just for money is just downright low maybe cdpr could learn from their game and not be like the corporations they depict but by that argument i guess that would make rockerboy for saying this stuff im not sure how to format the review so ill add any other miscellaneous problems into this paragraph please note that these are not gamebreaking by any means its just that these are minor inconveniences that bugged bit while playing ill make sure to get back to add more as i remember them stealth is not that fun you dont have chance with silenced weapons as you cant oneshot almost anyone while sneaking around without specing into lot of stats which is not worth the effort as you can just approach someone and do takedown which is very limited and gets boring very quick as there are 2 animations for takedowns and you cant takedown anyone with melee weapons which would have been really cool furthermore the doubletap dash mechanics screws your run up sometimes the vehicles are too responsive sometimes its as if theyve never ridden vehicle before its as if the vehicles were moving on ice or something the one hacking minigame is fun but it would have been nice to see some variety you can only create hex strings for so longtldr the game many bugs and missing features in its current state it lacks lot of promised features most probably because of crunch and trying to fit the release into deadline i am fan of cdpr and i do like the game or at least what they meant it to be but this sort of actions are not the way to go fix your game and treat your devs right
AspectosNegativos: ['Presencia de muchos bugs', 'Falta de customización y características prometidas', 'Desilusión con la falta de elementos edgy y de personalización', 'Cambios en el enfoque del juego de RPG a acción-aventura', 'Crunch de desarrolladores y presión por cumplir con fechas de lanzamiento']

Contenido: summarycyberpunk 2077 is game that can become whatever you want it to be with so many choices and playstyles those of you thinking this is futuristic gta might be disappointed but make mistake this game is just as big and diverse cyberpunk brings the rpg genre ahead once again with so many choices that can affect how people interact with you it creates sense of realism as if you are actually living in night city i feel with these types of games the main story isnt the only thing that defines game its also the side quests and atmosphere this game doesnt fail to disappoint with hours of content outside of the main story allowing you to lose yourself within the game and fade into the life of v not only that but the choices you make in these side missions can play part in the main story those stories can be emotional funny dark exciting and sometimes all of those things at once which only adds to the depth of cyberpunk and making you more invested in the charactershowever the game isnt perfect the number of bugs in the game currently takes you out of the immersion by making key choices seem like joke or hassle not to mention random gameplay issues that force you to reload saves just to fix quest objective then there is the poor optimisation for most older computers though what do people expect on outdated hardware due to cdpr being the developers i have doubt these things will be squashed out within the next few months making the game one of the most iconic and legendary games to come out of 2020 if not the decade prosconsgreat story with multiple optionsimpactful decisionsbeautiful and atmosphericamazing soundtracksgood voice actingnarrationunlimited replayabilitytedious at timeslots of bugsbad performance on lower end cardsunderutilized mechanics my experiencealthough i would say the game was overhyped for most people it still fell well within my expectations i do agree that the number of bugs should have been flushed out before release but with the game being as hyped as it was i dont think they could delay it any further without more backlash however by means is this bad game due to that fact although the bugs may take you out of the immersion from time to time the overall story and structure of the game is simply breathtakingyou are quickly thrown into one of three life paths giving you unique playthrough along with lengthy prologue to give you feel for the game and set the foundations for the overall story one of the best parts of the game is your relationship with johnny frequently gives you his input and acts as moral compass although his morals may not be right gives you another perspective on events that you would otherwise pass off as normal discussion this not only makes you question your own thinking process but also if johnny is being over the top or being realistic it gives added depth to what should be the simple choicesthe game really emphasis your decision making and your willingness to do side missions not only does it change the flow of the story but also changes how characters interact with you allowing level of immersion seen in few gameshowever the ncpd tasks are tedious at times with lot of them feeling like typical go here kill few people and retrieve the item to complete the objective if they didnt present an opportunity to give you cash and increase your street cred i really wouldnt have bothered with them as much as i didafter completing everything the game to offer and doing all the endings i can safely say that this is an rpg through and through all your choices matter even the ones you think wont im already planning on doing another play through but with heavily different choices to see how different character react and develop along with the story there is never dull moment in night city from the bizarre side missions amazing storyline to the wonderful and gorgeous visuals it sucks you in like other game in recent memory the photo mode is also fantastic allowing you take some breathtaking screenshotsimportant questionswould i recommend this game to friend yesshould i buy it for the full price yes unless you have an older computer though id still recommend getting it and giving it go you can always refund if it doesnt run well how long is the game if you do everything the game to offer its easily over 50 hours however just less than 20 hours if you only do the main storylinehow are the controlsthey are good and well thought out everything is simple to figure out and what you would expect from first person rpghow is combati hated the gunplay when i first started playing but as you level up your skills with these weapons they become far easier to use and become really fun plenty of options for what type of combat you want to do allowing you to enjoy multiple playstylesreplayabilityunlimited with different choices and different playstyles there are so many different outcomes to even the smallest of missionsmy final thoughtsif you are person that loves singleplayer storytelling and likes the freedom of choice you wont be disappointed cyberpunk 2077 throws you into one of the most beautiful cities in gaming with very few restrictions in what you can and cant do in night city offering hundreds of different choices on how to make your character what weapons you are going to use approach quests and fight enemies they all play role in how your story will unfold these choices can be good bad funny or emotional making you more and more attached to the characters within the worldits shame that the number of bugs in the game can kill or otherwise set bad tone for certain missions hopefully cdpr will sort these out soon allowing people to experience the game as it was meant to be playedhowever the amazing music and the masterfully crafted story make up for downsides and although you will want to experience the other endings that only justifies another playthrough with different style to see just how much your choice matters cyberpunk 2077 set an impressive standard for openworld rpgs that few games in the future will be able to beat it is truly remarkable game worth playing
AspectosPositivos: ['Great story with multiple options', 'Impactful decisions', 'Beautiful and atmospheric', 'Amazing soundtracks', 'Good voice acting', 'Narration', 'Unlimited replayability']
AspectosNegativos: ['Lots of bugs', 'Bad performance on lower end cards', 'Underutilized mechanics']

Contenido: so here it is cyberpunk 2077 is out after its announcement that is almost 8 years agobut is it worth it should you buy it i will give you brief summary on what i gathered in my first 11h of game experienceno spoilers will be included in this reviewgraphicsfor those asking im playing with 2070 super oc intel i79700k 45ghz 32gb ddr4 3000mhz on 1440p 144hz monitor without any problems on highest setting with raytracing off and some filters off film grain and motion blur the game runs at most times on perfect 80fps but drops down to 60 in some placeswhile sometimes the graphics feel sometimes bit blurry while driving in open world at day at night it looks fantastic if there is one thing cdpr did great it is the atmosphere of night city which really feels like dystopian future of its genre sometimes i even got blade runner vibes one thing i must say is though on how damn beautiful the faces are of characters that you must interact with or which you are allowd to interact i really loved staring into the face of jackie judy or other characters since they looks sooo realistic and pleasent to look at the wrinkles their facial expressions this is the magnus opum of face graphics and im not joking if just every npc would have it yes the faces of random npcs arent that good and it looks like only the ones you should and could interact with have been deliberately worked on to look that good which is understandable to be honest overall game looks great the city damn great atmosphere and the faces of only the main characters look fantastic turn raytracing off though since its probably to hard on your gpu if you dont have 3070 or highergameplayoh god here we goi really must say the game is buggy i didnt have anything gamebreaking yet but i had many buggs that made tragic scenes funny as hell and other things that were so absurd that it feels like im playing bethesda game cigarettes or cigars are floating in the face of characters or npcs while smoking themnpcs spawning or going through objects which shouldnt happenobjects as glasses and trash explodingcars getting stuck in objects or spawning in themobjects that are switched graphicaly to other objects like you equipped gun but have noodle box in your handi would have listed much more since it should be bug but those things i will mention now arent even bugs to begin with in my opinionpolice spawning right behind you after commiting crimecars dont react to obstacles and dont even evade themnpcs are crouching and many times not even running away when shooting at them or near themsorry but game like gta3 even somehow could do police chase in their cars while in cb 2077 they would not bother and just spawn behind you so you get killed as fast as possible im really pissed about those points mentioned above that are not bugs but just badly programmed npcs i cant even call that aione thing i really dont understand though are customability of your character cdpr promised sooo much out of it on how much you can change and stuff and im not talking about the penis though even i thought you can customize it more you cant change your hair after it since there is barber shop in that game like how come you can buy dildos while there is barber in this game are you guys nuts this is one of the most essential side things you want in an open world game it makes even less sense since there are barbers in witcher 3 so warning to those making their character it is final so choose wisely as you cant change many cosmetic features of you characterthe driving is uhhh horrible with cars and acceptable with bikes but somehow i must say that this is tradition in many games with many studios looking back at gta4 watch dogs and more i can look over itthe fight abilities are good sometimes it doesnt feel good tho play with particular gun sometimes it does i think its really subjective to the player to what and which gun feels great to shoot with and so onstory and sidequesteven though i have almost 11h i didnt come to play some sidequests i will update this review though after finishing this game which will take while the story to this point is interesting and gripping which is one of the reasons i still feel enjoyment in playing this gameconclusionthe game is in my opinion not ready they should have postponed it for atleast another year to fix many of those unnerving bugs adding more options and promised functions and adding an ai for the cars and police chasesoverall the world looks great the graphics are also nice and i still have fun to play itso should you buy it if you like the genre why not should you buy it nowabsoluetly notwhen should i buy it after some months best you check the state of the game after 2 months and think about itcan i recommend itnot in this state it is unfinished game which should have taken more timewhy do you still keep playing it and didnt return itwell i got it as present and i still enjoy its atmosphere and its story till now but that could changeseriously wait till some months have passed and more hotfixes and content is added that was promised from the beginning cdpr made to many ambitious statements while biting itself in the arse making this gamethe hype and the pressure to release the game as fast as possible after finishing the last witcher 3 installement blood and wine made the game to what it is now they should have followed their own statement with coming when its ready and should have withstanded the pressure of releasing it sure open world games are not easy to make and there will be always some funny bugs in it look at gta bethesda games and so on but there is sooo much missing and so many problems that shouldnt be in final product which makes kinda dissapointed coming from the so called best customer friendly developerbut as we know cdpr they surely will fix it but it will cost time so wait some months and check the state of the game then i will update this review after finishing this game which could take some time i will address future hotfixes and additions to the game and also tell you about the story till then see you
AspectosPositivos: ['Gráficos detallados y atmosféricos', 'Caras realistas de personajes principales', 'Historia interesante y envolvente']
AspectosNegativos: ['Bugs y problemas de rendimiento', 'Falta de personalización de personaje prometida', 'Conducción de vehículos deficiente', 'IA de NPCs mal programada', 'Lanzamiento prematuro con falta de pulido']

Contenido: after almost 80 hours and completing every side mission in the game i finally finished cyberpunk 2077 so far im not sure how i feel about the ending but i certainly have thoughts about the rest of the game while i wasnt as much into the hype as others i still preordered and got up in the middle of the night to play on launch dayi have never felt so ambivalent about game before its not 310 or 610 or 1010 because i can not possibly merge the things i loved and the things i hated into one score heres my random thoughts on the aspects that i liked and those i really didntthe goodnight city my god what beautiful vast varied place at times the lighting and colours reached level of perfection reminiscent of control sundown in the desert was damn near photorealistic at times and dont get started on the grimy gloomy perfection that is japantown and little chinastarting out i went into most gigs as stealthy hacker and got very frustrated with the unreliable detection system and how difficult it was to tell whether an enemy could be taken out safely with quickhack or not then i tried going in guns blazing instead and suddenly i was playing doom seriously the music the pacing jumping and sliding all over the place it felt pretty much like doom and i loved it played the rest of the game as complete badass with an assault rifle and the occasional quickhackthe narrative is solid disregarding the disappointing tease that is act 1 there is lot to love here as someone who primarily plays games for the story i was hooked fairly soon and found myself caring for many of the characters some of the main missions were absolutely breathtaking heh and i enjoyed all the long conversations great deal as they were very well written the endings are bit of mixed bag though and i can not possibly see how any dlc could pick up where they left offthe music the soundtrack is awesome especially the doomesque combat music but what i absolutely fell in love with was the samurai tracks by refused will be listening to never fade away chippin in and black dog for many months to comejohnny ill eat every last bullet in the city for you if thats what its going to take sniffthe badthe original story line and premise were probably scrapped at some point in development to be replaced by what we have now bits of it can still be found in the life paths and the entire act 1 leaving decidedly bitter taste of what could have been while i like the narrative that we did get i felt that act 1 promised very different game and it should have been several hours longer at the very least developing that friendship with jackie should never have been relegated to an action montage the game tells you briefly why v cares about jackie but it never tells you why you the player should and so it all falls flatcustomisation there is none why do i sink hours upon hours into open world rpgs because i can customise my character to t on my adventures appearance equipment weapons mountsvehicles perks i was so certain there would be barbers and tattoo parlors in this game i didnt even bother looking it up in reality there is nothing visual customisation at all and the stat customisation is utterly boring you can replace your eyeballs but you cant cut your hair there is vehicle customisation whatsoever visible weapon customisation either and i fail to see where 5 limb damage mods is compelling personalisation of your equipment there are many perks but the vast majority of them is as boring and uninspired as the weaponclothing mods there was plenty of misleading marketing but this for was the worst fashion is everything in night city off there isnt even single decent hat in the entire townthere is roleplaying dialogue options are very basic and decisions far and few between v is not going to change based on your actions or at all really romance options are limited to say the least to avoid spoilers ill simply say that after getting together theres nothing more going to happen until the very end oh you can move in with your love interest that is an icon will appear on your map designating their place as one of your apartments safe house but there is absolutely point unless cdpr seriously expects to drive across town to make stupid faces in my boyfriends mirrorthe npcs and ai this been discussed in many places so i wont go into too much detail whenever danger breaks out npcs crouch down into generic position that looks like placeholder sometimes they panic because i sprint the police system is complete joke they dont give when i go on rampage trying to drive my bloody car but for some reason get real touchy when i look at them while passing byafter many years of modding skyrim i thought i was resistant enough to not be annoyed by any bugs i might encounter boy was i wrong the glitches visual and otherwise just happen constantly taking crap on immersion at every turn quests get stuck and require you to reload an earlier save during one long main mission 5 second audio loop from an earlier cutscene got stuck for about ten minutes playing over relevant dialogue since the mission kept going i couldnt savereload to fix it either so it ruined the whole thing at least the game didnt crash on yaythe performance ranges from decent to utterly atrocious i realise that my processor is getting somewhat outdated i5 7600k 42ghz and was certainly bottlenecking my gpu rtx 3080 bought specifically for cyberpunk playing at 1440p with many of the settings turned down and crowd density set to medium my frame rate would still drop below 20 in the downtown area which is bad joke outside the city it sat at comfortable 7080fps but as soon as i got closer to the city centre the game turned into sluggish unresponsive messthe conclusioni enjoyed the game great deal i am also severely disappointed cyberpunk 2077 is rough unpolished experience that clearly needed more time in the oven whats there is for the most part very good but constantly overshadowed by what could have beenoverall i just can not recommend the game in its current state
AspectosPositivos: ['Ambientación visual detallada y variada', 'Música y banda sonora', 'Narrativa sólida en general']
AspectosNegativos: ['Falta de personalización visual y de estadísticas', 'Desarrollo de la trama inicial insatisfactorio', 'Problemas de rendimiento y bugs constantes', 'IA y comportamiento de NPCs decepcionantes']

Contenido: good morning night citynight city 2077 you play as v mercenary that wants to be legend in night city and for this to happen youll need to steal the relic biochip invented by arasaka one of the most influential megacorporations in the whole world now that ive just scratched the surface of the plot i can begin with this review city of dreamscyberpunk 2077 the most beautiful city that ive ever seen in video game and at first sight the most vivid city in game history but only at first sight when walking through night city you can see all npcs going on with their lives working shopping or just walking around but of course like in any game it is just an illusion to make the city feel alive however they failed trying to build up this illusion mainly when there is major interaction with the npcs just oneline dialog that repeats over and over again just like in the witcher 3 but here in cyberpunk hits different another thing that killed that illusion for personally was the crowd ai oh boy that ai is terrible when you look back at gta v and older games even and compare its ai with cyberpunk well there is comparison cyberpunk 2077 ai in general are awful and totally immersion breaker and for sure they were big dreamerscontinuing on with the world itself cdpr managed to handcraft beautiful and immersive openworld full of details that you can get lost in its beauty although there isnt lot to do in it in my point of view night city as i said is the most beautiful but at the same time the most empty city that ive seen in the past years because there is absolutely nothing to do in this huge city besides walking and doing some repetitive activities that pop up around the map yet there are random events like weve seen in red dead redemption 2 for example nor extracurricular activities as we see in many other games hell even in gta san andreas 2004 we could go to the gym barbershops casinos even take taxi so on another one of its downsides is the lack of character customization after the character creation for game where style is everything this is huge problem im pretty sure that cdpr planned lot of those activities but to meet the deadlines theyve had to cut it out of the final game now we just need to wait and see if theyre going to implement some of those things in the gameback in 2019 cdpr stated that cyberpunk would have wanted system and corrupt police well at least we got wanted system but not as you expected the police system is just awful literally there is car chase or proper ai for the police they just spawn behind you whatever the place you are at i remember gta 3 from 2001 having better police ai than cyberpunk and thats ridiculousthis is rpg after allat the end of the day cyberpunk 2077 tries to be an rpg but is it really when they first announced the lifepaths i got really excited and even more when i read that every lifepath choice would affect the world around you and that was big fat lie first of all lifepaths just change the game introduction and some minor dialog options and thats it major changes at all about the general choices yes lot of the choices that you made in the main quests or even side quests can have an impact on your ending or at least some important dialogs throughout the story when it comes to rpgs one of the most important things is the skill tree here in cyberpunk we have huge skill tree and it works quite similar to the skyrim skill tree you can upgrade your character to be melee specialist heavy weapon specialist or combine everything in one and be an overpowered one tap machinethe gameplay itself is pretty average nothing spectacular but not bad either we can carry 3 main weapons and toss variety of grenades there are the implants that we can only buy new ones or change the currently equipped on ripper docs the implants that you acquire on ripper docs can play huge role in your gameplay as you can upgrade your max health and carry weight etcthe hidden gem not so hiddenthe best part of the game so far is the main story and the main side quests if i can put it that way cdpr did great job telling the story in way that you dont feel overwhelmed or tired and gets even better when you get to know the characters and their stories you can connect really easily with the characters and thats huge point for in this huge game industry lately theres been lack of good characters that you feel for and cyberpunk 2077 makes you care about the characters even more than you shouldthe soundtrack is impressive even if many of the songs didnt suit my style they did awesome work creating the soundtrack unfortunately the main quests are too short compared to witcher 3 about 20 hours if you rush throughout the game i finished the main plot in 50 hours however half of my playtime was doing side missions and exploring the map ive had so much fun doing side missions and some ofem are i dare say better than some of the main storyrelated quests the not so good the bad and the uglynonetheless the bugs as everyone might know by now cyberpunk 2077 is full of bugs i can make book with five thousand pages about the bugs in my playthrough i didnt encounter any gamebreaking bug thank god but theres lot of glitches for example cars flying around npcs appearing from nowhere and lot of clipping glitches more than usual etc the most annoying bugs are questrelated ones even though i didnt encounter any gamebreaking bugs there are still some glitches that ruined my immersion and i hope that theyll fix those very soonconclusionim really divided about this game in one hand there are the great main storyside quests and the great characters but on the other hand theres lot of bugs glitches and main issues that make this impressive world well less impressive ill recommend cyberpunk 2077 more because of its great story characters and fun gameplay however we should treat this review as mixed one but steam doesnt allow us to do so im looking forward to seeing if cdpr will pull off hello games and make cyberpunk more enjoyable game
AspectosPositivos: ['Historia principal y misiones secundarias', 'Personajes bien desarrollados', 'Jugabilidad divertida']
AspectosNegativos: ['Bugs y glitches', 'Falta de interacción con NPCs', 'Ciudad vacía en términos de actividades']

Contenido: confused mess with structureim not going to talk about the bugs or performance of this game those are things that can get patched out but there are some clear foundation issues with this game that dont really begin to rear their ugly head until youre good 40 hours into the experience story issuesthe story loses its steam the moment you put it under scrutiny after act 2 starts v as character drive in the game whatsoever to move the story along at her own pace she choice in most of the missions youll be doing whether main or side story quests lot of the characters will simply boss v around to do their bidding and even if she seems outright disgusted with their requests shell always end conversation agreeing to do whatever it is they want her to do the story bite either for the few action sequences that exist in the game none of them are all that exciting the end of act 1 is likely going to be the most exciting moments the game to offer and everything following after is poor mess of vaguely apolitical filler that barely scratches the surface of why corporations are bad in this game you spend 90 of this game blasting homeless people and gangs in night city and it almost feels like you run around as beat cop with the amount of ncpd related gigs and sidemissions you accumulate throughout your playtime this game tries so hard not to send message that you only have nebulous feeling of how awful things are only if you spend your time reading the shards it spends lot of time telling you what to think and barely any time showing you the ramifications of mass corporate exploitation one good example of this is what happened to all of the animals in night city there is reason for it but its buried under so much bloat that one would only assume it was because they didnt have enough time to program dogs into their game overall the story is nothing interesting i didnt come away from it feeling any attachment to the characters as you spend so little time actually getting to know them outside of blasting your way through their problems repeatedly until they feel some vague sense of connection to you for pulling their asses out of the fire so many times rpg elements and the lack of choiceperks weapons and cyberware in this game have such weak effect on how you play this game that they might as well not have given you the option to make choices whatsoever despite there being such broad range of tools to use great many of them feel useless most of the perks are marginal percentage increases over your stats and genuinely never provide enough direction for the player to approach problem beyond just shooting their way through everything with their given choice of weapon some of the stealth options are especially strange because they buff your attack and crit change out of stealth with melee weapons but if youre in stealth behind an enemy you can simple grab them and snap their necks for an instant kill it makes almost little to sense in why you would choose to invest in less reliable form of stealth killing when they give you the best option at the beginning of the game lot of things feel as if they were added as an afterthought to this game weapon elements have bearing on how you play this game whatsoever because enemies have binary health bar that youll burn through with your weapon of choice if you even remotely invested in its respective skill tree enemy variety exacerbates this issue as none of them really counter you if you happen to bring weapon of the wrong type into the fight i dont even begin to know where to unpack lot of my frustration with these systems as they all end up feeling so shallow and worthless in the end it would have been better for the health of the game not to add them whatsoever nonexistent qolwhy is it that i have to hunt and search across all of night city to find shops that carry loot appropriate to my level why can i not change my character after customization stat respec you can respec perks why is earning eddies such chore this is short list of problems that make the game frustrating to play at very basic level and it only gets worse once you start reaching the upper end of max levels in this game heres the really big one quests iconic weaponsarmor and quest rewards do not scale with the player whatsoever you will reach point in the game where everything on the map is very low in challenge for you and there will be reason to do it if youre completionist this feels awful because the challenge of the game is invalidated even if youre playing on the highest difficulty it feels lame to pick up johnnys iconic gun near the end of the story only for it to be worse than revolver i picked up 5 hours ago because the quest rewards dont scale also upgrading doesnt work here the upgrade economy in this game is not well thought out whatsoever and youll end up completing the game before it ever becomes relevant in meaningful way just craft 50 armadillo mods and slot them into every piece of armor you get and youll never have to worry about anything posing challenge to you in this game again final thoughts2077 is rusted and broken down car welded together poorly and slathered in coat of paint more expensive than its shell the longer it runs and the more the paint starts to strip away the more the issues of the game start to rear their ugly head this game its moments sure its not all awful but its not innovative for as beautiful as night city can be it feels like you have little to impact in the world there are so many little things that bother about this game the lack of romance options the poor driving mechanics poor quest rewards and everything listed above it leaves feeling resounding eh for this game it was never going to live up to the hype people had for it but it didnt even deliver solid middling experience in the end shallow lakes worth of content and rather pathetic sendoff for game that had so much potential
AspectosNegativos: ['Estructura confusa', 'Problemas de base en la historia', 'Poca conexión con los personajes', 'Débiles efectos de las elecciones y elementos de RPG', 'Frustraciones con la falta de calidad de vida en el juego', 'Problemas con la escalabilidad de desafíos y recompensas de misiones']

Contenido: if youre looking for decent rpg id advise you to search somewhere elsemy pc isnt exactly up to snuff so i wont comment too much on the technical aspects but ill talk bit about the gameplay and world itselfthe world and lore of cyberpunk itself is pretty interesting and the story at least for is also very solid your interactions with this world however are pretty shallow npcs walk through the streets on scripted path like zombies only to eventually despawn and be replaced by another npc cars do the same and will despawn after you move away from them bit neither cars nor npcs have ai so they dont actually respond to what the character does unless scripted to for example if you park your car in the middle of the street cars will just pile up until the obstruction is removed they wont go around it if you so much as bump into police officer they will turn hostile accidentally brush an npc too hard they all flee in terror punch the air npcs will duck and beg you to spare their livesspeaking of the police system it isnt passable for game released in 2020 especially after 8 years of development once you are wanted police will spawn few yards behind you infinitely until you move out of the area alternatively you can duck and hide briefly and theyll go away you can hack someone with sword police come hide for couple minutes and then hear them say oh im sure they wont do it againthe world itself features very little interactivity too npcs only say one or two things if you try to talk to them most of the doors are locked in the world initially i thought that meant i could eventually unlock them but it simply means they are inaccessible if you help police take care of criminal they wont realize the criminal is gone and will still speak as if or she is there this could be bug not sure i once saw man pounding on vending machine because it ate his money i hacked the machine and made it dispense many cans the man continued to beg on the machine not responding to the myriad of cans on the floorcompare this to the kid chasing the rat in fallout new vegas if you kill the rat the kid will thank you and begin eating it small details like this makes the world feel alive unfortunately for cyberpunk everything feels for show and if you look even somewhat closely it all falls apartit falls completely flat as an rpg your decisions will rarely have consequences and the ones that do only have very short term effects dialogue options are poor giving your normally only 1 real option and 12 or 3 side options to get more exposition every couple of hours or so the game may give you speech check but this only yields more information and doesnt have real impact on the story you also can not fail checks and get hostile or comical response the option is just greyed out if you do not meet the requirements you cant flesh our your characters personality its all pretty much premade for youcybernetics one of the core parts of the game have marginal impact on the story the enemies and characters you will encounter will get pretty neat implants but most will not be available to you outside of the ones on your arms cybernetics do not change your character cosmetically and most improvements are superficial for example ive noticed many implants just give additional carrying capacity or increase armor there is also not cutscene for installing said implants though there is 1 cutscene when you get the very first one in story mission and that is it you install cybernetics the same way you buy cup ramen and it seems so anticlimactic given how cool the first scene iscrafting is pretty much pointless and the upgrades are marginal you are better off finding new gun or looting one off an enemy in this regard the game often feels like looter shooter but not very good one searching for items and looting in general both suck the combat itself is decent but enemies become bullet sponges very quickly unless you constantly upgrade your gear on the other hand they will also kill you very quickly if you do not upgrade your armor on the topic of combat the ai is so basic in this regard you can pretty much cheese through any encounter and enemies are only ever real threats if they are seriously overleveled in comparison to you though even in this situation you might still be able to cheese the ai by stunlocking it or hiding behind cover during mini boss encounter i took cover behind crate instead of chasing out the enemy just looked at as i shot it in the head dozens of times not moving once until it had diedside quests in general are pretty uninteresting there were some good ones but overall most of them feel like filler content used to get money and gear for the main quest the main quest tends to give more than enough money and gear anyways so doing side quests doesnt seem all that necessary and when most of them are pretty uninteresting i doubt lot of players including myself will go out of their way to finish them that said there were some real gems but most were go here touch or kill objective get reward there is also radiant quest system akin to skyrim or fallout 4 where quests will generate randomly these include hostage situations assaults you can intervene in shootings stuff along this line for these scaled very poorly to my equipment enemies would take dozens of headshots and lose fraction of their health but would kill in one hit at the same time the main campaign seemed more appropriate in difficult for my progression it was odd and frustrating overall the story is decent and the combat can be fun at times though the ai is pitifully easy to manipulate and not going at using tactics as an rpg the game falls completely flat and feels more like hallway shooter than an open world adventure the setting is mostly cosmetic backdrop and while good lore was written for it they do little maximize on this in game
AspectosNegativos: ['Interacciones superficiales con NPCs y entorno', 'Sistema policial poco realista', 'Poca interactividad en el mundo', 'Decisiones con pocas consecuencias a largo plazo', 'Poca variedad y profundidad en las opciones de diálogo', 'Poca relevancia de las ciberntéticas en la historia', 'Crafting y mejoras marginales', 'Combate con enemigos esponja de balas', 'IA básica en combate', 'Misiones secundarias poco interesantes']

Contenido: as an avid soulsborne player i really tried and gave this game my all i wanted to like it so badly but i cant bring myself to even complete second playthrough this review will contain spoilers so i advise skipping this review unless you have thoroughly completed the gamefirstly id like to start off with the great things this game doesbetter melee variety i love how there are different viable attacks when fighting with melee weapons ashes of war while some are quite busted is great mechanic to shake up monotonous melee combat i love that charged strong attacks and jumping attacks are not only viable but some of the strongest attacks you can do i love how shields can be altered and tweaked to match your build wonderfully and how useful they feel when performing guard breaksworld design aesthetics this game while being soulslike does an amazing job at separating itself from the look of the other souls games the highfantasy themes really show through in this games most beautiful areas even enemies and bosses themselves look amazing this game easily the best visuals aesthetics and design out of all of fromsoftwares current titlesexploration sense of scale level design this game feels massive with so many different things you can do and so many enemies to fight the legacy dungeons are all so fun to explore and make for some of the most classic soulsborne gameplaynow on to the cons i have with the gameboss enemy design truly the most upsetting thing about this game for the simplest way to sum up this issue is that it feels as if your character in elden ring is from dark souls 1 and the enemies are ported from dark souls 3 i really have issues with bosses having neverending combos of attacks granted that i have the equal and opposite ability to properly react and evade the combat in elden ring often feels challenging in the wrong way bosses more often than not have combos that never seem to end and also an apparent fetish for aoe moves i also find the bosses enjoy falling into loop of repeating moves time and time again spamming the same moves until your corpse is butchered to pulp my character ended the game with 60 vitality and it still felt like i never had enough hp armour seems to have little to purpose as i have to invest in endurance and sacrifice one trinket slot to have dollar tree version of havels ring in order to wear armour that feels stronger than paper mache the amount of repeated bosses in this game is really disheartening after exploring catacomb 59 and finding the misbegotten warrior and another trash mob in an arena the sense to explore is fleeting feeling it is tragic and feels horribly lazy and undercooked other fight drives this point home better than the godskin duo if youve been playing the game to the highest extent then youve fought these enemies multiple times caelid tower the witches village volcano manor etc already youve seen these bosses far too many times to count however the creme creme is awaiting you at the crumbling faram azura where you have to fight them for one last hurrah both at the same time this is an essential fight you need to do to beat the game i really implore anyone that avidly enjoys this game what was the purpose of putting this fight there i find myself asking this question far often than i should when i encounter reused boss in an area that didnt need bossit seems that major strategy of elden ring is to avoid engaging with the boss most if not every challenging boss follows this same logic fighting radhan just hit him couple times stage one then spam the summons second stage and never attack him directly fighting melania just stunlock her and use mimic tear to take aggro off you so when she uses her 1000 hit combo the fight just doesnt abruptly end the list goes on with people listing just use bleed bloody slash use magic use x ash of war and spam it until theyre dead use the rotten stray and proc scarlet rot insert exploit here none of these are proper solutions did you feel sense of accomplishment when you bloody slashed the 27th boss to death did you feel satisfied when your mimic tear summon soloed the boss did you have fun watching scarlet rot tick down that boss youve been struggling to beat you shouldnt have to respec to fight certain bosses every fight should have viable solutions and sense that every playstyle chance to win whether that chance be low or high it should always feel possible and it shouldnt feel like the odds are so stacked against you that you have to make do and essentially exploit the game to continue onthis entire game comes to climax inside the erd tree in easily the most disappointing final boss in all of souls i still remember the first time i fought gwyn gherman and the soul of cinder each of these games built up their final fights so immensely well it was challenge i was overjoyed with walking through the fog gate into gwyns boss room is feeling i will never feel again the dread knowing that everything that ive accomplished come to this final moment and when i win i can finally fulfil the prophecy foretold to i felt nothing when i got to the elden beast i felt sense of accomplishment joy fear happiness just nothing it felt like nothing had led up to that point there was buildup emotion struggle sense of accomplishment just gauntlet of two mediocre bosses back to backi really tried to enjoy this game i really did but the boss design in this game really brings it down many pegs for and kills all replayability this game ever could have if you enjoyed this game im happy for you but i just want to voice my feelings for others that may have felt the same way if you didnt like the game thats ok if you did im happy you enjoyed it and could see past the things i took issue withoverall as soulslike this game simply does not do it for and maybe others may share my feelings as well
AspectosPositivos: ['Melee variety', 'World design aesthetics', 'Exploration sense of scale level design']
AspectosNegativos: ['Boss enemy design', 'Repetitive bosses', 'Final boss disappointment']

Contenido: im so excited to be pointing the finger at this sport on steam everyone on the console feels really bad and the pc version worked very well for i was amazed at this game and spent more than 150 hours experience city story character building and enjoying branching choices and opportunitiesthe good1 the story and quests the story is beautifully crafted believable and wonderfully cyberpunk be it in the main story or the side quests all of the dialogue is polished and thoroughly enjoyable the game 3 different starts nomad street kid corporat 4 different genderspecific romance options and 2 additional ones each and every one coming with beautifully crafted and believable story and 5 different endings to explore that shouldnt be rushed and explored over multiple playthroughs im going to go out on limb and say do the bill jablonsky quest you will not be disappointed2 the overall city life experience i felt that the city is believable and it was so much fun stumbling upon all kinds of events all over the districts sometimes the janky driving can actually deprive you from finding some real cool art loot character lines etc that the developers have so lovingly and cleverly put in the game while i would agree that there are things missing wasting money in casinos slots etc there are such locations in the game i personally never cared about these activities3 the combat the first person experience is amazing it is difficult enough to keep you occupied but also not too punishing especially as you start learning how to use your chosen builds strengths properly as i have tested it myself from start to finish over these 320 hours every build is viable and works from full on get in their faces to picking enemies from distance with snipers and hacks it is all very enjoyable admittedly some weaponperk combinations work better than others but as this is an rpg it to cater to multiple playstyles and playthroughs and i can tell you it does4 weapons this deserves separate point as there are useless weapons in the game and cater to every possible option player might desire close combat to long distance sniping every weapon can be accommodated in build and specific playstyle get in their face with bats katanas mantis blades or guerilla arms get in close range with shotguns pistols the monowire be true soldier behind cover utilizing submachine guns or assault rifles or just go the sneaky long range sniper route and combine them with silenced weapons to take out enemies from stealth the variety is great and the additional weapon variations power for richochets tech for wall penetration and charging for more damage and smart for brain aiming while negating enemys armor work well towards creating the character that you want5 the music damn if it isnt damn near perfect it thoroughly deserves the double damn in this sentence which became triple damn and in the brackets quadruple damn and with this damn quintuple i listen to some of the tracks almost every day because they are so amazing some are good for pumping up some are chill but they will satisfy fans of almost every genre from techno and pop to throatbursting metal and of course you can choose which radio station to play based on your moodall those 4 points are more than enough to create good open world game to explore and feel sufficiently engaged for many many hoursthe bad1 bugs lets just get this out of the way and be done with it even as of v112 there are multiple issues that at least on pc thankfully dont take that much out of the experience2 missed opportunities the building blocks for multiple random activities are present but not implemented pretty much like in live service game ergo we may or may not see it there is the opportunity for gambling casinos pachinko playing various minigames and various others but they are simply not implemented its clear that the devs thought of adding it but it was pushed back in the development cycle in favor of more important things3 the driving janky at best and you may be stuck in traffic way too often while the devs really tried to add realism by having heavy traffic between 6 and 9 and 16 and 19 sometimes it clogs up the engine and creates way too many roadblocks including cars stuck in one place for reason while you can roleplay and say that that guys car just broke down if you are in quest that requires driving or chasing enemies that is way too irritating most of the time the best vehicle you can use is motorcycle to avoid said problems4 the police system it is clearly rudimentary pushed back in the development process and not properly implemented simply teleporting police officers in your vicinity including in closed rooms nope bad development work on this one just nope5 the 3 different starts nomad street kid and corpo could have had more impact than just 1 measly side quest at certain point of the game i really hoped for more quests based on it and not just random lines in dialogue that sometimes amount to nothing based on dialogue alone corpo is the best starting option as that life path really allows you to deal with multiple problemsconclusioni had and still am having blast with this game over 150 hours in i always want to double or triple my cash investment in game hours and in cyberpunk 2077 i can see myself dumping over 600 hours exploring testing various character builds and even more with the free dlcs that are coming i can only hope the game will get better and better from now on once again i am very sorry for my friends on console but i have pc i bought the game on pc and i need to judge it as i experienced it on pc which started from 710 on patch 106 and is now sitting on very solid 910 since patch 111 i am positive that with the right additions and dlcs cdpr will get this game into 1010 status
AspectosPositivos: ['Historia y misiones', 'Experiencia de vida en la ciudad', 'Combate', 'Variedad de armas', 'Música']
AspectosNegativos: ['Bugs', 'Oportunidades perdidas', 'Problemas con la conducción', 'Sistema policial', 'Falta de impacto en las diferentes opciones de inicio']

Contenido: the long awaited game elden ring is collaborative work between the makers of dark souls and george rr martin rest assured that im not some pleb that couldnt beat the first boss and got mad at 88 hours in ive beaten the final boss with the hidden endingfirst off i cant recommend this to people who dont know what theyre getting into if you havent played souls game before this is going to kick your teeth in and the hyped up fanboys will get mad when you ask to see dentist the game is notably difficult but not in clever way that tests your skill throughout the game enemies will frequently have unavoidable instant kill attacks they spam in an area of effect or they randomize the time in their attack patterns so muscle memory plays against you depending on where the spawnpoint is you will likely have significant backtracking to do before getting instant killed on entering the boss room until you get lucky and they change their attack patternsthis feels less like narrative element of the game and more like transparent way of padding their games length and distract you from how otherwise empty the world isthe best part of the game is the design of the creatures sheep roll around birds have swords on their legs and the first major boss is this amalgamated mass of arms and dragons head and overall they nailed it for the visual design of creatures that being said it quickly becomes evident that they copy paste those creatures in different areas with the soldiers and shambling undead being the main offenders for repetition even in areas where that doesnt make senseim unsure what george rr martins influence was exactly for the game whether it was some character names or the whole background lore but none of it is very good writing spoiler alert for every quest every quest i did ends with the npc dying horribly either by your hands or by you stumbling on their corpse when you go to hand in the requested item i have feeling this was george rr martins contribution to the game before the final boss only 2 characters were left alive in the hub area with the subtext that they were on track to burn to death if i finished the game as far as the writing of the game is the game starts off by telling you that in order to be the elden lord you need to stand under the elden ring which was shattered among several demigods except you dont i beat the game with only 4 of the main shards out of seven and i could have done it with less that vast majority of characters are variations of mumbling depressed edgelord or whisper talking wimpas an open world game youll stumble on quests though there werent really any memorable beyond fetch this or deliver this to x the main problem with the quests though is that without any sort of quest log the game will tell you deliver this item to x and then character in question will have moved somewhere else on the map this is especially frustrating as the game gives you tips on how to find or accomplish these quests and opening wiki to check for clarification is required for even the most basic of tasks the most damning of which requires you to hop back and forth between early and late game sections go through unmarked hidden walls and have picked up an item off the ground somewhere else to progress in one area seemingly unrelated to the quest you were on the open world aspect is fine for stumbling on things every now and then but the enemy placement and loss of xp on death means that its also discouraged via having you hopping around save points once you pick play style youre pretty much locked into it with the option to respec your stats coming near the end game and the cost of leveling up becoming more expensive as you play items in the game are not balanced in their distribution ninety percent of the time when you loot something itll be crafting component but almost none of the items are worth crafting weapons and armor all have stat requirements for use but in general there is significantly more strength based weaponry and armor doesnt really matter since most enemies will kill you in two hits meaning its more of preference to how much overkill the enemies deal or how you look as opposed to any sort of any noticeable difference mechanically unless its too heavy at which point you dodge worsethe game coop but its limited to boss areas or the immediate areas in front of them these also require consumable objects and only provide progress to the player requesting help you wouldnt play this with friend unless you had already beaten it and they wanted their hand held not as play together sort of game pvp is present but you can only attack someone if they opt into it and usually they have the coop help option turned on so itll be 3 v 1 in an area of the defenders choosing even if you win the reward is pretty worthless so its unclear why youd do itto be completely honest this game reminds lot of an mmo where one else is online its hard to exactly describe what i mean by this but i think its because of how almost nonexistent the presence npcs the world is for huge chunks the visual design of the world the presence of emotes and message writing and just general grind to level up there are some visually pleasant vistas to look at but the world feels empty aside from the random enemies meandering around the majority of the games lore is done through item descriptions but it feels more like yeah all this happened off screen over there and you just missed it as opposed to being world with things happening around youtldr the game is frustrating the bosses feel unfair the quests make sense and you are left checking the wiki for even the basic idea of what to do and the long play time comes from grinding to beat the game as opposed to actual enjoyment
AspectosPositivos: ['Diseño visual de las criaturas']
AspectosNegativos: ['Dificultad de los jefes', 'Repetitividad de enemigos y misiones', 'Escritura de las misiones', 'Falta de claridad en las misiones', 'Sistema de juego desequilibrado']

Contenido: i will preface this review by saying that i have just altf4ed out of the game in rage at quest that i am clearly not ready to do and despite the spew of negativity that you are about to read there is something about this game that is fun there is some intangible aspect to this game that i am having fun with however i am beyond comfortable saying that this game was not ready for market and is not worth 60 in its current statei can honestly say this is an unfinished game ill preface this with few things firstly is an admission that im terrible at shooters so when i say the shooting is stiff and unrewarding take it with grain of salt the next three are all reviews number 54100 would i recommend anyone buy this game i wouldnt and finally am i enjoying myself barelyokay so lets begin for anyone actually reading this chief complaint and honestly what sunk the entire experience for the hell nightmare cluster trench foot bastard that is the driving i cant express the level of unfun and genuine repeller from the game the driving here is im playing on mouse and keyboard and ive often in my long 6 hours with this game expressed that the driving is akin to piloting an elephant on ice skates matter how little of how much i use the or d key the rear of my car swings out like drift and starts my car fishtailing away as i try desperately to maintain control the driving here is some of the worst ive ever experienced the cars also wont auto path to objectives if placed on the route to them ironically making this driving technology regression from the witchers horses in 2015 by the same developernext is the bizarre and frustrating fact that your character customization options quite literally end at the creation screen the second that you press done on your creation window you are locked into stone there are nail salons barbershops tattoo parlors and none of the body mods that were promised the game throws you out into the world as permanent and unchanging entity further the tattoo options are limited to 5 or 6 presets for the face and body each if you like some of tattoo set but not all then tough luck you take it all or none and can never change it later hair color is bizarre as well as far as i can tell there is option to have brown hair color only amber or black yet vs beard can be set to normal brown meaning that the color pallet exists in the gameas said in my opener the shooting feels stiff and the aiming feels wrong couple this with the fact that despite going all in on body build and attempting to lower difficulty to normal when hitting brick walls the melee combat seems to be wholly unviable enemies at equal or higher level simply maul v if you fight in any way other than slow covertocover peak and shoot style the perks that v can take on level up are also lame they dont have any cool or noticeable impact on the way that combat flows or plays they just make simple and minor number changes and fail to add any fun or diversity to the combatspotty voice acting seems to plague missions even main story ones on the very first mission where youre sent to steal car you meet the cars owner and the voice acting sounds like child doing voice over for covid science project there are numerous other times that ive been jarred out of cutscene by awful voice acting but that one stuck out to the most of allpast here are spoilers for what limited story ive played be ye warned man could the writing surrounding the death of jackie have been any worse seriously what joke that was despite cdpr spoiling this moment for themselves in the 1st mission playthrough that they released back in early 2020 lets look at all the mash level corny self spoiling that happens leading up to this1 before you go into the afterlife to meet dex jackie says that always feels like hes lying to his mom when says everything is okay and that always feels deeper in the more you do 2 right after entering the afterlife yes the sound you just heard was in fact cdpr hitting you over the head with the analogy and not just the wind jackie orders the drink of one of their legends and v can ask how you get drink named after you the answer die in an epic way and literally right after this jackie the bartender write down his drink recipe so they can name drink after him3 on the way to the hotel for the heist v can remind jackie to keep his head in the game to which jackie will reply that worked his whole life to get out of this city and after this say it with 70s cop show fans one last job hes never going back to broke4 when you enter the hotel jackie will walk up to the bar entrance turn to v and say that after this one more time everyone one last job hed like to come back to this nice hotel with his money and his retirement and have fun with misty his girl back homethis kind of stuff is everywhere the twists so far have been telegraphed the writing been either painfully convoluted or painfully obvious the entirety of what is happening to with johnny feels jarring unearned and warped my play through by making feel entirely disconnected from the story i am post chapter two acutely aware of the fact that im playing video game and unlike in games like saints row and gta that is not good thing for cyberpunkas said to begin this game is not done it should not have been released and you should not buy it for at least 6 months to year post this review being written i trust cdpr i loved the witcher 3 and place is as my favorite game of all time its why i went out on limb and broke personal rule to never get games on release given time cdpr will patch this game to point that it is worth the price tag and probably release dlc to truly make night city place worth being explored until that time however keep the 60
