Contenido: i really enjoyed this game im fan of froms games so while i was confident theyd make an good game i was worried that the move to an open world format would diminish some of their other strengths i think instead they were able to show new strengths creating an open world that will be new standard by which to compare others going forwardthe gameplay is much like other from games though i did appreciate the effort they made to make it more varied and even in their own way make it more accessible through additional gameplay options between the many new options in this game like spirit summons and the resurrect ability in sekiro you can tell from been looking at ways of giving players alternative methods to overcome the difficulties in their games in smart ways that dont compromise their design and arent bland difficulty slider that changes the game globally pvp seems to have improved featurewise however the times i have played it i found it to suffer from lot of lag its hard to tell if this is caused by players or the game but its extremely common and makes pvp less enjoyable than it could bei found the bosses to be overall easier than in previous games with some notable exceptions where it seemed from was almost making point to show they can still make hard as hell boss fight when neededthe world design makes incredible use of scale and the areas have good amount of variety both in terms of types of environment but also in terms of the enemies within and the content density the first few areas are packed with places to explore and things to find while some of the latter areas are bit more sprawling and sparse i didnt care for some as much as others like the blinding snowfield but with so much thats bound to be the case the enemy variety is worth noting too someone recently counted them up and found that elden ring had more enemy types than breath of the wild ac valhalla ghost of tsushima and horizon forbidden west combinedthe emphasis on open world does mean bit of step down in terms of the small scale level design many of the past games dark souls 1 in particular is renowned for its incredible interlocking vertical layered approach to the world elden ring does have bit of this in spurts in areas the community taken to calling legacy dungeons but not quite to the same extent the graphics are huge step up in quality for from basically look at any screenshot of the landscape and it would probably make an amazing wallpaper from always had good artistic eye for presenting the player with interesting focal scenes and having an open world just allowed them to do that all the more characters designs are largely the same as past games passable but not their strong suit particularly with the faces and as ever the character creator is very difficult to work with perhaps even the hardest boss in the gamethe ui is very much from software ui there are some quality of life improvements like sorting and some better presentation of information but it is what it isthe armor is very cool but for all the variety i kept hoping there would be more maybe its case where theres just never enough but knowing how big of deal fashion is i keep hoping theyll lean into it more the armor alteration system is interesting but it almost feels like it wasnt fully fleshed out as in most cases with some notable exceptions its just about removing the cloak in the future at the least it would be nice to see color palette changes as an additional optionas far as the lore of the world goes this is probably the best realization of froms style of presenting lore in the abstract but discernable through the world and items you find and the lore of this world is very interesting to learn about as you go through the gamequests are bit of mixed bag i enjoyed the content of the quests such as there is im not opposed to froms typical minimalist quest design from tends to not treat quests as traditional rpg quests but more as fleeting ephemeral experiences with characters and things you do in the world may or may not advance your relationship with them much like life i get that however there is also good argument to be made that its still game at the very least if youre going this route with system where the conditions for advancement are not transparent then you need those quests to be reliable flexible and bug free and i feel like in the games current state this is lackingmany times there are quests that behave in unexpected ways or only via exceedingly strict conditions for instance i had one quest that would not advance until i had rested at one specific site of grace other site of grace would do and this one was not obviously associated with the events i had another case where bug preventing character from speaking with that had spending time trying to figure out what i was missing fortunately this was fixed in patch 104i kind of wonder if lot of the nonmainline quest content was added at the very end of development and thats the cause of these issues i get that feeling because even as of the most recent patch new stages to quest chains are still being added which is pretty unusual unfortunately combined with the previous issues this also leads to problems there is one new quest line with new character announced in the patch notes that i am unable to even begin because of nonquest related action that i took before they were added to the game in short im open to the way from designs quests but i think they fell short of what they were going forultimately these complaints dont detract from the overall experience which is still pretty amazing i highly recommend this game and look forward to future dlc
AspectosPositivos: ['Nuevo enfoque en mundo abierto', 'Variedad de opciones de juego', 'Diseño del mundo y escala', 'Cantidad de enemigos y contenido', 'Mejora en gráficos']
AspectosNegativos: ['Problemas de lag en el modo PvP', 'Algunas misiones con condiciones poco claras', 'Posible falta de profundidad en sistema de armaduras']

Contenido: shovelware imitation of game that never actually existed this is not the game which was shown to influencers and later posted on youtube as gameplay reveal that game was purely fake demo created solely for hype this game is an incredibly bad attempt to imitate that game made in short amount of time by small team of inexperienced devs many of the best devs at cdpr already having quit before getting chance to work on any game other than the witcher 3 which was obviously not made by the same people who made this garbagefire of productthis isnt transformers this is transmorphers which is to say loweffort secondrate knockoff rushed out to cash in on hype for something else which in this case was fake demo for game which didnt actually exist most disappointing game in history this is literally the most disappointing game i have ever bought and i wasnt even expecting it to be good as you can see from this group i created before release i thought that this would be mediocre aaa game that wouldnt even measure up to far cry and i was still incredibly disappointedhttpssteamcommunitycomgroupsfarcry2077btw if you bought the game hoping for adult content you are really going to be disappointed in my time in the game the closest i came to love scene was being able to see these fullyclothed middleaged housewives dancing in the window of locked building i couldnt even enterhttpssteamcommunitycomsharedfilesfiledetailsid2328824055a terrible indie game this doesnt even measure up to the worst of what you would expect in aaa game this is basically terrible indie game that isnt even as good as number of indie games like betrayer and dead effect which i literally purchased for less than 1i actually made list of good indie games most of them dirt cheap and cyberpunk wouldnt make the list even if cdpr were plucky indie dev because it would be an insult to compare anything that is actually good to this loweffort abominationhttpssteamcommunitycomgroupsdecentindiegameswhy is it bad at this point i am going to cut to video which does an exceptionally good job of explaining why you will probably have more fun installing the game than playing ithttpswwwyoutubecomwatchv_cymqhdnykgfeatureyoutubeshort version its not bad because it bugs the bugs are bad because they are distracting people from how bad the game underneath those bugs actually isi have played openworld games since morrowind and gta 3 and this is the most barren lifeless world i have ever encountered cramped spaceship full of zombies like in dead effect feels more interesting than city of drab minimalist buildings that you cant enter and are thus effectively just an ugly map painting while procedurally generated npcs literally pop into view with ai so bad that they actually make the city feel less alive to be frank you shouldnt have traffic in game in which you cant be bothered to give the cars the ability to change lanes or back up you shouldnt put npcs that move into your game if they just walk back and forth aimlessly with terrible animations in way which emphasizes the fact that they are not people or indeed even smart enough to survive as earthwormsyou should not put wanted system in your game if your police ai is literally too stupid to follow the player something that better games managed on the ps2 and you can not work around that by making the police magically appear behind the player and shoot him in the back of the head while at the same time every door and elevator in the city stops working to prevent the player from taking cover insidequests this was obviously not made by the same people who made the witcher 3 many of those people joined to work on this game found that cdpr wasnt actually making it made the witcher 3 instead and then quit in disgust at how badly cdprs game development was being managedthe quests in this game arent good enough for modern mmo much less singleplayer rpg that isnt hyperbole the last quest i did in the elder scrolls online mistress of the lake was more openended allowing the player to choose side leading to one of two very different followup quests more interesting and felt more meaningful than anything i encountered in my more than 12 hours with cdpr 2076in cdpr 2076 the game starts out with dialogue and choices so pointless that i found that not only did my choices not make real difference they literally didnt even affect what people said to in some cases the only good memory i have from this game is being able to pet an ugly cat in an alley and the game took even that away from by making that cat disappear after the boring mission was overhttpssteamcommunitycomsharedfilesfiledetailsid2326389621 why are you posting review after only 12 hours in the gameif cdpr didnt finish the game why should i i have finished plenty of other games including multiple entries in borderlands final fantasy saints row far cry mass effect all but the most recent expansions in swtor etc i did not finish mass effect andromeda and that game is far better than this onethis game is so bad that i can spend literally hundreds of hours in other games but cant force myself to endure more than 12 hours of this blatant ripoffif you are thinking of buying this game try morrowind with the latest mods it actually looks and sounds better than cdpr 2076 or any one of the other literally hundreds of readily available games that are better than this one this isnt even the best rpg on gog in fact having this game on gog is an insult to most of the other games that are sold theretheres only one good thing to do with this gamehttpssteamcommunitycomsharedfilesfiledetailsid2353251355

Contenido: 4 febrero i was not seated in the glorious hypetrain the cdpr had put on the rails instead i chose to wait until it improved before giving it try to avoid disappointment from bugs and complaints at the beginning of 2023 i started playing the game with low expectations and to my surprise i freakin loved itnever fade awayi think the theme and worldbuilding of the game are its strongest points the game does an excellent job of presenting night city as city full of disasters where even the smallest mistake could end with your dead body in landfill and nobody gives the various affiliations such as the evil corporations that control the world with technology healthcare and even military services the street kids and their gangs like valentinos with their chicano culture the voodoo boys with their technological version of haitian voodoo or 6th street who wants to see nusa great again nomads like aldaceldos who reject the shiny walls scrappers and the dreams that the city to offer instead cling to their family valuesthe game convincingly showcases the consequences of these affiliations in every aspect of the world whether it be economic political or spiritual its clear that the developers did their homework on the cyberpunk universe and brought it to life in remarkable way much like the witcher seriesa like supremei somehow managed to avoid major spoilers for year and i was very pleased with the main story v and johnnys struggle with their identities blend of fight club and matrix is in fine line between multiple personality disorder schizophrenia and depersonalization it is fascinating to see v die and be reborn as new person both literally and figuratively to the realities of night city and work through their issues with johnny who is completely different persona legend of the past the balance between side jobs world events and main jobs arent as smooth as i expected it to be despite playing the game without taking long break i had trouble with connecting with some of the characters or understanding their motivations for certain actions it is most likely designed around the main story and main side jobs which are included in endingsthree specific side jobs stood out to and showed the games potential the sinnerman questline with stephenson former criminal who turns to religion and is exploited by the evil corp for crucifixion instead of death sentence is an incredibly engaging and provided emotional tension throughout the quest the second is rivers questline about an ordinary nypd officer whose nephew is kidnapped by man who brainwashes lost teenagers into becoming cyberpunk versions of what you would call humanbroodstock lastly theres peralezs questline about an honest politician who is unknowingly controlled by corporations due to injected false memories and how they become paranoid and lose everything over time these three side quests share one big commonality theyre grounded in reality and have relatable approach even though the technology and the instruments of the are different overall i like the main story and i feel like they did not use all the potential they had in many aspects of the game the majority of the side jobs feel uninspired but there are hints of what could have been better im hopeful for improvement with the upcoming dlcs and sequelchippin inthe gameplay is intriguing with the possibility to test out different builds and optimize your cyberwave to handle everything the city throws at youfor example you can use sandavista like martinez in the anime and turn into glorious katanawielding solo merc be knifethrowing or pistoleer assassin that prefers quiet stealthy approach like thief as takemura calls it or you can go full netrunner basically cyberpunk variant of mage and perish everyone by just hacking them over their own security cameras unfortunately it gets stale repetitive quickly and you realize that the many builds out there to discover is mere illusion even though it can be enhanced to some point by mods just like the plot i see great potential in the combat and build systems but it is definitely not implemented in complete wayside activities such as nypd announcements and gigs turn into mindless repetitive activities after short time despite my efforts uncover their story through the messages and objectives given by the fixers they just turned into various chores to get 100 completionits been over year since its release but there are still persistent bugs that sometimes require loading previous quick save the bugs didnt ruin my gameplay but it forces the player to take frequent quick saves to prevent any gameplay errorsthe general consensus that the game being unfinished is mostly applies to the gameplay and i agree on that it is enjoyable but definitely not polished enougharchangelin conclusion cyberpunk 2077 is game that the potential to be classic in the gaming world but it falls short due to its incomplete gameplay repetitive side activities lingering bugs and its take on the side stories despite these issues the game is still enjoyable and worth playing especially for those who are fans of openworld games or interested in the futuristic theme yet again i believe that the gameplay in the witcher series was not outstanding either but it was the unique theme setting and compelling stories that turned it into legendary piece i hope to see similar emphasis on storytelling in cyberpunk which would make it even more captivatingthe narrative character development and worldbuilding are highlights of the game and it was fun journey that i spent hours and hours on i definitely recommend it
AspectosPositivos: ['Worldbuilding', 'Narrative', 'Character development']
AspectosNegativos: ['Repetitive side activities', 'Lingering bugs', 'Incomplete gameplay']

Contenido: cyberpunk 2077cybermeme 2077what can there be said about the disaster of release that was cdprs hotly anticipated follow up to one of the best games of the last generation the witcher 3 wild hunt that hasnt already been said and then regurgitated ad infinium on various sites and message boards the internet over i initially had joke review in the review section for this game which i am replacing with this one because at the time of posting that review cyberpunk 2077 had become one giant meme not place i would have expected one of the most hotly anticipated and most talked about games in generations to land i know cdpr been tolling away hard at work trying to deliver on the game they promised but the reality is that cyberpunk 2077 destroyed lot of trust and goodwill the company had built up over the years with its followers and fellow gamers and i for one will forever look at them with the eyes of sceptic lot of cyberpunk 2077s problems stem from its core cyberpunk 2077 is technically not much of an rpg at all which is disappointing given the table top source material but more of an action fps with light rpg elements many of its interconnected systems either fail to make an impression or simply dont work point in case i couldnt use single replenishable item in my inventory for my entire playthrough which begged the question why was i even bothering collecting all that shtat least on the pc it ran pretty well and while not quite as cutting edge as many believed it would look in the graphics department if taken as whole it could look impressive at times i did find the main story line gripping and most of the side quests were pretty enjoyable to complete when i had convinced myself i was playing an action fps and not an rpg at all i did feel like the end of the game was incredibly rushed as this was where i acutely felt that the team had simply run out of time and couldnt deliver on the ending they had originally planned especially after the boilerplate missions that ratchet up the tension before entering into the final mission the end felt almost anticlimatic because it was over in such jiffy the final boss felt like joke given that we had been built up to fear him and ended up being complete pushoverat the time of play i did initially find all the various graphical glitches quite hilarious but in the end it did start to subtract from my experience i cant speak for the game now october 2021 as it would require replay but hopefully most of those have been sorted out by now whoever decided that crouch and skip scene should be mapped to the same button really didnt play test the game properly because they would have immediately seen how annoying this is when you accidentally press the b button on the controller thinking you are gon na stand up and then end up skipping cut scene the traffic system and ai police npc enemy needed some serious attention hopefully that also been addressed now also cyberpunk 2077 open world didnt quite revolutionise the genre in the same way the witcher 3 wild hunt had done prior that was disappointingif you temper your expectations cyberpunk 2077 can be an awesome thrill and there are genuine moments where you can see the brilliant game waiting to be unearthed lying underneath its mess of systems and visual bugs and glitches the sad thing is with probably another two years development cdpr would have had the classic game everyone and his dog thought they were delivering because the puzzle pieces are all there they just needed to be joined correctly i do believe it could have been that genre defining game that all other games aspire to be like had it been given more time in development so it was sad to see how it got kicked out the door in such poor state most people would have been fine with further delays well at least the adults among us who i like to think outweigh the emotionally stunted death threat script kiddies living in moms basement because we have jobs families other hobbies that also keep us busy we dont have time to tweet sht i get that there are investors and that they want results and they want to see their investment materialise but the 8 million preorders should have been enough of sign that demand was incredibly high for this title sure some might have cancelled their preorders off another possible longer delay but excellent reviews across all platforms would have driven them all back one to ask was this all really worth it as miyamoto put it rushed game is forever bad delayed one is eventually good those should be words you live by in this industry in the end while i thoroughly enjoyed my time with cyberpunk 2077 the fact of the matter is given the hype and the marketing campaign i fully well expected cyberpunk 2077 to come in as my favourite game of 2021 but sadly that not been the case in fact come year end it might not feature in my top 10 games played for 2021 at all i cant help feeling pang of disappointment about this especially given that the witcher 3 wild hunt ended at 1 back in 2015one word or phrase to sum up the experiencefrustratingly disappointing because there is great game in there waiting to emergeperformancebug related incidentsi am sure most of the visual glitches have been sorted now but at one point they were so bad they were subtracting from the experience i never had any quest bug out but lot of the rpg systems put into the game simply didnt work or were half bakedsimilar to gamesthe witcher 3 wild hunt deus ex human revolution watch_dogs legionrating Contenido: after hearing all the fuss about skyrim for many years and seeing it rereleased countless times i decided to give this game try and i regret to say that i was absolutely underwhelmed by it ill try to articulate the reasons as clearly as possible spoilers belowif i had to describe the game in single phrase it would be wide as an ocean deep as puddle right from the beginning the game lot going on you have storyline about the civil war in skyrim and another one about dragons coming back to the world plus many more subplots theres gigantic world to explore with an inordinate amount of dungeons and just as many quests and more than dozen skills with their associated skilltree but most of these elements are spread very thinquests the approach they took here is quantity over quality by light year you cant go two meters without getting quest from somebody but the overwhelming majority are glorified and sometimes not even that fetch quests you either have to collect specific item certain number of common items clear dungeon or kill certain enemy then get the reward thats the long and the short of it credit where credit is due some quests are bit more interesting and have more work put into it like the daedric quests but they are very small minority and end up drowned into the endless barrage of inane babys first quest the game keeps throwing at youthe dungeons are different you get them in three flavors cave ancient tomb or castle with couple of dwarventhemed ones which would be fine if there werent over hundred dungeons so seeing the exact same palette gets really old after while although the designers decided to go the extra mile in some cases and throw couple of trees or bushes in the cave maps so theres that i also would like to mention that im willing to believe bethesda was contractually obligated to put puzzles in the game or something like that because the puzzles are the bare minimum thing that could still be legally considered puzzle usually with the solution right above them because god forbid players have to think for couple secondsmain storyline the first sequencetutorial failed completely to make feel invested in the story and the but thou must feeling was the only thing that carried forward from storytelling perspective my character had little to incentive to go to whiterun after escaping the dragon attack to draw comparison with similar games fallout 3 starts with your father disappearing and you having to track him fallout new vegas starts with you being robbed and almost killed the dragonborn such personal stake on moving the plot forward it gradually starts to appear as the story progresses but its insufficient the characterization is anemic as well further contributed by the classic bethesda move we have 300 npcs but 6 voice actors so half the city sounds the same i dont expect an individual voice actor for every minor npc but it was so blatant it bordered on immersionbreakingcivil war storyline this one showed promise at first it was presented as significant element in the story at the beginning but ends up being completely optional barebones thread not much characterization is provided to either side besides the empire is trying to annex skyrim as part of its territory and the stormcloaks want skyrim to stay independent i dont know how it is for the stormcloaks but after joining the empire i completed dungeon and after whiteruns defense it devolved into series of attack this castlekill this group of soldiers until storming windhelm and killing ulfric and that was the end of it other than passing comments from random npcs there wasnt much acknowledgement of the situation and in classic bethesda move general tullius mentions we should root out the stormcloak camps after the last battle but the game forgot to mark the captains of each camp as nonessential and they were unkillable subplots mage college thieves guild etc while these are some more fleshedout questlines they are slowburn but somewhat serviceable at best the companions and the dark brotherhood to the plot being out there mages college or acceptable but then making you grind like crazy in order to complete the last chapter thieves guild along with dawnguard the characters are at least bit more defined and theres some focus on different facets of gameplay or new aspects ie vampire and werewolf formsskills and gameplay there are several skills several combat related along with an interesting crafting system while the combat system plausibly seems to offer several approaches one of the main problems of the crafting system when it comes to leveling up is that there are means to increase the acquisition of raw materials but the experience requirements for each level get progressively steeper making it increasingly grindy and an absolute chore on the last levels and even then theres not incentive on behalf of the game to focus on crafting as you have several shopkeepers whose products scale with level and its pretty easy to get gold incidentally the main bottleneck here is usually the shopkeepers gold supplyall in all the ideas presented are nice but the execution on several key aspects particularly storytelling really hamstrings the enjoyment im willing to give it bit of pass as it may not have aged particularly well but if i hadnt been for achievement hunting id probably rushed the main quest after while and wrapped it up much sooner as it stands i dont think ill ever touch this game again
AspectosNegativos: ['Misiones repetitivas y poco interesantes', 'Dungeons con poca variedad', 'Puzzles simples y poco desafiantes', 'Historia poco envolvente y falta de caracterización de personajes', 'Problemas de inmersión con la repetición de voces de NPC', 'Sistema de crafting tedioso y poco gratificante']
